Policy: Ministerial Decree No.698 of 1996 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of carrying out state ecological expertise.
Policy_Content: Premier decrees to validate the Regulation. The present Regulation establishes the modalities of carrying out state ecological expertise carried out by the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and its territorial bodies. Specific objects, determined by the articles 11 and 12 of the Federal Law “On ecological expertise” are subject to state ecological expertise. The Ministry and its territorial bodies set up expert commissions. The obligatory condition for the acceptance of the materials for state ecological expertise is the presence of the data regarding environmental impact of the projected activity and ecological substantiation of the admissibility of its realization. The beginning of the carrying out state ecological expertise must be set not later than 30 days after the reception of the document confirming its payment. Expert commission must determine compliance of the projected activity with requirements establishes by the normative federal and regional legal acts as regards environmental protection, the completeness of the exposure of the scale of the prognosticated environmental impact as a result of carrying out the projected activity and ecological substantiation of its realization, and su8fficiency of the envisaged arrangements for ensuring environmental safety and conservation of environmental potential. The document consists of 2 Secs. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards organization and carrying out state ecological expertise.

Policy: Loi nº 96-48 modifiant et complétant la loi nº 95-21 du 13 février 1995, relative aux immeubles domaniaux agricoles.
Policy_Content: Cette loi modifie les articles 16 et 27 de la loi nº 95-21 portant régime relatif aux immeubles domaniaux agricoles. On entend par immeubles domaniaux agricoles les terres dont l'Etat est propriétaire et qui sont destinées à la production agricole, celles pouvant servir de support à cette production ou celles qui ont été classées comme telles, ainsi que les bâtiments qui s'y trouvent. L'article 16 (nouveau texte) prévoit que ces terres soient exploitées en usufruit soit par les unités coopératives de production agricole, conformément aux conditions prévues par la loi nº 84-28 et par celles edictées par la présente loi aux articles de 16-2 à 16-7, soit par les techniciens sortant d'établissements de formation agricole et les jeunes agriculteurs qui en sont locataires. Le nouveau texte de l'article 27, auquel s'ajoute un article 27 bis, fixe les sanctions prévues pour tout preneur d'un immeuble domanial agricole ou tout titulaire d'usufruit qui le loue en totalité ou en partie.

Policy: Agreement No. 1 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Nizhni Novgorod Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Nizhni Novgorod Region have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation shall: include the Nizhni Novgorod Region in the Program of stabilization and development of agro industrial production in the Russian Federation; contribute to the participation of all branches of agro industrial complex of the Nizhni Novgorod Region in carrying out common Russian centralised programs (systems) in the field of pedigree cattle-breeding, plant selection, prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous pests, vermin and plant and animal disease, carrying out scientific research in the field of veterinary, livestock raising, agriculture, introduction of scientific and technical innovative arrangements, protection of environment and the utilization of natural resources at the average level established for the regions of Non-Black Earth Zone; include the Nizhni Novgorod Region into common system of allotment of high productive seeds of agricultural plants, pedigree livestock, plant protection means, mineral fertilizers, the national and imported preparations and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, issuing authorization for their manufacturing and trade; finance, within the limits envisaged by federal budget, federal special programs, scientific research, projecting and construction and technological arrangements of federal importance, running costs and development of material and technical and scientific basis of research and educational institutions situated in the Nizhni Novgorod Region financed form federal budget; finance and credit the formation of state stock of foodstuffs and raw materials for federal needs within the limits envisaged by federal budget for such purposes; concede lease and other types of credits for financing of agro industrial complex, including the reserves, delivery of machinery and equipment for the formation of production and material and technical basis. 2) The administration of the Nizhni Novgorod Region shall: provide for development of agro industrial complex under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions in order to increase profitability of agro industrial complex, improvement of production and economic relations and productive forces, development of various forms of property and economic activity; develop the system of procurement and trade of agricultural commodities and raw materials, carry out the reform of consumer cooperation; render assistance in the development of enterprises and organizations of agro industrial complex, agricultural educational and scientific institutions situated on the territory of the Nizhni Novgorod Region and financed from federal budget; ensure purposeful and efficient utilization of funds allotted from federal budget.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ley Nº 26620 - Ley de control y vigilancia de las actividades marítimas, fluviales y lacustres.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 8 artículos y 2 disposiciones transitorias, regula los aspectos de control y vigilancia a cargo de la autoridad marítima, respecto de las actividades que se desarrollan en los ámbitos marítimo, fluvial y lacustre del territorio nacional (art. 1º). Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 711 on mortgage of the plots of land and land rights.
Policy_Content: The Ministerial Decree regulates mortgage of the plots of land and traditional land rights related to land based credits. Plots of land in private ownership, land rights and shares of a plot of land in joint ownership or in joint land tenure can be mortgaged. The following land categories shall not be mortgaged: (a) common land; (b) defence land; (c) protected areas; (d) public land allotted for temporary land tenure to the officials. Physical and non-governmental legal persons owning plots of land or exercising land rights thereto can be depositors. The state land tenants can mortgage exclusively the plots on land on which edifices and constructions, that shall be mortgaged, are situated. Legal and physical persons can be mortgagees. The Ministerial Decree contains the form of mortgage contract.

Policy: Maritime Zones (Establishment) Decree, 1996 (N.P.R.C. Decree No. 11 of 1996).
Policy_Content: In order to give effect to the provisions of the Law of the Sea Convention this Decree defines the territorial sea, contiguous zone, exclusive economic zone and the continental shelf of Sierra Leone, defines the rights of Sierra Leone in respect of those maritime areas and regulates access to and use of by (nationals of) other States of those maritime areas. Further the Decree grants regulation making powers of the Secretary of State for giving effect to provisions of the Decree and particular for the protection and preservation of rare or fragile ecosystems within the marine and the prevention, reduction of sea pollution. The territorial sea of Sierra Leone is that area extending beyond the land territory and internal waters to the belt of sea adjacent thereto, the breadth of which is twelve nautical miles measured from the baseline, being the low-water line along the coast of Sierra Leone as marked on large-scale official charts. The waters on the landward side of the baseline of the territorial sea form part of the internal waters of Sierra Leone. The contiguous zone of Sierra Leone is that area contiguous to the territorial sea and extending up to twenty-four nautical miles from the baseline from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured. The exclusive economic zone of Sierra Leone comprises the area of the sea, seabed and subsoil that is beyond and adjacent to the territorial sea of Sierra Leone, the outer limit of which is a line seaward, every point of which is at a distance of two hundred nautical miles from the nearest point of the baseline from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured. The area of the exclusive economic zone forms part of the fisheries waters of Sierra Leone.

Policy: Loi portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: L’Etat exerce sur l’ensemble du territoire de la République de Côte d’Ivoire, sa mer territoriale, sa zone économique exclusive et son plateau continental des droits souverains aux fins des opérations pétrolières. Nul ne peut entreprendre des opérations, même le propriétaire de la surface, s’il n’y a pas été préalablement autorisé conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi. L’Etat peut entreprendre directement des opérations pétrolières, soit en les réalisant lui-même, soit en les faisant réaliser pour son compte par des personnes morales ivoiriennes de droit public. L’Etat peut également autoriser des personnes morales de nationalité ivoirienne ou de nationalité étrangère à réaliser des opérations pétrolières en exécution d’un contrat pétrolier conclu par ces personnes avec l’Etat, conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi. S’il y a lieu, l’Etat peut également accorder des autorisations de reconnaissance d’hydrocarbures dont les fins sont uniquement d’information technique.

Policy: Protection of Water Against Agricultural Nitrate Pollution Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996  (S.R. No. 217 of 1996).
Policy_Content: Regulations relative to measures relating to the prevention, reduction and elimination of pollution of water. For the purpose of the designation and revision of designations of nitrate vulnerable zones, the Department of the Environment shall monitor at least every 4 years the nitrate concentration in freshwaters over a period of 1 year: (i) at surface water sampling stations laid down in article 5(4) of Directive 75/440/EEC or at other sampling stations which are representative of surface waters, or at both, at least monthly and more frequently during flood periods; and (ii) at sampling stations which are representative of groundwater aquifers, at regular intervals and taking into account the provisions of Directive 80/778/EEC. the Department shall furthermore review every 4 years the eutrophic state of fresh surface waters, estuarial and coastal waters. Where the nitrate concentration in all previous samples taken in pursuance of the Directive at any sampling station has been below 25 mg/1 and no new factor likely to increase the nitrate content has appeared, the requirements of monitoring of nitrate concentrations shall have effect in relation to that sampling station as if the reference to 1997 and the reference to 4 years were references to 2001 and 8 years respectively. Monitoring under this regulation shall be carried out using the reference methods of measurement set out in Schedule 2.

Policy: Law No. 851-XIII on environmental audit and environmental impact assessment.
Policy_Content: This Law determines targets, tasks and principles of environmental audit, environmental impact assessment, and also the basic rules for organization and application thereof. The Act consists of ten Sections: (1) general provisions; (2) documentation on environmental impact assessment (EIA); (3) documentation of environmental audit; (4) elaboration of environmental impact assessment (EIA) scheme; (5) publication and discussion of documentation on environmental audit; (6) participation of non-governmental entities in environmental impact assessment (EIA); (7) state documentation on environmental audit; (8) expert opinion on environmental audit; (9) transboundary effects and environmental audit; and (10) list of objects and activities requiring obligatorily environmental impact assessment (EIA). The state environmental audit shall be carried out by the authorized state central environmental institution. The basic principles of environmental audit shall be: (a) assumption of potential environmental hazards by any projected activity envisaging the use of natural resources; (b) compulsory environmental audit before decision-making on realization of a project; (c) complex environmental impact assessment (EIA); (d) scientific substantiation, objectivity and legality of the conclusions of environmental audit; and (e) transparency and consideration of public opinion. State environmental audit shall be mandatory for: (a) strategies and concepts of socio-economic development of the Republic of Moldova, some of its areas, districts, municipalities, cities and villages; and (b) schemes of placement and arrangement of landfills for industrial, domestic and agricultural wastes and residues of toxic substances, construction or arrangement of plants for their processing, treatment or destruction. State environmental audit of planning and project documentation shall be performed prior to the final review of the documentation as a whole. The time of the performance of state environmental audit of the documentation related to complex and potentially hazardous facilities and types of economic activities, including those requiring additional special scientific research, may be extended by the central environmental authority, but not more than three months.

Policy: Agreement No. 11 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region recognize that all state functions, liability, plenary powers and competence regarding the development of agro-industrial complex on the territory of the Rostov Region are delimited on 3 levels: exclusively federal, joint (carried out jointly) and exclusively regional functions, including liability, plenary powers and competence. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation in carrying out on the territory of the Rostov Region exclusively federal functions, including liability, competence and plenary powers: shall take into account the interests of the Rostov Region in the process of elaboration, introduction and financing of federal programs, large scale arrangements for the development of agro-industrial complex aimed at state support of the producers of agricultural commodities, improvement of land relations, social development of rural area, development of agricultural machinery manufacturing, increase of soil fertility, production of hemp and its processing, prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, provision with the national and imported preparations, and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, issuing of authorization for their local manufacturing, formation of the system of marketing and infrastructure of the market of agro-industrial complex; shall finance on account of federal budget veterinary and sanitary recycling factories; shall render assistance in the provision with seeds of highest reproduction elite species selected by scientific selection institutions, pedigree livestock from pedigree breeding centres of the Russian Federation and from abroad; shall render assistance in the provision of the regional enterprises of food and processing industries with raw materials, main and auxiliary components and combustibles and energetic resources, as well as hot-house vegetable growing enterprises; shall consider it necessary the participation of state executive bodies of the Rostov region in carrying out exclusively federal functions, including liability and plenary powers, on the territory of the Rostov Region regarding the development of agro-industrial complex of the Russian Federation carried out by the ministries, departments and organizations. 3) The administration of the Rostov Territory in carrying out of exclusively regional functions, including liability, plenary powers and decisions regarding sphere of competence and municipal property as regards the development of agro-industrial complex: shall provide for stable development and increase of the efficiency of agro industrial complex under conditions of market economy at the expense of improvement of production and economic relations and productive forces, development of various forms of property and economic activity, rational use of land and other available resources; shall form regional food reserves; shall provide for delivery of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs of the coordinated amount to federal stock of foodstuffs at fixed purchase prices for local producers of agricultural commodities; shall render assistance to the organizations under the jurisdiction of the Rostov Region situated on the territory of the Rostov Region.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement No. 1 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region will interact in all the main issues regarding the development of agro industrial complex. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation: shall elaborate proposals regarding the main directions of the agrarian policy and structural reorganization of agro industrial complex; shall improve State Standards, branch standards, technical requirements and other technical and normative documentation in the sphere of agro industrial production; shall carry out the program of state support of the producers of agricultural commodities of all types of property; shall carry out in the Sakhalin Region federal program “Improvement of soil fertility in Russia” financing it annually, within the limits envisaged by federal budget for the nationwide Program; shall allot and deliver annually to the Sakhalin Region seeds of the original selections of perennial herbs and vegetables; shall include the Sakhalin Region in the common Pan-Russian centralized program for the provision with pedigree cattle, poultry, eggs of good laying hens and meat producing breeds, prevention of and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, carrying out scientific research in the field of veterinary, feeding and breeding of agricultural animals; shall provide agro industrial enterprises of the Sakhalin Region with the national and imported preparations and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification. 3) The administration of the Sakhalin Region: shall provide for stable development of agro industrial complex and the increase of the manufacturing of agricultural commodities under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions for more efficient functioning of agro industrial complex on the basis of development of various forms of property and economic activity; shall set up annually regional stocks of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs, provide for their financing, including advance payment of 50% on account of the budget of the Sakhalin Region and extra-budgetary funds; shall protect the interests of the region in carrying out purchase of agricultural commodities and foodstuffs for federal and regional stocks of foodstuffs at fixed purchase and contractual prices; shall provide for rational use of finances and special funds allotted from federal budget; shall support the producers of agricultural commodities of all types of property on account of budgetary funds and other sources for break-even economic activity and fixation of accessible retail prices for agricultural commodities; shall take part in the formation of federal and regional stock of foodstuffs.

Policy: Agreement No. 5 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of ownership, use and management of land on the territory of the Rostov Region.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1) Land within the boundaries of the Rostov Region can be classified as federal property, regional property, municipal property, private ownership and other forms of ownership in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation and the legislation of the Rostov Region. 2) State control over the protection and use of the plots of land pertaining to the property of the Russian Federation (federal land) is carried out jointly by Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey of the Russian Federation and by Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey of the Rostov Region and by other institutions authorized to carry out control over the use and protection of land in accordance with the modalities established by the legislation currently in force. 3) The Government of the Russian Federation is entitled to: a) to establish and change the purpose of federal land in agreement with the administration of the Rostov Region and local administration; b) upon fulfilment of the federal need to transfer on contractual basis or sell federal land to the possession of the Rostov Region (in case the initial allotment of the plots of land has been carried out on repayable basis); c) to transfer the plots of land in terms of open-ended (permanent) tenure for the accommodation of the objectives of federal importance; d) to carry out different plenary powers of the Russian Federation as owner of federal land. 4) Management of the plots of land pertaining to the property of the Rostov Region is carried out by the administration of the Rostov Region. The Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey of the Rostov Region shall carry out the administration of the aforesaid land.

Management of the plots of land pertaining to the property of the Sakhalin Region is carried out by the administration of the Sakhalin Region. Policy: Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Sakhalin Region regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Sakhalin Region.
Policy_Content: Authorised representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Sakhalin Region have agreed on the following: 1) The State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Sakhalin Region jointly are authorized to: a) regulate issues of the development of agro-industrial complex of the Sakhalin Region, development and improvement of soil fertility; b) regulate issues of prospecting and rational use of mineral sources of raw materials, aquatic biodiversity and other natural resources on the territory of the Sakhalin Region, including those of the continental shelf and 200-mile economic zone of the Russian Federation in accordance with federal legislation; c) regulate issues of reproduction and rational use of mineral sources of raw materials, prospecting and exploitation of recreational resources; d) regulate issues regarding prevention of disasters and liquidation of their consequences; e) certify and license some types of activity on the territory of the Sakhalin Region. 2) The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation and its State Bodies: a) elaboration with the participation of the State Bodies of the Sakhalin Region of normative legal acts pertaining to joint jurisdiction in accordance with the provisions of the present Treaty; b) elaboration and validation jointly with the State Bodies of the Sakhalin Region of federal special programs regarding liquidation of the consequences of disasters and all-round development of the region, including development of agro-industrial complex. 3) The state bodies of the Sakhalin Region, for the purpose of implementation of the present Treaty, must establish, in accordance with federal legislation, conditions of licensing for use of natural resources and other types of activity on the territory of the Sakhalin Region, take part in the realization of federal programs of development of mineral sources of raw materials, structural re-organization of economy and development of agro industrial complex. Delimitation of natural resources on the territory of the Sakhalin Region, including aquatic biodiversity within continental shelf and 200-mile economic zone of the Russian Federation between federal and regional property must be carried out on the basis of separate agreements.

Policy: Agreement No.5 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of external economic ties.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region have agreed as follows: 1). The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Sakhalin Region shall have joint authority as regards the following issues: co-ordination of international activity and external trade, including export, for the purpose of maximum realization of export potential of the Sakhalin Region; forming and carrying out regional and inter-regional programs of economic ties and external trade of the Sakhalin Region; receipt of foreign credits guaranteed by the budget of the Sakhalin Region, their use and repayment; implementation of international agreements of the Russian Federation concerning the interests of the Sakhalin Region; information coverage of external economic ties of the Sakhalin Region; conclusion of separate agreements between the Parties that must envisage charges to be paid by investors for the use of subsoil and land (bonuses, royalties) to the regional budget; elaboration of the recommendations regarding rational use of land, put into operation by foreign investors. 2). The administration of the Sakhalin Region: shall carry out international activity and external trade on the territory of the Sakhalin Region in accordance with the Legislation of the Russian Federation; conclusion of agreements at regional and territorial level with foreign states; elaboration and carrying out policy for drawing in foreign investments for the purpose of the realization of regional programs on the territory of the Sakhalin Region. 3). Federal Executive Bodies are authorized to carry out international arrangements on the territory of the Sakhalin Region exclusively by agreement with the regional administration. 4). Federal and Regional Executive Bodies are authorized to carry out control over international activity and external trade on the territory of the Sakhalin Region for the purpose of ensuring the observance of the respective legislative provisions of the Russian Federation and protection of economic and political interests of the Russian Federation and the Sakhalin Region.

Policy: Agreement No. 6 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of construction, architecture, urban planning and housing and communal services.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1) To recognize that state functions, responsibility and plenary powers in the field of construction, architecture, urban planning and housing and communal services on the territory of the Rostov Region are delimited at the three levels: first (federal) regards functions, responsibility, plenary powers and competence carried out by the Government of the Russian Federation; second (joint competence) regards functions, responsibility and plenary powers carried out jointly by the Government of the Russian Federation and by the administration of the Rostov Region; third (regional) regards functions, responsibility and plenary powers carried out by the administration of the Rostov Region. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation, in carrying out federal functions on the territory of the Rostov Region, is entitled to: elaborate and ensure the realization of state policy in the field of construction, architecture, urban planning and housing and communal services taking into account the interests of the Rostov Region; elaborate current and long-term prognoses of social and economic development of construction complex and housing and communal services of the Russian Federation, taking into account the proposals of the administration of the Rostov Region; elaborate legislative and normative legal acts regarding architecture and urban planning; carry out state support of construction complex and housing and communal services within the limits destined for this purpose by federal budget; establish the modalities of licensing of activity in the field of designing, construction, architecture and housing and communal services. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region, in carrying out joint competence on the territory of the Rostov Region, carry out the following commitments: to carry out organizational and methodological foundations of setting up and keeping of state urban planning cadastre and the system of monitoring of hazardous environmental and technological processes and control over environmental protection arrangements and functioning of protective constructions; render assistance in carrying out energy-saving policy in the field of construction and housing and communal services. 4) The administration of the Rostov Region, in carrying out regional competence on the territory of the Rostov Region, carries out the following commitments: to elaborate and carry out regional policy in the field of construction, architecture, urban planning and housing and communal services taking into account federal programs in course; elaborate and carry out regional branch programs, including those for engineering protection of populated areas from disasters; favour development of individual housing through unimpeded allotment of the plots of land and drawing in extra-budgetary funds for development of engineering and social infrastructure; carry out regulation and control over development of engineering infrastructure, quality of urban environment, ensuring reliable, stable and safe from the ecological point of view functioning of housing and communal services on the territory of the Rostov Region.

Policy: Agreement No.18 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region regarding delimitation of jurisdiction and plenary powers in the field of ensuring stable functioning of industry.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1). To recognize that all the spheres of competence and plenary powers in the field of ensuring stable functioning of industry on the territory of the Rostov Region are delimited on two levels: the first level regards federal competence, federal plenary powers and responsibility under the jurisdiction of the Government of the Russian Federation; the second level regards exclusively regional functions, responsibility, sphere of competence and plenary powers in the sphere of functioning of industry under the jurisdiction of the administration of the Rostov Region. 2). In carrying out federal functions as regards management of industry on the territory of the Rostov Region the Government of the Russian Federation assumes the following responsibility: a). elaboration with the participation of the administration of the Rostov Region of current and long-term prognoses of socio-economic development of industry; b). carrying out inter-branch co-ordination of the activity of enterprises pertaining to federal property situated on the territory of the Rostov Region; c). carrying out reformation of state enterprises, including public enterprises in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation. d). assistance in the sphere of economic stimulation of fulfilment of federal special programs by means of their direct financing. The Government of the Russian Federation in its activity aimed at fulfilment of the present agreement proceeds from the principles ensuring ecological safety, environmental protection, and prevention of disasters, catastrophes and damage to the Rostov Region. 3). The administration of the Rostov Region assumes the following responsibility: a). to elaborate and to forward to the Government of the Russian Federation for examination proposals to federal special programs regarding development of industrial enterprises of the Rostov Region; b). to elaborate and promote realization of regional programs of development of industry; c). economic and financial assistance of industrial enterprises of all types of property; d). re-organization, liquidation and creation of enterprises and organization pertaining to federal property.

Policy: Agreement No.7 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region regarding the delimitation of authority and plenary powers in the sphere of ownership, use and management of subsoil.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1). State functions, responsibility, authority and plenary powers in the field of state regulation of use of subsoil on the territory of the Rostov Region are subdivided into federal functions pertaining to the competence of the Government of the Russian Federation and federal executive bodies and regional functions pertaining to the competence of the administration of the administration of the Rostov Region. 2). The administration of the Rostov Region participates in the realization by federal executive bodies of the federal functions, responsibility, authority and plenary powers in the field of regulation of the relationship regarding use of subsoil on the territory of the Rostov Region. 3). In the process of carrying out regional functions, responsibility, authority and plenary powers in the sphere of regulation of the relations pertaining to use of subsoil by the subdivisions of the administration of the administration of the Rostov Region they must provide for the respective concordance and ensure assistance on the part of the Committee on Geology and the Use of Subsoil of the Russian Federation, the Ministry of Economy, the Ministry of Finance and other federal executive bodies. 4). Rates of revenues for the use of the source of mineral and raw materials, except for the revenues of extraction of the widely-distributed underground minerals and underground waters are divided in two parts: 40% of revenues is destined to federal budget and 60%is destined to regional budget.

Policy: Agreement No.9 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the administration of the Rostov Region regarding delimitation of plenary powers in the sphere of prevention of emergency situations of environmental and technological type and liquidation of their consequences.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Rostov Region have agreed as follows: 1). The parties will conduct co-ordinated policy in the field of ensuring safety and protection of the population and territory of the Rostov Region against emergency situations of environmental and technological type. 2). The parties confirm the necessity of further improvement of the integral state system of prevention of emergency situations of environmental and technological type and liquidation of their consequences including territorial sub-system of the Rostov Region. 3). The Government of the Russian Federation pledges to provide for: a). elaboration and financing of long-term programs aimed at the reduction of the risk of emergence of the emergency situations including flooding prevention arrangements for the protection of inhabited areas and objects on the territory of the Rostov Region; b). determination of national arrangements in the field protection of the population and territory of the Rostov Region against emergency situation and their realization; c). setting up reserves of material, technical, financial and other resources for the purpose of protection of the population and territory of the Rostov Region against emergency situations; d). determination of the modalities of preparation of the population for the protection against emergency situations. 4). The Administration of the Rostov Region is entitled pledges to: a). provide on the proper territory for the organization and realization of arrangements for protection of the population and territory against emergency situations and assume responsibility for them; b). elaborate in accordance with Federal Laws regional laws and other normative acts in the field of protection of the population and territory of the region against emergency situations; c). carry out in accordance with the established modalities data collection and exchange of information regarding protection of the population and territory of the region against emergency situations; d). set up reserves of material and financial resources for liquidation of the consequences of emergency situations. 5). Head of Administration of the Rostov Region is entitled to set up authorized institutions (committees, departments) entitled to resolve problems regarding protection of the population and territory against emergency situations.

Policy: Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Tsasucheisky Bor”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of federal significance "Tsasucheisky Bor" is a unique natural complex and is intended to preserve an integral forest biogeocenosis in the steppe zone of South-Eastern Transbaikalia, its flora and fauna. Management regime of the reserve does not envisage expropriation of land plots from landowners (land tenants). The objectives of the reserve shall be as follows: (a) preservation of the integral forest complex and its monitoring; (b) conservation and restoration of the number of species of animals and plants that are economically, scientifically and aesthetically valuable, as well as rare and endangered biological species and their gene pool; and (c) maintaining an overall ecological balance. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) plowing of land; (b) final felling and procurement of resin; (c) application of pesticides, plant protection chemicals and growth stimulants; (d) construction of buildings and structures, roads and pipelines, power lines, and other communications, except for biotechnical work, fire-prevention measures and the construction of office buildings; (e)  conducting irrigation and drainage activities, geological exploration and development of minerals; (f) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside public roads; (g) all types of hunting, except for shooting ungulates for scientific and regulatory purposes; and (h) all types of pollution from household and industrial waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 646 of 1996 regarding validation of the Regulation on authorized institution for conclusion and fulfilment of contracts for subsoil management.
Policy_Content: Authorized institution for conclusion and fulfilment of contracts is a state body entitled by the Government with the plenary powers regarding conclusion and fulfilment of contracts with subsoil managers. Authorized institution must: 1. ensure the observance of the national interests; 2. conclude contract if licence is available and ensure compliance of the terms of contract with the terms of licence; 3. submit contracts to the competent state bodies for carrying out environmental audit; 4. to conclude mining contracts after state expertise and valuation of mineral deposits; 5. bear full responsibility for the preparation of contracts and fulfilment of terms and conditions within the date specified in the licence.

Policy: Decree on the transfer of land of the National Land Fund to the Agricultural Land Redistribution Fund under the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Kyrgyz Republic (No. 240 of 1996).
Policy_Content: Land of the National Land Fund is transferred to the Agricultural Land Redistribution Fund under the Ministry of Agriculture and Food. The Decree lists also a variety of measures to ensure that allocation of land plots from the Agricultural Land Redistribution Fund is carried out: expansion of rural settlements in accordance with the Master Plans for their development; creation and operation of seed-growing, livestock-breeding, testing and selecting, experimental farms and state variety testing entities; establishment of special agricultural entities to grow agricultural crops decided by the Government; sale of rights to use land plots at auctions; leasing out of land to farmers. Citizens, who worked and lived outside the farm and came to the farm for permanent residence before July 1, 1996, are entitled to an average farmland share.

Policy: Regulations on procedures for allocation of land from the Agricultural Land Redistribution Fund for the expansion of rural settlements.
Policy_Content: Allocation of land from the Agricultural Land Redistribution Fund for the expansion of the territories of rural settlements is performed by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food in collaboration with the Ministry of Architecture and Construction, State Agency of Land Management and Land Resources under the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and in agreement with the local state administrations. A special commission set up by the rayon state administration considers Land for the expansion of each specific rural settlement. That Commission considers also land planning issues. After the Commission's Decision is approved by specified central authorities, the land, dedicated to the development of the rural settlement, is allotted in kind with its boundary marks fixed and registered by the land management service in the land cadastre documents.

Policy: Agreement No. 6 of 1996 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Irkutsk Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of the use of subsoil.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Irkutsk Region proceeding from the necessity of rational use of the deposits of minerals and joint regulation of the use of subsoil, have agreed as follows: (a) This Agreement delimits plenary powers between the Parties in the sphere of the use of subsoil. (b) The present Agreement determines the list of the plots of subsoil of federal importance on the territory of the Irkutsk Region in accordance with the Annex that is integral part of the Agreement. (c) Management and establishment of the conditions for the use of the plots of land of federal importance on the territory of the Irkutsk Region must be carried out in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on subsoil in concordance with the administration of the Irkutsk Region. (d) Management and establishment of the conditions for the use of the plots of land not classified as those of federal importance on the territory of the Irkutsk Region must be carried out in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation and the legislation of the Irkutsk Region on subsoil and by Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil of the Irkutsk Region. (e) Revenues for the reproduction of mineral sources of raw materials transferred to federal budget and regional budget of the Irkutsk Region must be destined for the purposeful use. The amount of the aforesaid revenues is established in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.

Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Irkutsk Region have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation jointly with the administration of the Irkutsk Region elaborates federal programs for support of social and economic development of the region and establishes the conditions for use of natural resources on the territory of the Irkutsk Region adjacent to the Baikal Lake. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation participates in the financing of the arrangements for the reorientation or liquidation of hazardous enterprises and industries situated within water protection zone of the Baikal Lake; the list of hazardous enterprises and industries must be validate jointly by the Parties. 3) State institutions of the Irkutsk Region are entitled to validate on the basis of the Russian Legislation regarding protection of the Baikal Lake corresponding normative legal acts and to carry out supervision over their application, take part in the elaboration and realization of federal and regional programs regarding conservation, restoration and improvement of the ecosystems of the Baikal Lake area situated on the territory of the Irkutsk Region, elaborate regional programs regarding conservation and improvement of ecological situation of the Irkutsk Region adjacent to the Baikal Lake, determine legal status, the modalities of elaboration and realization of rational land use planning on the territory of the Irkutsk Region adjacent to the Baikal Lake, carry out other plenary powers envisaged by the Russian Legislation and the Legislation of the Irkutsk Region.

Policy: Decreto Nº 25.298/MINAE - Reglamento para regular el Registro Nacional de Auditores de Calidad y Protección al Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento, que consta de 3 capítulos y 20 artículos, establece que el Ministerio del Ambiente y Energía (MINAE) establecerá un registro al que podrán inscribirse las personas físicas o jurídicas que deseen ser acreditadas como auditores para realizar labores de inspección y evaluación de los productos, procesos y servicios relacionados con la protección del medio ambiente (art. 2º). Los términos de referencia para la inspección y evaluación serán definidos por el MINAE para cada tipo de actividad (art. 11). Los resultados de la inspección y evaluación estarán disponibles para el público en la oficinas del MINAE (art. 14). Los inspectores están obligados a no revelar a terceros la información de carácter confidencial a que hayan tenido acceso durante la inspección (art. 15). A los diferentes productos, procesos o servicios que se sometan a la evaluación voluntaria se les otorgará un sello de calidad según sea el puntaje obtenido en la evaluación (art. 17).

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to implement section 13 of the Federated States of Micronesia Environmental Protection Act by establishing standard procedures for preparation of an environmental impact assessment statement prior to taking or funding any major action that may significantly affect the quality of the human environment. The Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) process is intended to help the general public and government officials make decisions with the understanding of the environmental consequences of their decisions, and take actions consistent with the goal of protecting, restoring, and enhancing the environment. These Regulations provide the directions to achieve this purpose. In addition, these Regulations are designed to: (a) Integrate the EIA process into early planning of projects to insure timely consideration of environmental factors and to avoid delays; and (b) Identify at an early stage the significant environmental issues requiring further study and de-emphasize insignificant issues, thereby defining the scope of the EIA.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Earthmoving Regulations (Chapter 2401-1).
Policy_Content: Regulations promulgated by the Republic of Palau Environmental Quality Board (“the Board”). They regulate earthmoving operations, i.e. any construction or other activity which disturbs or alters the surface of the land, coral reef or bottom of lagoons (reg. 3). All earthmoving operations in Palau shall be conducted in accordance with these Regulations and in such a way as to prevent accelerated erosion or accelerated sedimentation (reg. 4). Erosion and sedimentation control measures shall be set forth in a plan to be prepared by qualified persons in accordance with requirements laid down in reg. 6 and presented by an applicant to the Board (regs. 4 and 5). If a project involves the marine environment, additional requirements of reg. 7 shall apply. Regulation 9 lists erosion and sedimentation control measures to be incorporated in all earthmoving operations, whereas regulation 10 specifies control facilities. Removed material shall be disposed of in accordance with discharge rules laid down in regs.12 and 13. Remaining provisions deal with (procedures for) permits and enforcement.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Marine and Freshwater Quality Regulations (Chapter 2401-11).
Policy_Content: Regulations promulgated by the Republic of Palau Environmental Quality Board (“the Board”). The purpose of these Regulations is to protect the quality of freshwater (surface and groundwater) and marine water resources of the Republic of Palau and, in this context, identify the uses for the various waters of Palau to be maintained and protected, and prescribe water quality standards for those waters (reg. 2). Regulation sets out the policy of Palau in respect of protection of water quality. Regulation 5 classifies coastal waters according to its various uses and prescribes general quality requirements for those waters. Regulations 6 to 8 classify freshwater, groundwater and groundwater areas. Basic criteria regarding water quality standards that apply to all waters are set out in regulation 9. Regulations 10 to 18 lay down specific water quality standards with respect to various polluting substances. All point and non-point discharges subject to the provisions of this Chapter shall comply with the terms, conditions, provisions and management plans for any National, State or traditional conservation area, preserve or other protected area as established by law. Regulation 22 requires discharge operators to obtain a Pollutant Discharge Permit from the Board. Regulations 30 to 36 concern water quality of so-called “mixing-zones”. Regulation 42 classifies water use areas in accordance with criteria set out in regulations 6 to 8. A water quality certification must be provided to the Board prior to issuance of any permits and other procedures set out in regulations 44 to 54 accomplished. (57 regulations completed by one Schedule)
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Classification/declassification,Effluent waste water/discharge,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water quality standards

Policy: Environmental Impact Statement Regulations (Chapter 2401-61).
Policy_Content: Regulations promulgated by the Republic of Palau Environmental Quality Board (“the Board”). They give further meaning to provisions of the Environmental Quality Protection Act of Palau by providing agencies and persons with procedures, specifications of contents and other rules regarding the preparation, filling and distribution of environmental impact statements. “Environmental impact”, “environmental assessment” and “environmental impact statement” are defined in regulation 2. Regulations 3 and 4 define the applicability of the requirement of an environmental assessment. An environmental assessment shall contain information set out in regulation 5. On the basis of this environment assessment the Board shall determine whether the preparation of an environmental impact statement in accordance with regulations 8 to 14 is required (reg. 7). Regulations 15 to 19 concern filing and distribution of a draft environmental impact statement. The Board shall be responsible for notification of the draft statement to the public and distribution to reviewers, i.e. persons and agencies that have jurisdiction or expertise to review the draft. Regulation 17 prescribes the period of public review of the draft. A draft shall be accepted or rejected by the Board in accordance with regulation 18 and a notice to that effect issued to the applicant. Remaining regulations make provision for supplemental statements, public notice of statements and environmental impact fees. (26 regulations)
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Loi nº 014/96/ADP portant réorganisation agraire et foncière au Burkina Faso.
Policy_Content: Cette loi détermine les principes fondamentaux de l'aménagement du territoire, de la gestion des terres rurales et urbaines, du régime de l'eau, des forêts, de la faune, de la pêche, des substances de carrière et des mines, ainsi que la réglementation des droits réels immobiliers. Elle est formée par 248 articles répartis en 7 titres, à savoir: Champ d'application (I); Création et définition du domaine foncier national (II); Aménagement du territoire (III); Gestion du domaine foncier national (IV); Réglementation des droits réels immobiliers (V); terres du domaines foncier national situées à l'étranger (VI); Dispositions finales (VII). Le domaine foncier national est constitué de toutes les terres et des biens immeubles ou assimilés cités à l'article 34 de la loi. L'aménagement du territoire doit tenir compte des contraintes et de potentialités du milieu naturel, des capacités humaines et techniques, des nécessités économiques et sociales, des interactions et des spécificités socio-économiques régionales et de la protection de l'environnement. L'aménagement distingue les zones urbaines et celles rurales et se fait sur la base de quatre types de schéma: national, régional, provincial et schéma directeur d'aménagement, chacun de ces schéma étant élaboré par une spécifique commission. Tout changement de destination de terrain doit être approuvé par un décret pris en conseil des ministres. Tout aménagement doit être précédé par une étude d'impact sur l'environnement. L'article 34 arrête la liste des biens immeubles du domaine foncier national qui, en raison de leur nature, de leur destination et de leur affectation , bénéficient de mesures particulières de gestion et de protection. Ces biens sont inaliénables, imprescriptibles et insaisissables et grèvent les fonds riverains de servitudes d'utilité publique. Les articles de 38 à 40 fixent les critères pour la délimitation et la gestion des terres urbaines et rurales, qui sont gérées par les structures suivantes: la commission d'attribution des terres destinées à l'habitation, la commission d'évaluation et de constat de mise en valeur des terres, la commission de retrait des terres. Dans les villages, l'attribution, l'évaluation et le retrait des terres relèvent de la compétence de commissions villageoises de gestion des terroirs organisées en sous-commissions spécialisées. Les articles de 48 à 61 réglementent les titres de jouissance des terres, toujours nécessaires à l'exception des cas d'occupation et d'exploitation des terres rurales non aménagées dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de logement et de nourriture de l'occupant et de sa famille. La délivrance des titres est subordonnée à la mise en valeur des terres et au paiement des droits et des taxes dus. Les terres urbaines destinées à l'habitation sont attribuées de gré en gré, et dans certaines zones bien définies, par adjudication. Les articles de 66 à 70 réglementent l'aliénation des terres du domaine foncier national, normalement subordonnée à l'obtention préalable d'un permis et à des conditions particulières de mises en valeurs. Les articles de 71 à 147 portent principes de base pour la gestion de l'eau, des forêts, de la faune, des pêches et des substances de carrière et des mines, et les relatives infractions et sanctions. Le titre V porte les dispositions relatives à la définition des droits réels immobiliers, aux principes de la publicité foncière, à la vente sur saisie immobilière, à la procédure d'adjudication et de ses incidents et à la distribution du prix entre les créanciers du propriétaire exproprié; à la responsabilité en matière de publicité foncière; au fonds d'assurance en matière de publicité foncière pour la réparation des dommages causés aux tiers, aux transactions et mutations de droits réels immobiliers et de leur cession forcée. Les titres fonciers précédemment supprimés sont rétablis. La loi renvoie à un décret pris en conseil des ministres pour la réglementation des structures, conditions et instruments de gestion des terres des collectivités territoriales, à prendre dans un délai d'un an.

Policy: Instructions No. 1 of the General Directorate of Forests and Pastures on technical criteria for leases of pastures and meadows.
Policy_Content: This Instruction deals with the criteria for the granting of leases for pastures and meadows by local authorities and lays down rules for the use of such agricultural land by leaseholders. Lease contracts for animal grazing with local legal and natural entities are entered into by the district subordinate bodies of the General Directorate of Forests and Pastures according to priorities: (1) with villagers who are livestock owners and are nearest the location of the pasture or meadow; (2) with livestock owners within the Commune and are near the location of a pasture or meadow; (3) with livestock owners within the district and are near the location of the pasture or meadow; (4) with livestock owners within the prefecture; (5) with livestock owners of other districts; (6) priority shall be given to those with the largest number of animals. Grazing is allotted on the basis of a zone or parcel system with the aim that it is operated rationally. Various other obligations of the leaseholder are specified. The last part of this Instruction concerns obligations of subordinate bodies of the General Directorate of Forests and Pastures and the local legal and natural entities that lease pastures in use.
Subject: Land & soil, Livestock
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Instructions enter into force immediately.

Policy: Regional Law No. 104 "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the process of functioning of state bodies, local government, enterprises, institutions and organizations irrespectively of organizational and legal form thereof and the population, in the sphere of protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters. It shall have the following purposes: (a) determination of the jurisdictional competence of state bodies, local government and organizations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters with the consideration of geographic and climatic particulars of the regions; (b) prevention of the outbreak and propagation of disasters; (c) reduction of damages and losses caused by disasters; and (d) rehabilitation of the territory. Regional territorial subsystem of the national early warning system shall be responsible for data collection, processing and dissemination of the information related to disasters and timely information of the population thereof.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Municipal Property Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for various maters relative to property acquired and/or held by municipalities, including expropriation of private land, disposal of municipal property, and management and operation of real property. Municipal property shall include the following: forests and agricultural land as defined by law; water sources, including mineral waters, which are used only by the respective municipality, together with the water intaking equipment and the water distribution networks and equipment, and; water basins, together with their adjacent beaches and quarries of local significance. Municipal property shall be public and private (art 3). The municipality shall establish its property rights over any real property by means of a municipal property deed (art. 4). Municipal property shall be run and managed in the interest of the community of the municipality, in accordance with the provisions of the law and with the care of a good husband and municipal property shall be utilised in accordance with its uses, and for the purposes for which it has been granted (art. 5).

Policy: Model Sewerage and Drainage Regulations (GN No. 99 of 1996).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made in terms of section 94 of the Local authorities Act of 1992, concern providing of sewage services by municipal councils, town councils or village councils (together ‘Council’) and the control of drainage of (waste)water by local authorities. No person shall obtain the connection of any private sewer to a public sewer, whether directly or through a combined private sewer, except by means of a connecting sewer provided by the Council pursuant to a sewerage service contract. An application for the provision of a sewerage service shall be made to the Council in the form provided by the Council for the purpose. Where in respect of any premises a suitable means of disposal by waterborne sewage is available, the owner of such premises shall provide and install a drainage installation on the premises. In certain circumstances, the Council may perform certain work on private premises. Only qualified and registered persons shall carry out work on drainage installations for which approval is required. For the purpose of these regulations the relevant South African Bureau of Standards (SABS) standards and codes shall be applicable, but the Council may also approve the use of any other specification and codes where in its opinion it is appropriate to do so, and it shall in considering any application for such approval be guided by accepted practice and international specifications and codes of practice. Except with the prior written permission of the Council, no person shall discharge or cause or permit to be discharged into any public sewer any industrial effluent or any other liquid or substance, other than soil water or wastewater. Various obligations are placed upon an occupier of any premises from which industrial effluent is discharged into a public sewer. The Council may undertake metering and assessment of industrial effluent. Certain discharges are prohibited.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Subsoil (No. 242–IIS of 1996)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates subsoil in Georgia. Subsoil located on the land territory, its territorial waters, continental shelf and special economic zones of Georgia is a national treasure of Georgia and it is protected by the State. The Law defines subsoil as part of the earth crust, which is exposed on the ground surface or located in layers of soil and reservoirs, as well as under the soil layer and the bottom of the reservoir, and which is available for exploration and usage. Mineral resources are natural and technogenic formations and/or a combination thereof, which are available in subsoil. Mineral resources that may be extracted or treated at the modern scientific and technological development level, and which is economically feasible and environmentally acceptable, are mineral resources which, depending on the spheres of their designation and use, may be divided into fuel and energy, ore (ferrous and non-ferrous metal ores), construction materials, mining and chemical raw materials, groundwater and non-fuel gas types, and other non-metallic mineral types. Within metalliferous deposits, main and ancillary mineral resources may be selected. In this case the type of metalliferous deposits shall be determined by the content of the main mineral resource within such deposits. The main mineral resource is the main useful component available in the metalliferous deposits, for the extraction of which mining works are carried out. The components available in ore, which are extracted and used together with the main mineral resource, shall represent ancillary mineral resources. Subsoil of Georgia is state property. Any action, which overtly or covertly infringes the right of state ownership of subsoil shall be prohibited and such transactions shall be invalid. The right of ownership of land shall not mean and shall not grant the right of ownership of subsoil. The purpose of this Law is to ensure the rational use of subsoil and mineral resources taking into account laws of nature and the potential capacity of the environment, the interests of present and future generations, and the principles of sustainable development. The Law is divided into eight chapters and 54 articles.

Policy: Law No. I-1340 “On Klaipedos state seaport”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the activities and management of Klaipeda state seaport. Klaipeda State Seaport is the property of the Republic of Lithuania. The founder of the port is the Government of the Republic of Lithuania. The boundaries of the territory of the port land and the territory shall be determined by the Government of the Republic of Lithuania on the proposal of the Ministry of Transport and Communications. Port land, water areas, hydrotechnical installations, quays, navigation routes and channels, navigation facilities and other infrastructure objects shall be state property. The Port Authority manages, uses and disposes of the property of the Port Authority in accordance with this and other laws of the Republic of Lithuania. The Port Authority has the right to lease harbor land for the needs of port activities, as well as operators functioning in the port area, even if their activities are not related to port activities. Port land, infrastructure and water areas shall not be privatized. Other state property objects located in the port may be privatized in accordance with the Law on the Privatization of State and Municipal Property, by agreement with the Ministry of Transport. The port is open to international shipping. For vessels with nuclear power plants and nuclear weapons, access to the port is prohibited. Enterprises located in the port who use or transport hazardous substances harmful to human health must ensure the safety of the working environment. The main functions of the Port Authority include: (a) preparation and realization of projects related to the development of port facilities and infrastructure; (b) control of compliance with laws, international maritime legislative documents and other legal acts of the Republic of Lithuania on shipping; (c) control of the environmental security of seaport, protection against pollution and mitigation of the consequences of pollution; and (d) construction, operation and development of port facilities and navigational equipment. Harbor master shall be responsible for the registration of vessels flying the flag of the Republic of Lithuania and issuance of registration documents thereto; piloting of vessels; and provision of navigational and hydrometeorological information. This Law is composed of IV Chapters divided into 44 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation of port operations. Chapter III regards economic and commercial activities in the port. Chapter IV lays down final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Council Directive 96/29/Euratom laying down basic safety standards for the protection of the health of workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Directive applies to all practices involving a risk from ionizing radiation emanating from an artificial source or from a natural radiation source in cases where natural radionuclides are or have been processed in view of their radioactive, fissile or fertile properties. Such practices include in particular the production, processing, handling, use, holding, storage, transport, import to and export from the Community and disposal of radioactive substances. On the other side, this Directive shall not apply to exposure to radon in dwellings or to the natural level of radiation, i.e. to radionuclides contained in the human body, to cosmic radiation prevailing at ground level or to aboveground exposure to radionuclides present in the undisturbed earth's crust. The above-mentioned practices may be carried out only upon prior authorization and must be reported to the competent authorities. Title III of the Directive is entirely devoted to such reporting and authorization. Article 5 concerns authorization and clearance for disposal, recycling or reuse of radioactive substances or materials containing radioactive substances. Further, Title IV deals with justification, optimization and dose limitation for practices. Title V lays down rules relating to estimation of effective dose. Title IX regulates with details the interventions to be undertaken in case of radiological emergencies.
Subject: Energy, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Guidelines for the calculation of damage caused to atmosphere, land and water resources by oil pollution.
Policy_Content: These Guidelines establish the modalities of the calculation of damage caused to atmosphere, land and water resources by chemicals, regulate calculation of payment for the compensation of damage caused to land by oil pollution and shall be applicable to all land categories. Policy: Federal Law No. 41-FZ on production cooperatives.
Policy_Content: Production cooperative (cooperative association) is a voluntary association organized on the basis of membership for common production and other economic activity based upon personal working and other participation and unification of property shares of its members (participants). Section 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 4-6) regards setting up a cooperative. Section 3 (arts. 7-8) establishes the rights and the duties of the members of a cooperative. Section 4 (arts. 9-13) regards the property of a cooperative. Section 5 (arts.14-18) regards management of a cooperative. Section 6 (arts. 19-22) regards regulation of labour relations in a cooperative. Section 7 (arts. 23-25) regards interrelations between cooperatives and associations of cooperatives. Section 8 (arts. 26-27) regards reorganization and liquidation of cooperatives. Section 9 (arts. 28-29) lays down final provisions.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 563 validating Regulation on the modalities of import into the Russian Federation and export from the Russian Federation of ozone depleting substances and produce containing them.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree implements the Montreal Protocol on Substances That Deplete the Ozone Layer. The Prime Minister decrees to to establish that import-export of ozone depleting substances and produce containing them must be carried out in accordance with licenses issued by the Ministry of External Economic Ties and Trade in conformity with the present Regulation. The present Regulation is applicable to all legal persons irrespectively of their organizational and legal form and to all individual entrepreneurs engaged in activity related to ozone depleting substances and produce containing them, except for cases envisaged by the Russian legislation and international agreements. Import-export, and transit through the territory of the Russian Federation into or from the states that are not Parties of the Montreal Protocol of ozone depleting substances specified in Annex 1 are prohibited. Import-export into or from the states that are not Parties of the Montreal Protocol of ozone depleting substances specified in Annex 2 are prohibited. The present Regulation is not applicable to transit through the territory of the Russian Federation of ozone depleting substances specified in Annex 2. State Committee for Environmental Protection is authorized institution entitled with the task of decision-making as regards the possibility of import into the Russian Federation and export from the Russian Federation of ozone depleting substances and produce containing them. In case of the infringement of the present Regulation legal persons, individual entrepreneurs and officials are liable to prosecution in accordance with the Russian legislation.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation of 3 May 1996 on the control of acoustic pollution.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 26 articles and four Annexes, regulates the control of acoustic pollution of musical premises, under Law on atmospheric and noise pollution, approved by the General Council on 30 December 1985. Potentially generating activities of a high noise level are subject to the above mentioned Law on atmospheric and acoustic pollution. The Ministry of Environment is the competent authority responsible for these matters. Noise is measured in decibels, according to the standard scale A (dBA). Sound activities should not produce noise that exceed environmental standards, given the reception areas of the sound and the schedules, and the specific limits in the outside environment. Annexes specify the following issues: Activities potentially generating a high level of noise (Annex I); Sound level rating (Annex II); Temporary and night work and facilities in general (Annex III); Public places intended for leisure, entertainment or recreational activities that have music equipment or perform musical shows (Annex IV).

Policy: Law on Subterranean Depths (1996)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates subterranean depths. The purpose of this Law is to ensure complex, efficient, environmentally-friendly and sustainable use of subterranean depths, as well as specify the requirements for the protection of subterranean depths. Subterranean depths and all mineral resources present therein shall be owned by the land owner. The land owner or an accordingly authorised person thereof, if the land owner is the State or local government, may deal with subterranean depths as far as this Law and other regulatory enactments do not restrict his or her rights. The Law further provides for supervision of use of subterranean depths fund; use of subterranean depths; protection of subterranean depths; and liability for violations in the use of subterranean depths and the recovery of damages. Mineral resources are defined as formations of non-organic or organic origin (also groundwater) the use of which is practically possible and economically viable. Also, mineral resources of national significance are defined as hydrocarbons untreated petroleum (crude oil), natural gas and groundwater (freshwater, mineral water, thermal water and water used in industry).
