Policy: Ley Nº 217 - Ley General del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales.
Policy_Content: La Ley consta de 6 títulos y 156 artículos. INDICE: Disposiciones generales (I); Gestión del medio ambiente (II): La Comisión del Ambiente (1), Instrumentos para la gestión ambiental (2); Recursos naturales (III): Normas comunes y formas de adquirir derechos (1), Biodiversidad y patrimonio genético nacional (2), Suelos (3); Calidad ambiental (IV); Competencias, acciones y sanciones en materia administrativa y judicial (V); Disposiciones transitorias y finales (VI). La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer las normas para la conservación, protección, mejoramiento y restauración del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales que lo integran asegurando su uso racional y sostenible (art. 1º). Son objetivos particulares de la presente Ley: 1) la prevención, regulación y control de las causas o actividades que originen deterioro del medio ambiente y contaminación de los ecosistemas; 2) establecer medios, formas y oportunidades para una explotación racional de los recursos naturales dentro de una planificación nacional fundamentada en el desarrollo sostenible; 3) la utilización correcta del espacio físico a través de un ordenamiento territorial; 4) fortalecer el sistema nacional de áreas protegidas para garantizar la biodiversidad y demás recursos; 5) garantizar el uso y manejo racional de las cuencas y sistemas hídricos; 6) fomentar y estimular la educación ambiental; 7) propiciar un medio ambiente sano que contribuya a la promoción de la salud y prevención de enfermedades (art. 3º). El desarrollo económico y social del país se sujetará a los siguientes principios rectores: 1) el ambiente es patrimonio común; 2) es deber del Estado y de todos los habitantes la protección de los recursos naturales y el ambiente; 3) el criterio de prevención prevalecerá sobre cualquier otro en la gestión pública y privada del ambiente; no podrá alegarse la falta de una certeza científica absoluta como razón para no adoptar medidas preventivas en todas las actividades que impacten el ambiente; 4) el Estado debe reconocer y prestar apoyo a los pueblos y comunidades indígenas en sus actividades para la preservación del ambiente y uso sostenible de los recursos naturales; 5) el derecho de propiedad tiene una función social ambiental que limita y condiciona su ejercicio absoluto, abusivo y arbitrario; 6) la libertad de los habitantes, en el ámbito de las actividades económicas y sociales, está limitada y condicionada por el interés social; 7) las condiciones y contratos de explotación racional de los recursos naturales que otorga el Estado deberán contar con la aprobación de los gobiernos regionales autónomos o municipales (art. 4º). Se crea la Comisión Nacional del Ambiente como foro de análisis, discusión y concertación de las políticas ambientales, que funcionará como instancia de coordinación entre el Estado y la sociedad civil para procurar la acción armónica de todos los sectores, así como órgano consultivo y asesor del poder ejecutivo en relación con la formulación de políticas, estrategias, diseño y ejecución de programas ambientales (art. 6º). El Ministerio del Ambiente y Recursos Naturales es el ente regulador y normador de la política ambiental del país, y el responsable del cumplimiento de la presente Ley (art. 8º). También se crea la Procuraduría para la Defensa del Ambiente y los Recursos Naturales, como rama especializada de la Procuraduría General de Justicia, que ejercerá la representación y defensa de los intereses del Estado y la sociedad en esta materia (art. 9º). Son instrumentos para la gestión ambiental, entre otros, los siguientes: 1) la planificación y legislación; 2) el ordenamiento ambiental del territorio; 3) las áreas protegidas; 4) los permisos y evaluaciones del impacto ambiental; 5) el Sistema Nacional de Información Ambiental; 6) la educación, divulgación y desarrollo científico y tecnológico; 7) los incentivos; 8) las inversiones públicas; 9) el Fondo Nacional del Ambiente; 10) la declaración de áreas contaminadas y de emergencias ambientales (art. 11).

Policy: Ley Nº 7599 - Titulación de tierras ubicadas en reservas nacionales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 18 artículos, dispone que el Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario llevará a cabo programas múltiples de titulación de tierras en zonas del país determinadas por la Junta Directiva de ese Instituto y que sean parte de las reservas nacionales; asimismo donde exista por lo menos una proporción del 20 por ciento de poseedores de fincas no inscritas en el registro público y cuyas cabidas no sean superiores a 300 hectáreas (art. 1º). La presente Ley considera reservas nacionales los terrenos que no estén inscritos a nombre de personas físicas o jurídicas, los que no pertenezcan a instituciones del Estado y los de aptitud agropecuaria que el Ministerio del Ambiente y Energía traspase al Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario.

Policy: Regional Law No. 30-z “On wild fauna”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of conservation and management of wild fauna, natural habitats thereof with a view of ensuring biological diversity, setting up conditions for sustainable existence of wild fauna, conservation of genetic fund of wild fauna species and other forma of protection of wild fauna as integrated part of natural environment. It also shall be applicable to captive breeding of wild fauna species and utilization of genetic fund thereof for scientific research and educational purposes. Wild fauna within regional boundaries shall be public property. Natural and legal persons shall be granted the right: (a) to obtain information related to wild fauna from state bodies; (b) to perform environmental audit; (c) to carry out arrangements for protection of wild fauna and natural habitats thereof; and (d) to assist in the realization of state programs in the sphere of wild fauna.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 232-I validating the Regulation on the State Committee on Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the State Committee on Environmental Protection shall be the authorized state institution in the sphere of environmental protection and nature management. The main tasks of the Committee shall be: (a) state supervision over environmental protection, management and reproduction of natural resources; (b) interdepartmental coordination of environmental protection; (c) elaboration and implementation of common energy saving policy; and (d) improvement of environmental situation. The Committee shall carry out the following functions: (a) elaboration and validation of environmental standards, rules and regulations, and also registration of natural resources; (b) pollution control; (c) validation of maximum allowable limits of emissions and discharge of pollutants; (d) environmental audit; (e) environmental monitoring; and (e) management of protected areas.

Policy: Order No. 74 of the Federal Forest Service regarding assessment of the state of forest selection seed-growing and the perspectives of its development for the period of 1996-2000.
Policy_Content: The President of the Federal Forest Service orders to adopt as recommended methodological base of model structure of the program of development of forest seed growing elaborated by the Central Institution of Forest Seed Growing, to increase the amount of procurement of seeds from the permanent forest seed growing areas in accordance with the Annex 5, to promote arrangements for large-scale introduction of available mass selection methods such as calibration and separation of forest seeds and sorting out of planting materials, to examine the proposals regarding organization of new forest seed growing production stations and specialization of forestries in accordance with the Annex 6, to elaborate perspective program of experimental and production work in the field of forest selection and forest seed growing in the basic forestries, ensure the increase in delivery to the forest institutions of selection and planting materials and to carry out coordination of the activity of specialized institutions and forestries as regards introduction of the progressive methods of seed growing into forest practice. Model Structure of the program of development of forest selection seed growing and forest seed-growing activity for the period of 1996-2000 and further up to 2010 is recommended as methodological basis. The Program consists of 3 Sections. Section 1 contains the analysis of the actual state of forest seed growing and forest seed growing activity at the regional level. Section 2 regards the development of forest selection seed growing. Section 3 regards the development of forest seed growing activity.

Policy: Agreement 1996 between the Russian Federation and the Khabarovsk Territory regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Khabarovsk Territory.
Policy_Content: Authorised representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Khabarovsk Territory have agreed on the following: 1) The State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Khabarovsk Territory jointly are authorized to: (a) elaborate and carry out jointly with the subjects of the Russian Federation concerned federal special program of economic and social development of Far Eastern and Baikal area for the period of 1996-2005; (b) establish conditions for economic activity and use of natural resources on the territory of the Khabarovsk Territory, reproduction and rational use of mineral sources of raw materials, aquatic biodiversity, prospecting and exploitation of recreational resources; (c) certification and licensing of some types on the territory of the Khabarovsk Territory; (d) development and rational use of natural resources of the continental shelf of the Russian Federation in accordance with federal legislation. 2) The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation and its State Bodies: (a) elaboration with the participation of the State Bodies of the Khabarovsk Territory of normative legal acts pertaining to joint jurisdiction in accordance with the provisions of the present Treaty; (b) reproduction of mineral sources of raw materials; (c) financing of federal special program of economic and social development of Far Eastern and Baikal area for the period of 1996-2005 within the limits established by federal budget. (3) The state bodies of the Khabarovsk Territory, for the purpose of implementation of the present Treaty, must establish, in accordance with federal laws, conditions for use of natural resources on the territory of the Khabarovsk Territory, take part in the realization of federal programs of development of mineral sources of raw materials.

Policy: Resolución Nº 1/INEFAN - Disposiciones para la aplicación de los artículos 36 y 37 de la Ley de Desarrollo Agrario.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece que en los casos de comunidades o etnias aborígenes en posesión ancestral y otros posesionarios que se encuentren asentados dentro de áreas del patrimonio forestal del Estado, y que de conformidad con el artículo 36 de la Ley de desarrollo agrario y el artículo 60 de su Reglamento general soliciten al Instituto Nacional de Desarrollo Agrario (INDA) la correspondiente legalización de dichas tierras, el INEFAN -de manera previa a la adjudicación por parte del INDA-, procederá a delimitar y deslindar de dichos predios las áreas declaradas patrimonio forestal del Estado (art. 1º). Las adjudicaciones de tierras en favor de comunidades o etnias aborígenes en posesión ancestral será en forma colectiva, gratuita y como cuerpo cierto, con la prohibición de fraccionarlas o enajenarlas, y su aprovechamiento será de beneficio exclusivo de los adjudicatarios (art. 4º).

Policy: Arrêté ministériel nº 3313 portant création et organisation du Projet de Promotion des Micro entreprises rurales (PROMER).
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté porte création au sein du Ministère de l'Agriculture, d'un projet de Promotion des Micro entreprises rurales (PROMER) financé par le Fonds international pour le Développement agricole (FIDA) et le Gouvernement du Sénégal. Ce projet a pour objectifs: 1) la création de nouveaux emplois saisonniers ou permanents rémunérateurs et par là l'amélioration des revenus des familles rurales les plus défavorisées; 2) la production des biens et services dont les communautés rurales ont besoin pour leur propre développement économique; 3) l'allongement de la période de travail productif annuel en milieu rural qui est surtout limité aux périodes de travaux agricoles; 4) la réduction de l'exode rural. La zone d'intervention du Projet est située dans les régions de Tambacounda, Kolda, Kaolack et Fatick. L'article 11 prévoit que pour atteindre les objectifs assignés au projet, l'unité de gestion signe différents protocoles et conventions avec les intervenants extérieurs.

In case of non use or misuse land must be allotted back to the State and no buildings shall be built upon rented land destined to use other than building infrastructure.

Policy: Fire and Emergency Act 1996.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment and operation of the Northern Territory Fire and Rescue Service. Functions of the Service include to respond to all incidents in an emergency response area; to respond to all hazardous material incidents and road accident rescues, wherever occurring, in the Territory; to conduct community education and awareness programs relating to fires and other emergencies and, in particular, relating to fire safety and prevention; and to develop and administer programs designed to promote safety in building structures. The Act also contains provisions on the role of the Service in dealing with and investigating on fires and other emergencies and defines offences and penalties under the Act.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 565 regarding the arrangements for economic stabilization and promotion of reforms in agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of economic stabilization in agro-industrial complex, creation of favourable conditions for increase of the production of agricultural commodities and foodstuffs, increase of social insurance of peasants and further intensification of agrarian reform, decrees as follows: 1) To establish that the main directions of state policy in the field of reformation of agro-industrial complex are assistance in the setting up and functioning of efficient economic structures in agro-industrial complex with the use of means stationed by the federal budget for support of agricultural organizations irrespectively of the form of property and organizational and legal form, state financing of structural transformation of the agricultural organizations, improving financial position of unprofitable agricultural enterprises, information backing and personnel selection for the promotion of agrarian reform financed from federal budget, republican budgets and extra-budgetary sources, promotion of agricultural cooperation as a priority direction of the agrarian reform, including support for setting up by the producers of agricultural commodities of production, processing, providing and trading, agro-servicing, crediting, insurance and other types of cooperatives, incentives for the newly-set peasant farms for the initial purchase of agricultural equipment. 2) To establish that trading organizations that purchase agricultural commodities from producers must pay them immediately after revenue to the budgets of all levels, to the Pensionary Fund, to the Federal Fund of Compulsory Medical Insurance, to State Employment Service and Social Insurance Fund of the Russian Federation. 3) To establish that state authorized institution in the field of land reclamation is the Ministry of Agriculture and Food and the respective regional executive bodies. To establish that the Ministry of Agriculture and Food is the leading managing authority of agro-industrial complex and food delivery.

Policy: Regional Law No. 7 "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes organizational and legal provisions in the sphere of protection of the population, environment, including land, water and air, against natural and environmental disasters. It shall have the following purposes: (a) determination of the plenary powers of state bodies, local government and organizations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters with the consideration of geographic and climatic particulars of the regions; (b) prevention of the outbreak and propagation of disasters; (c) reduction of damages and losses caused by disasters; and (d) mitigation of the consequences of disasters. Regional territorial subsystem of the national early warning system shall be responsible for data collection, processing and dissemination of the information related to disasters and timely information of the population thereof.

Policy: Presidential Decree establishing criteria for the implementation of article 40, paragraph 1, of Act of 22 February 1994, No. 146 on the Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: The Decree establishes conditions, criteria and technical provisions for the application of the Environmental Impact Assessment procedure to the projects included in Annex II to the Council Directive No. 85/337/CEE. Annex A to the present Decree lists out the projects that are subject to the Environmental Impact Assessment (e.g., production of pesticides, storage of hazardous substances, waste treatment plants, etc.). Annex B concerns the projects to be carried out, totally or partially, in protected nature areas and, therefore, subject to the Environmental Impact Assessment (e.g., animal breeding, fish culture, metals processing or food processing plants, building of infrastructures, etc.). The Environmental Impact Assessment aims, inter alia, at: (a) the protection and the improvement of the quality of life and the conservation of the biodiversity and reproduction capacity of the ecosystems; (b) the evaluation of the impact on humans, fauna, flora, soil, underground and surface waters, air, climate, landscaping aspects; (c) exchange of information between the applicant and the appropriate authority. Articles 5-12 describe in details the procedure of the Environmental Impact Assessment (application, documentation to be submitted, evaluation by the appropriate authority, issue of the authorization, etc.).

Policy: Regional Act No. 18 implementing Act No. 440 of 4 August 1978: "Provisions on the use of uncultivated, abandoned and lands insufficiently cultivated".
Policy_Content: The Regional Act regulates the reclamation of lands in order to: (a) protect the soil and the hydrogeological balance; (b) encourage the rational use of agricultural surfaces. Article 2 gives the definition, on the one hand, of uncultivated or abandoned lands and, on the other hand, of lands insufficiently cultivated. The provisions established by this Act shall apply exclusively to uncultivated or abandoned lands and insufficiently cultivated lands falling within the zones classified into "agrarian cultures" (COL) and "grasslands under maintenace" (PRMA) by the maps related to the vegetation arrangement provided for in the Regional Territorial Coordinating Plan. The Act shall not apply to the lands defined by article 4, such as forests, lands intended for quarrying and discharges, lands that are necessary for commercial industrial activities. Article 5 regulates the allotment of lands to the beneficiaries thereby specified. Article 9 concerns the withdrawal of the allotment administrative provision. The Commission for the Use of Uncultivated Lands shall be established under each Province (art. 11).

Policy: NOMEM-003-SEMARNAP/SAGAR-1996: Uso del fuego, en terrenos forestales y agropecuarios, y que establece las especificaciones, criterios y procedimientos para ordenar la participación social y de gobierno en la detección y el combate de los incendios forestales.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los requisitos y procedimientos para el uso del fuego en terrenos forestales, de aptitud preferentemente forestal, así como en los terrenos de uso agrícola y ganadero, y determinar las especificaciones, criterios y procedimientos a promover y ordenar la participación social y de gobierno en la detección y el combate de los incendios forestales. Esta Norma se aplicará a todas las actividades en donde se haga uso del fuego en terrenos forestales, de aptitud preferentemente forestal, así como en los terrenos de uso agrícola y/o ganadero, con objeto de reducir el riesgo de inicio y propagación de incendios descontrolados en dichas áreas. Esta Norma regula las actividades de prevención y combate de incendios forestales de los pobladores, propietarios y poseedores de los terrenos a que se refieren los incisos anteriores: ejidatarios, comuneros y propietarios rurales titulares de aprovechamientos de recursos forestales maderables y no maderables, forestaciones y reforestaciones y aquellas personas que tengan la necesidad de hacer uso del fuego; así como la intervención de autoridades y el apoyo de las organizaciones de los sectores social y privado en dichas actividades.

Policy: Instructions on land-surveying practice validated by the Committee on land resources and land survey.

These Instructions are destined for physical and juridical persons that carry out land survey practice irrespectively of the departmental affiliation. The document consists of 16 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 determines the substance of land-surveying practice. Section 3 regards geodetic basis and establishes the requirements regarding the precision of land-surveying practice. Section 4 establishes the requirements for the fixation of the boundaries of the plot o land. Section 5 deals with preparatory work. Section 6 concerns field inspection of geodetic support posts and boundary-marks. Section 7 regards elaboration of technical project. Section 8 regards information of landlords, land owners and tenants of land survey. Section 9 regards fixation and concordance of the boundaries of the plot of land. Section 10 deals with determination of the co-ordinates of boundary marks. Section 11 concerns the calculation of the surface of the plot of land. Section 12 regards mapping of boundaries of the plot of land. Section 13 regards control and formal acceptance of the documentation of land-surveying by the producer. Section 14 deals with state control over the installation and preservation of boundary marks. Section 15 regards the modalities of appeal against the outcome of land survey. Section 16 regards putting together land survey file. The document contains 3 Annexes.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: The Sicilia Region aims at promoting agricultural and sylvo-pastoral resources, improving woodlands as well as sylviculture and related activities and protecting the environment. For the achievement of these purposes, this Act reorganizes the regional legislation in matter of forestry and flora protection. Forests are defined by article 4 as surfaces of not less than 5000 mq in width where forestry plants, shrubs and forest trees exist. The Regional Counsel of Agriculture and Forestry shall elaborate and update the regional inventory of forests, which shall contain the list of lands that can be qualified as forests in accordance with the definition given by article 4. The Regional Forestry Chart, containing the classification of forests, shall be attached to the inventory. The Agency for the Forest Domain of the Sicilian Region (AFDRS) shall provide for the management of forests by adopting the plans referred to in article 13. Such plans shall contain, inter alia, provisions regarding forest management and culture and infrastructural interventions to be undertaken to improve forest productivity. The forestry administration shall be engaged in: (a) nature reserves management; (b) the management of woodlands and lands of naturalistic interest; (c) interventions to be undertaken in order to protect and improve public and private lands falling within nature parks; (d) setting up of installations intended for the processing and transformation of forest products; (e) creation of botanic gardens for scientific and educational purposes; (f) cultivation and marketing of officinal plants, mushrooms and typical fruit plants of the regional territory. Article 20 lays down provisions in matter of expropriation, which may take place upon payment to the owner of a proper compensation as per article 22. Article 27 concerns particularly the expropriation of lands reforested through public funding. The Regional Counsel of Agriculture and Forestry shall promote a programme on water and forestry interventions so as to contribute to soil protection. With a view to enacting such programme, the Regional Counsel may draw up a plan on acquisition of lands, in compliance with the priority criteria laid down in article 31. Article 33 concerns fire-fighting activities. The Plan for the Protection of Vegetation against Fires shall be adopted by Decree of the President of the Region as referred to in article 34. Particular rules are established for protected nature areas. The Regional Forestry Body shall exercise, within the regional territory, the functions and tasks which are entrusted to the State Forestry Body at the national level.
Subject: Forestry

Policy_Content: The present Law establishes guaranteed financing of processes carried out at especially radioactively dangerous and nuclear dangerous works and objects for the purpose of ensuring safe and sustainable functioning of the aforesaid works and objects. Policy: Loi nº 96-29 du 3 avril 1996, instituant un plan national d'intervention urgente pour lutter contre les événements de pollution marine.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte institution d'un Plan National d'Intervention urgente fixant le cadre et les mécanismes d'action rapide, efficace et coordonnée permettant aux pouvoir publics de se prémunir et de lutter dans les meilleures conditions contre les pollutions marines massives par les hydrocarbures et autres produits nocifs menaçant l'environnement marin et le littoral national. Afin de suivre la préparation des différents intervenants à la lutte et à l'exécution du Plan, est instituée une Commission Nationale pour la Prévention et la Lutte contre les Evénements de Pollution Marine. En cas de pollution marine massive, le président de cette Commission prend la qualité de Coordinateur National pour la mise en oeuvre du plan. Au niveau régional, est institué un comité de mise en oeuvre du Plan, présidé par le Gouverneur de la région, compétent en cas de pollution affectant ou susceptible d'affecter le littoral. Est aussi établi un système d'alerte entre les différentes autorités compétentes en mer qui pourraient avoir connaissance d'un accident de pollution marine. La loi réglemente la conduite des opérations d'intervention et les activités qui suivent la fin de ces opérations. Des plans spécifiques d'intervention urgente en cas de pollution de faible ampleur doivent être mis à point par les gestionnaires des ports de pêche, de commerce, de plaisance, des terminaux pétroliers et des plate-formes de prospection et de production pétrolière.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 440 on general directions of the passage to sustainable development.
Policy_Content: The President decrees that considers it necessary for the purpose of the conservation of favourable environment and the potential of natural resources for the benefit of the present and the future generations to pass to sustainable development. Considerable part of the production capacity of Russia is not meeting the modern ecological requirements while 16 per cent of its territory is classified as ecologically unfavourable. The targets of the passage to sustainable development at the federal level are: 1) to ensure stabilization of environment; 2) to reach radical improvement of environment by means of introducing ecofriendly economic activity and processes; 3) to introduce energy saving technologies. The objectives of the passage to sustainable development at the regional level include soil improvement, afforestation and the introduction of ecofriendly progressive technologies in agriculture. Manufacturing and industrial use of all hazardous substances shall be put under the state supervision.

Policy: Timber Harvesting Contract and Subcontract Regulation (B.C. Reg. 22/96).
Policy_Content: This Regulation deals with both contracts and subcontracts in timber harvesting. It is divided into 7 parts as follows: Part 1 - Interpretation and Application; Part 2 - Written Contracts and Subcontracts Required; Part 3 - Assignability of Contracts and Subcontracts; Part 4 - Dispute Resolution; (Division 1 - Dispute Resolution Requirements; Division 2 - Dispute Resolution System; Division 3 - Register of Arbitration Awards); Part 5 - Replaceability of Contracts and Subcontracts; (Division 1 - Contracts; Division 2 - Amount of work; Division 3 - Amount of Work Disputes; Division 4 - Rate Disputes; Division 5 - AAC Reductions; Division 6 - Subcontracts); Part 6 - Contractor Clause Compliance; Part 7 - Required Provisions and Schedules 1 to 20. Part 4 outlines the practices, procedures, fees and expenses of mediation and arbitration. Part 5 specifies that a replaceable contract must provide for the contractor to continue to satisfactorily perform its obligations under the contract as a condition. This Regulation deals with amount of work and rate disputes arising in the absence of express provision. Part 5 also deals with the reduction of "AAC" (allowable annual cut) and dispute resolution proceedings. Part 6 provides that compliance of "contractor clause" by the holder of a licence must be assessed for each calendar year in accordance with this Regulation. Finally a contract or subcontract must contain either the standard provisions contained in the schedules, which comply the requirements specified throughout this Regulation, or similar provisions agreed to by the parties

Policy: Mines and Minerals Act 1996 (No. 5 of 1996).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules relative to the exploration for and the exploitation of mineral resources and related matters such as the grant of mineral rights and (restriction of) rights on the surface, protection of the environment and the resolution of disputes. No grant of rights in minerals shall be valid unless granted in accordance with this Act. The Minister may designate an Inspector of Mines and Minerals. Mineral rights shall be granted by Agreement with the Minister, whereas a reconnaissance licence, exclusive prospecting licences or mining licences shall be granted by the Minister upon application. The Inspector shall keep a register of every mineral right granted under this Act. Non-exclusive prospecting licences may be granted by the Inspector. In deciding on a mineral right, the Minister of the Inspector, as the case may be, shall take into consideration protection of the environment and may attach conditions in this regard (including conditions regarding soil rehabilitation) to a mineral right. Such conditions may be enforced by Notice of the Minister. The Act also establishes a Board for the hearing of all disputes arising in relation with matters covered by this Act.

Policy: Lands Tribunal Rules 1996 (S.I. No. 1022 of 1996).
Policy_Content: These Rules make provision for the procedure to be followed in respect of cases before the Lands Tribunal. They replace the Lands Tribunal Rules 1975. The Rules consolidate the procedure in relation to appeals. They no longer provided for prescribed forms to be used except in relation to applications under section 2 of the Right of Light Act 1959. The main changes to the general procedure of the Tribunal are: (a) a simplification of the procedure for the determination of proceedings without a hearing; (b) a new simplified procedure is introduced for appropriate cases; (c) section 19A of the Arbitration Act 1950 is applied to proceedings allowing the Tribunal to award interest on compensation; (d) the Tribunal's powers of sanction in the event of failure to pursue proceedings diligently or comply with the Rules are strengthened; and (e) provision is made for solicitors to formally be placed on the record when acting for a party to proceedings with responsibility to the Tribunal for fees.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: These Regulations entered into force on 1 April 1996.

Policy: Aprueba el Programa Forestal y de Suelo 1995-2000.
Policy_Content: Los objetivos generales y específicos del Programa Forestal y de Suelo 1995-2000, en lo relativo al sector forestal, son: 1) asegurar la conservación de los recursos forestales, como parte fundamental del equilibrio de los ecosistemas; 2) aumentar la participación del sector en el desarrollo económico del país, mediante el impulso de un aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos forestales, promoviendo la inversión, la generación de empleo y el ahorro interno; 3) propiciar la valorización de los servicios ambientales forestales, para que la sociedad reconozca, asuma y contribuya al costo de su mantenimiento; 4) contribuir al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de las comunidades campesinas que viven en las zonas forestales. En relación al recurso suelo, son: 1) contrarrestar los problemas estructurales del deterioro del suelo, mediante la promoción de estrategias financieras y la adecuación del marco jurídico correspondiente; 2) detener los procesos de degradación del suelo; 3) restaurar gradualmente el recurso suelo; 4) propiciar el desarrollo de una cultura para el uso sustentable del recurso suelo.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil

Policy: Law on the property of agricultural lands.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Law is to: (a) provide security for organized farming; (b) to avoid the dismemberment and irrational use of farmland. It defines the rules on the purchase and sale of agricultural land as well as on State participation in the process of "normalisation of relations connected with agricultural land". The law defines farms, agrarian persons (farmers, etc.), and sets out rights and obligations connected to landownership and use, such as the right to freely alienate land. The final section lists cases in which alienation of land requires special permission, such as when land designated for agricultural purposes is not intended to be used for agriculture by the new owner. Such permissions are granted by the Land Administration Body. All land transactions must be registered in the public register.

Policy: Decree No. 202 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on Sinsha biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Sinsha biosphere reserve shall be allotted the area of 13398 hectares and shall have as its purpose the conservation in its natural state the unique landscape and lake ecosystem with the population of rare and endangered plants and game recorded in the Red Book of Belarus. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of Sinsha biosphere reserve: 1) clear final cutting; 2) extraction of peat and sapropel; 3) land reclamation and any other activity causing change of landscape and the existing hydrological regime; 4) damage and annihilation of shrubbery and forest plantations and disturbance of soil; 5) burning out dry vegetation; 6) water abstraction for irrigation, industrial water supply, discharge of sewage and waste disposal in water bodies; 7) clearing of riverside natural growth except for recreational areas; 8)  the use of motor boats except for life-saving and nature-conservative inspection; 9) setting up tourist camps. The proclamation of Sinsha biosphere reserve shall not entail the expropriation of land. The regional executive bodies shall be the managing authority of Sinsha biosphere reserve. Land tenants must observe the regime of protected area and use ecofriendly processes. The damages caused to Sinsha biosphere reserve shall be compensated by the legal and natural persons in conformity with the modalities established by law.

Policy: Order No. 43 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on forest management in the state forest strips.
Policy_Content: The state protection forest strips situated in the dry lands of the European and in the Asian parts of Russia represent unique artificial ecosystems. The total area of the state forest strips in the European part is of 102.8 thousand hectares and in the Asian part is of 24.3 thousand hectares. The main tasks of forest management are rise of viability, longevity, protective functions of the state forest strips and reforestation on suitable soil. Sanitary and intermediate felling in the state forest strips shall be carried out for the purpose of the improvement thereof, strengthening protective functions and the formation of the optimum structure of the forestation. There shall be no limitation of felling age. In the state forest strips either partial or total conversion shall be carried out. In case of occurrence of mass nidi of forest pests there shall be applied extermination arrangements with the utilization of biological and chemical preparations in conformity with the validated List.

Policy: Law No. 8093 on water resources.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to ensure the protection and development of water resources, to provide for the proper distribution of water resources, to prevent water pollution and to define the institutional framework at national and water basin level for purposes of the implementation of a national water policy (art. 10). For the purposes of this Act, "water resources" shall encompass inland waters, maritime waters, surface and underground waters, hydrogeological formations as well as precipitation. The 74 articles of this Law are divided into 16 chapters: General (I); Administration of water resources (II); The national water strategy and planning of water resources (III); The right to water usage (IV); Permits, authorizations and concessions for water use (V); The control and preservation of water resources quality (VI); Discharges and sewerage networks (VII); Permissions, authorizations and concessions for discharges (VIII); The harmful effects of water (IX); Protected areas and surfaces (X); Protection of banks (XI); Waterworks and objects (XII); Water users and discharges' associations (XIII); Servitudes (XIV); Financial provisions (XV); Violations and sanctions (XVI). Article 5 provides for the establishment of water administration agencies. A National Water Council, to be headed by the Prime Minister, is also established.

Policy: Agreement No. 5 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Komi Republic regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Komi Republic have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Komi Republic will interact in all the main issues regarding the development of agro-industrial complex. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation: shall carry out coordination of the elaboration and realization of federal programs, introduction of large-scale scientific and technical innovative arrangements in all branches of agro-industrial complex; shall provide for, within the limits fixed by federal budget, financing arrangements for the prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, carrying out veterinary scientific research, provision with national and imported preparations and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, authorization for manufacturing and trade of the aforesaid preparations and equipment, delivery of pedigree cattle in accordance with the request of the Komi Republic; shall elaborate common Regulation on agricultural inspections, improve State Standards, branch standards, technical requirements and other technical and normative documentation in the sphere of agro-industrial production; shall carry out the program of state support of the producers of agricultural commodities; shall contribute to the delivery of raw materials, additives and components for the processing industry. 3) The Government of the Komi Republic: shall provide for stable development of agro-industrial complex and the increase of the manufacturing of agricultural commodities under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions for more efficient functioning of agro-industrial complex on the basis of development of various forms of property and economic activity; shall carry out delivery of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs jointly with Federal Foodstuffs Corporation attached to the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Russian Federation on account of finances destined for the formation of federal and regional stock of foodstuffs, regional funds for the delivery of agricultural commodities to the Arctic Circle area and provide for purchase price fixation for the local producers; shall take part, within its competence and available funds in carrying out national agro industrial programs; shall ensure rational use of land and other environmental resources functioning within the system of agro-industrial complex; shall forward at the request of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Russian Federation the necessary information regarding the development of agro-industrial complex and utilization of financial funds and material resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement No. 7 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Komi Republic regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of environmental protection and the use of natural resources.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Komi Republic have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation provides for carrying out common state policy in the field of environmental protection and regulation and use of natural resources in the Russian Federation; regulation of relationship in the field of environmental protection and stable ecological development; organization of Pan-Russian system of environmental monitoring; elaboration of international, federal and inter-regional ecological programs and environmental quality standards; determination of the modalities of elaboration and validation of ecological standards, basic charges for escape, discharge and emission of hazardous substances in environment; observation of federal legislation in the field of environmental protection and use of natural resources and carrying out state control over the observation of the requirements of federal legislation in the field of environmental protection and use of natural resources. 2) The Government of the Komi Republic is entitled to carry out, within its sphere of competence, state management in the field of environmental protection and use of natural resources; to determine, within its sphere of competence, the modalities and conditions of use of natural resources to the benefit of the Komi Republic and the Russian Federation; to establish differentiated environmental charges for use of natural resources, escape, discharge and emission of hazardous substances, waste disposal, other types of hazardous environmental impact and distributes the aforesaid charges among budgets and funds in accordance with the Russian legislation and the legislation of the Komi Republic; to carry out state control over use of natural resources and state of environment; to carry out state ecological expertise in accordance with normative legal acts of the Russian Federation and the Komi Republic. 3) The Parties shall elaborate and carry out programs regarding development and reproduction of natural resources, study of the state and protection of environment; assume the responsibility for improving from a health point of view and quality improvement of environment on the territory of the Komi Republic; undertake effective arrangements for reproduction of wildlife and plant species, conservation and reproduction of biodiversity; keep state Red Books. 4) The Parties, for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of environmental legislation can set up by mutual agreements joint environmental institutions.

Policy: Law No. 2391 ratifying the international Convention on Salvage, 1989.
Policy_Content: This law ratifies the international Convention on Salvage which was signed in London on Geneva on 28 April 1989 (article 1 of the present law). The objective of the Convention is to provide for uniform international rules regarding salvage operations in the light of the need for timely operations and to protect the environment. The provisions of this Convention shall not apply when the property involved in the salvage operations is maritime cultural property of prehistoric, archaeological or historic interest and is situated on the sea bed (article 2). The law, consisting of three articles (ratification, reservation and entry into force), adopts all its provisions.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 113 validating the Regulation on protection zone of the national park “Orlovskoe polesie”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that protection zone around the national park “Orlovskoe polesie” is being created for the purpose of maintaining protection regime and reduction of the impact of economic activities on natural complexes in the national park. Land, forest and water plots with all resources within their boundaries of wild flora and fauna within the protected zone of the national park "Orlovskoe polesie" shall not be subject to privatization. In the protection zone shall be authorized economic activities that do not cause damage to natural resources of the national park and do not lead to disruption of their natural states. Protection zone shall perform the following tasks: (a) mitigation of the negative impact of economic activities outside the territory of the national park on its natural complexes and species; (b) reduction of fire hazard in the territory adjacent to the park; and (c) improving the conditions for the existence of rare and particularly valuable species of animals and plants in the park by reducing the anthropogenic impact on the areas of their habitat. The following activities shall be prohibited in the protection zone: (a) drainage and land reclamation; (b) mining; (c) resin tapping; (d) hunting, running and training of dogs; (e) industrial procurement of wild plants, medicinal and technical raw materials; (f) cattle grazing and bush felling in the coastal strips of waterbodies; (g) making fires outside specially designated places; (h)  clean burn of grass; and (i) littering of the territory.

Policy: Land Reform (Labour Tenants) Act 1996 (No. 3 of 1996).
Policy_Content: "Labour tenant" is defined in section 1 as a person who: (a) is residing or has the right to reside on a farm; (b) who has or has had the right to use cropping or grazing land on the farm, referred to in paragraph (a), or another farm of the owner, and in consideration of such right provides or has provided labour to the owner or the lessee; (c) whose parent or grandparent resided or resides on a farm and had the use of cropping or grazing land on such farm or another farm of the owner, and in consideration of such right provides labour to the owner or the lessee of such or such other farm, including a person who has been appointed successor to a labour tenant in accordance with the provisions of section 3(4) and (5), but excluding a farmworker. Provisions of Chapter II confirm the right of labour tenants to occupy and use land which was either held by him or her on 2 June 1995 or the occupation and use of which is restored to him or her in terms of this Act or any other law (sect. 3). Other provisions of this Chapter concern eviction of labour tenants and other persons and reinstatement or labour tenants by Court Order. Chapter III provides for the acquisition of ownership or other rights in land by a labour tenant and related procedures of arbitration or court proceedings. Chapter contains provisions concerning the Land Claims Court and Arbitrators; Chapter V contains miscellaneous provisions.

Policy: Law of Georgia on System of Protected Areas (No. 136-IIS of 1996)
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the system of protected areas of Georgia. It provides that the formation of the system of protected areas in Georgia serves the preservation of original natural and cultural environment and its individual components for future generations, and the ensuring of conditions for the mental and physical health of humans and the creation of one of the main bases for the civilised development of society. In Georgia, protected areas are established for protecting and restoring significant national heritage - unique, rare and distinctive ecosystems, plant and animal species, natural formations and cultural areas, and for ensuring their use for scientific, educational and recreational purposes and for the purposes of developing a saving economy for natural resources. The planning of the system of protected areas in the territory of Georgia, the selection of categories of protected areas and the establishment and functioning of each protected area have the following goals: a) the guaranteed long-term protection of the bio-geographic units of Georgia to ensure the continuous development of natural processes; b) the protection and restoration of natural ecosystems, landscapes and living organisms; c) the protection of the genetic pool of endangered wild animals and plants included in the Red List of Georgia, and the preservation of biological diversity; d) the preservation of unique and rare organic and inorganic natural formations; e) protection against human-induced impacts on territories within active zones of erosion, mudflows, floods, torrents, avalanches, landslides, as well as areas of surface and ground water formation, drainage and discharge; f) the preservation and restoration of sceneries characteristic of historical and cultural landscapes and architectural and archaeological complexes; g) the creation of appropriate field conditions in areas of invaluable and irreplaceable objects in order to carry out educational and scientific research; h) the ensuring of favourable conditions in the natural, historical and cultural environment for recreation, health care and tourism purposes; i) the facilitation of the protection, restoration and development of traditional economic activities and folk arts in order to preserve the original historical and cultural environment; and j) the promotion of the saving economy of areas used for agricultural, industrial, transport and energy purposes, and of natural resources. The Law is divided into 25 articles.

For the purposes of this Act, The Bahamas shall be divided into such number of local government districts as the Minister deems fit. Every town area shall have a town committee and every district a district council, which shall be bodies corporate. Functions of town committees shall include general health and sanitation management and the upkeep and maintenance of public wells and water tanks. Functions of district councils include town and country planning and the public supply of water.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant le règlement flamand relatif à l'assainissement du sol.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant le règlement flamand relatif à l'assainissement du sol est formé par 45 articles répartis en 8 chapitres: Définitions (I); Etablissements et activités pouvant engendrer une pollution du sol (II); Agrément d'experts en assainissement du sol (III); Registre des terrains pollués et attestations du sol (IV); Normes d'assainissement du sol et valeurs de fond (V); Procédures d'appel visées dans le décret (VI); Sûretés financières (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII). Policy: Decree No. 295 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on state testing, state registration and re-registration, issuing the list of pesticides and agrochemicals authorized for application in Ukraine.
Policy_Content: The state testing of new preparations shall be carried out for the purpose of biological, toxicological and hygienic, and also ecological assessment thereof and regulation of their safe application. The state testing of preparations shall be carried out by the scientific research institutions, enterprises and organizations that make part of the network of the state testing units in conformity with the common methodological instructions validated by the Ministry of Environmental Protection. The state testing of preparations composed of new substances shall be carried out for the period of two full vegetation periods.  Institutions that make part of the network of the state testing units in case of necessity shall elaborate maximum permissible limits of contents of preparations in the fodder, permissible limits or approximately permissible limits for the water of the fishing water bodies and approximately permissible limits for the bee feeding. Preparations of pesticides and agrochemicals of the national and foreign origin shall be subject to compulsory registration. Formerly registered preparations the period of validity of which has expired shall be subject to re-registration.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Industrial Development Corporation of Solomon Islands as a body corporate and defines its functions, powers and internal organization. The objective of the Corporation shall be to stimulate, facilitate and encourage the development of industries in Solomon Islands. The Corporation shall have a Board of Directors that shall finance industrial ventures and research, also in the field of ecofriendly processes and technology. The Board shall also assist in exportation of commercially viable goods. The Minister may give to the Board such directions of a general character as to the policy to be followed by the Board in the performance of its functions.

Policy: Environmental quality standard for soils (National Standard GB 15618-1995).
Policy_Content: The Standard is formulated for the purpose of implementing the Environmental Protection Law of the People's Republic of China, preventing soil pollution, protecting the environment and human health and safeguarding agroforestry production. It provides the allowed concentration limit of soil pollutants and monitoring methods according to soil use functions, protection objectives and soil quality. The standard applies to soil of farmland, vegetable field, tea garden, orchard, rangeland, woodland and nature reserves.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.210 of 1996 regarding institutions authorized to carry out state expertise of the stock of minerals, geological, economic and ecological information regarding the plots of subsoil conceded in use.

The Ministry for Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and its territorial branches are authorized institutions entitled to carry out state ecological expertise and must provide for state ecological information regarding the plots of subsoil to be conceded in use. Policy_Content: This Regulations seeks to fill a gap in the regulation of Maritime Traffic by the Shipping Act particularly with respect to the prevention of collision on sea in areas near to large sea ports. The Regulation makes provision for navigation signs, communication of transport of dangerous or harmful substances, and amends various navigation regulations for specific areas. (32 articles)

Policy: Regional La No. 38 “On protection and rational management of amber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of the regional state bodies and legal grounds for extraction, collection processing, trade and conservation of amber. Amber shall be considered mineral laying in subsoil, on sea bottom and in mining waste. Extracted amber shall be considered property of subsoil manager if not otherwise envisaged by mining licence. Concession of subsoil parcels for amber extraction shall be authorized subject to prior geological exploration and assessment of stock of minerals. Extraction of amber shall be subject to mandatory licensing. Artificial change of coastline due to amber extraction shall be subject to state regulation imposing soil recultivation and rehabilitation. In such case subsoil managers shall carry out arrangements for protection of environment, water and subsoil.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 168 validating the Regulation on licensing of certain activities in the area of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of issuing licences for recycling, storage, transportation, burial and treatment of industrial waste, materials and substances (except radioactive), certification and environmental audit. Licence applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) copy of statutory documents; (c) copy of the state registration of the enterprise; (d) payment of dues and taxes; (e) tax inspection certificate; (f) professional quality certificate; (g) information on technical equipment and previous activity; and (h) ecological substantiation. The licence shall authorize specific activities and establish the terms and conditions for carrying them out. Individual licences shall be issued each activity and shall be valid for no less than three years.

Policy: Resolución Nº 62/96 - Franjas forestales hidroreguladoras alrededor de los embalses y cauces fluviales.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución se propone establecer regulaciones a fin de preservar y reforestar las fajas forestales que deben existir en los embalses, ríos, arroyos y otros cuerpos y espejos de agua. A este propósito dispone la elaboración de los proyectos de fajas forestales hidroreguladoras (par. 1º), realizados de conformidad con lo establecido en la Norma Cubana 93-01-206 "Franjas forestales de las zonas de protección a embalses y cauces fluviales" (par. 2º). Las personas naturales y jurídicas tenedoras de tierras, ya sean en propiedad, usufructo o administración, quedan obligadas en un término de 2 años a construir las fajas forestales en los embalses y cursos de agua existentes dentro de sus límites, con el ancho y las especies forestales o frutales determinadas en los proyectos realizados a tales fines, cuando no existe proyecto el ancho se define por la Norma antes mencionada (par. 3º). Se prohíbe la entrega de nuevas tierras en usufructo, así como la construcción de viviendas e instalaciones y el fomento de nuevas plantaciones agrícolas en las zonas de protección de los cuerpos de agua (par. 4º), así como el fomento de cultivos temporales agrícolas (par. 5º).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: State Program of Environmental Education and Training of the Population of the Republic of Tajikistan until 2000 and for the perspective until 2010.
Policy_Content: State Program of Environmental Education and Training of the Population of the Republic of Tajikistan until 2000 and for the perspective until 2010 is a nationwide sectoral policy document aimed at expansion and improvement of environmental education system and transition to a qualitatively new level of training in accordance with international standard requirements. The implementation of this Program shall be considered as a necessary condition for the environmentally sound, sustainable socio-economic development of the Republic of Tajikistan, ensuring the solution of the problems of rational nature management with preserving the biosphere and maintaining a favorable natural environment for human health. It generally meets the organizational, legal, economic requirements, from the point of view of environmental protection and ecological upbringing and education, and will serve the current and future generations. This Program obliges ministries and departments, organizations, institutions and enterprises, regardless of ownership, to be like-minded in environmental education and public education of the republic, to have their own sectoral program for environmental protection and nature management, taking into account the interests of present and future generations. The goal of the Program: to teach every person in their place of residence and in their workplace to make environmentally sound decisions in the field of environmental management, which is achieved by creating a unified continuous system of education and upbringing of the population of the country in the field of environmental protection.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Provisional Regulation No. RND 211.3.02.01-96 of the Ministry of Ecology and Biological Resources on environmental audit.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the proceedings of environmental audit for the functioning enterprise, sets the requirements for the environmental audit documentation and the modalities of concordance and validation thereof. The grounds for environmental audit shall be: (a) availability of data attesting high negative environmental impact of an enterprise; (b) incompleteness and unreliability of data regarding environmental impact hindering ecological inspection; (c) violation of environmental legislation; (d) request of the enterprise. Environmental audit shall be supplemented with audit report and shall be subject to sanitary, epidemiological and ecological expertise after the completion of which it shall be definitely validated. Annex 3 contains model form of environmental audit.

Policy: Official Letter No. MG-1-17-6/34 regarding the implementation of Water Code.
Policy_Content: The Deputy Chief of the Federal Forestry Service specifies that Water Code envisages the setting up of water conservation zones of the water basins, as well as realisation of forestry protection measures in these zones. In connection with the requests for the allotment of water conservation zones and the regime of forest management in them the Federal Forestry Service communicates that there exists the internal contradiction in Water Code because Article 111 prohibits timber extraction and rooting out in the aforesaid zones while Article 113 allows interim felling. Water Code doesn't determine the dimensions and boundaries of water conservation zones. Article 111 authorizes the Government to establish the dimensions and boundaries of water conservation zones and their coastal forest shelter-belt. In accordance with the aforesaid the Government must validate decree regulating these issues. Till the validation of this legislative act it would be advisable to maintain the dimensions and the regime of forest management in prohibited forest shelter-belt as well as in the coastal forest shelter-belt.
Subject: Forestry, Water

Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact subsection 15(1) of the Canada Oil and Gas Operations Act. Policy: Resolución Nº 7/96 - Financiamiento de la silvicultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución se propone perfeccionar el sistema de financiamiento vigente para la silvicultura, a fin de eliminar sus deficiencias, elevar la eficiencia de los resultados e incentivar a las diferentes entidades encargadas de ejecutarlo. Las entidades productoras financiarán con sus propios recursos o utilizando el crédito bancario actividades como: plantaciones de bosques productivos con ciclos de corta de hasta 7 años, producciones de semillas para la venta, producciones de posturas para la venta, tratamientos silvícolas, así como reconstrucción y enriquecimiento, cuando los costos de los manejos sean inferiores al valor de las maderas extraídas (par. 1º). El párrafo 2º especifica las actividades que se financiarán con cargo al presupuesto de inversiones del Ministerio de Agricultura, como: plantaciones de bosques productivos con ciclos de corta superior a 7 años, plantaciones de bosques protectores, tratamientos silvícolas, así como reconstrucción y enriquecimiento, cuando los costos de los manejos sean superiores al valor de las maderas extraídas, medidas de protección contra incendios, medidas de protección contra plagas y enfermedades, alimentación y reproducción de la fauna. El financiamiento para la reforestación de presas y embalses estará incluido en el presupuesto de inversiones de los proyectos de dichas obras (par. 3º). Para valorar las actividades previstas en el párrafo 2º se establecerán precios zonales, basados en los costos tecnológicos más un margen de ganancia de hasta un 30 por ciento (par. 4º). El Ministerio de Agricultura designará en cada municipio los funcionarios facultados para certificar las actividades silvícolas a financiar con cargo al presupuesto de inversiones, establecerá el sistema para su registro, el control correspondiente y la información que deberá emitirse periódicamente (par. 8º). Mientras la plantación no sea declarada como establecida, el financiamiento se efectuará con recursos propios del productor o mediante crédito bancario (par. 10). Los párrafos 11 a 13 establecen la modalidad para recibir el reintegro de lo ejecutado por la entidad.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Framework Agreement on First Nation Land Management.
Policy_Content: The present Agreement is an initiative by 14 First Nations to take over the management and control of their lands and resources. The Agreement sets out the principle components of this new land management process. Furthermore, the present Agreement provides First Nations with all legal status and powers needed to manage and govern their lands and resources. While First Nations will not be able to sell their land, they will be able to lease or develop their lands and resources, subject to any limits imposed by their own community in laws and Land Codes. The Land Code A Land Code, Drafted by the community, will be the basic land law of the First Nation and will replace the land management provisions of the Indian Act. The Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development will no longer be involved in the management of the First Nation’s reserve lands. The Land Code does not have to be approved by the Minister.

Policy: Air Pollution Control (Licensing and Emission Standards) Regulations (Cap. 204).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide with respect to control of air pollution in Zambia. The Environmental Council shall, in accordance with the guidelines set out in the First Schedule, assess the quality of ambient air. The long term emission limits shall be as set out in the Third Schedule. The Environmental Inspectorate may determine the period of time within which an operator of a plant, undertaking or process shall meet the long term emission limit. Any person who intends to erect or install a new industrial plant, undertaking or process which is likely to cause air pollution shall: (a) register with the Inspectorate during the planning stages; and (b) apply for a license in form as set out in the Second Schedule (reg. 5). The Inspectorate shall issue a license to discharge air pollutants in form as set out in the Second Schedule after taking into account the details specified in section forty-five of the Act and after having published a notice in the Official Gazette (reg. 6). The license to discharge air pollutants shall be valid for 36 months and be conform to the long-term emission limits set out in the Third Schedule and be subject to such other conditions as the Inspectorate may determine. Regulation 8 concerns a license for new sources of emissions whereas regulation 10 to 14 provide for permits to emit air pollutants. A person shall not conduct any open air burning of any waste from industrial, commercial operations, domestic or community activities except with the written consent of the Inspectorate (reg. 15). The Inspectorate may issue Enforcement Notices under regulation 16. Fees are prescribed in the Fourth Schedule. (16 regulations and 4 Schedules)
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Law on state and local property.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to regulate relations arising from the matters of powers of the legislative and executive organs concerning ownership rights on state and local property, level of authority of a legal person with state property and its administration, principle and regulations of activity of an organ implementing policy on state property. The following immovable and movable property to be considered as a state property for public use: 1) land not pertaining to private ownership; 2) subsoil with its mineral wealth; 3) water and water resources; 4) forest and forest resources; 5) flora and fauna; 6) historical and cultural relics and monuments; 7) archaeological and paleonthological findings; 8) other items considered as State property for public use by law. The local property comprises items of common/public property for public use and the locally owned property. The Law consists of 9 Chapters that contain 83 articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-2) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (arts. 3-7) specifies state property items. Chapter 3 (arts. 8-12) regards management of state property. Chapter 4 (arts. 13-23) regards legal persons with state property and rights of its stock. Chapter 5 (arts. 24-31) regards regulation of ownership, use and disposal of the property pertaining to state property. Chapter 6 (arts. 32-65) regards privatization of state property. Chapter 7 (arts. 66-73) deals with control over state property, its protection, inspection, registration and accounting. Chapter 8 (arts. 74-81) regards local property items. Chapter 9 (arts. 82-83) lays down additional provisions.

Policy: Act respecting the Régie de l'énergie (R.S.Q., c. R-6.01).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the régie de l’énergie. In particular, it applies to the supply, transmission and distribution of electric power and to the supply, transmission, distribution and storage of natural gas delivered or intended for delivery by pipeline to a consumer. At the outset the Act contains a definition clause relating to terms therein employed, such as, “electric power supply”, “energy”, “natural gas”, “petroleum products”, “steam distributor”, “storage”, “deemed contract”. Section 4 rules that a board to be known as the “Régie de l'énergie” is established. It shall promote the satisfaction of energy needs through sustainable development and with due regard for equity both on the individual and collective planes. The Act consists of 13 chapters as follows: Application (I); Organization and operation of the Régie (II); Functions and powers (III); Rate determination (IV); Monitoring of steam and petroleum product prices (V); Exclusive electric power or natural gas distribution rights (VI); Examination of consumer complaints (VII); Financial provisions (VIII); Directives and regulations (IX); Penal provisions (X); Amending provisions (XI); Transitional and final provisions (XII).

Policy: Icelandic Maritime Administration Act (No. 6/1996, cf. Act No. 38/1997).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provisions with respect of the administration of maritime matters in Iceland. The Minister of Transport and Communications is responsible for centrally administrating navigation, maritime and harbour matters, except where otherwise decided in a different law and the Icelandic Maritime Administration shall be the principal supervisory body. The Icelandic Maritime Administration shall: represent the State in the implementation of the Harbour Act; supervise State-funded projects concerning coastal protection; supervise the implementation of legislation on control, measurement and registration of ships; assume responsibility for issues concerning legislation on measures against marine pollution and regulations issued pursuant to such legislation to the extent that they concern ships and their equipment subject to rules issued by the Minister for the Environment; monitor investigations of marine casualties and assist in such investigations and return reports on maritime court inquiries to the Director of Public Prosecutions, and carry out other tasks defined in article 3. There shall also be a Harbour Council and a Maritime Council, which shall act as an advisory body to the Minister. (8 articles)

Policy: Law No. IX-1381 on purchase of the plots of land.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates purchase of land by the foreign legal and natural persons, and also by foreign institutions and organizations that have no status of legal person but have legal capacity. It also establishes terms, conditions and restrictions on the purchase of land by foreigners. The Act consists of four Chapters divided into 17 Articles: (1) general provisions; (2) right of foreigners to purchase land, internal water and forest; (3) temporary provisions regarding the right of foreigners to purchase non-agricultural land; and (4) final provisions. Only foreign natural persons, legal persons and organizations residing or registered in EU Member States or Signatory States of the European Agreement (Association Agreement), NATO Member States shall be granted the right of purchase of land, internal water and forest. Public agricultural land, internal water and forest can be sold or otherwise granted to private ownership exclusively after the completion of land reform. Foreigners shall not be granted the right to purchase the following categories of land: (a) exclusive public land property; (b) biosphere reserves and protected areas; (c) agricultural land; (d) reserve land; (e) harbour land and territory of free economic zones; (f) mineral deposits; (g) seven kilometre wide coastal areas; and (h) borderland.
