Policy: What May Be Recorded - Chapter 31 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter defines certain matters relative to the recording of land. Any instrument or judgment affecting the title to or possession of real property may be recorded under this Chapter, provided, however, that deeds or grants conveying to a governmental agency, real estate, or any interest therein, or easements thereon, for public purposes shall not be accepted for recordation without the consent of the grantee evidenced by its acceptance attached to such deed or grant. Instruments and judgments to be recorded pursuant to this section shall be recorded by Department of Land Management. Other provisions concern recording of judgements.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Rights of Owners - Chapter 9 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter defines certain rights and owners of real property and tenants for life. The owner of a life estate may use the land in the same manner as the owner of a fee simple, except that he or she must do no act to the injury of the inheritance. Sections 2 and 3 of Article 1 define property rights of a Tenants for Years. Section 6 defines rights of lessees and assignees against his immediate lessor, for the breach of any agreement in the lease. Sections of Article 2 concern rights of owners to the surface and to everything permanently situated beneath or above land, boundaries of land or by water or by ways, relationship with owners of neighbouring estates, and the ownership of trees.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Termination of Estates – Chapter 5 of 21 GCA "Real Property".
Policy_Content: This Chapter provides for the termination of a tenancy or another estate at will and recovery of possession by the landlord. A tenancy or other estate at will, however created, may be terminated by the landlord's giving notice in writing to the tenant, in the manner prescribed by §21108 of this Title. The termination notice shall be of at least thirty days. Summary proceedings for obtaining possession of real property forcibly entered, or forcibly and unlawfully detained, are provided for in Chapter 21 of this Title. An action for the possession of real property leased or granted, with a right of re-entry, may be maintained at any time, after the right to re-entry has accrued, without the notice prescribed in §5103.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Transfer of Real Property - Chapter 4 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter regulates certain aspects (requisites, effect of transfer, form of grant, etc.) of the transfer of real property. An estate in real property, other than an estate at will or for a term not exceeding one year, can be transferred only by operation of law, or by an instrument in writing, subscribed by the party disposing of the same, or by his agent thereunto authorized by writing (sect. 1 of Article 1). Section 2 of Artcile 1 defines the form of grant of an estate in real property. Article 2 makes provision with respect of the effect of a transfer of a real property on easements, fee simple, and effects of conveyance of limited estate, conditional grants, grants with subsequent condition, and some other matters relating to transfer such as implied covenants, definition of boundaries, etc.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Accession to Real Property - Chapter 20 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter provides for title to accessory matters to land such as fixtures put on the land by others, new land formed by alluvium, river banks carried away by sudden violence, island formed in a stream which is not navigable, islands formed by division of a river. The Chapter also provides for removing of removable fixtures by a tenant.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Guam Waterworks Authority Act – Chapter 14 of 12 GCA “Autonomous Agencies”.
Policy_Content: This Act provides in article 1 for the establishment, powers and duties, organization, etc. of the Guam Waterworks Authority, in Article 2 for Guam Waterworks Authority Revenue Bonds and in Article 3 for a Drought Management and Comprehensive Water Conservation Plan. The Authority shall, inter alia, produce, treat, transmit, store, distribute and sell water, and collect, treat and dispose of wastewater (sect. 4). The Authority shall have a Board and a General Manager. Article 3 concerns a response to so-called El Nino” events of alternatively wet and dry periods and in particular a plan for the water supply and conservation system of Guam to react to prolonged shortage of water. The governor shall develop a long-term water resources management plan for these purposes. Provision is also made for the adoption of Drought Condition Standards and Low Groundwater Level Conditions and Severity Alert Phases, adoption of Rules and Regulations for improved water supply and conservation by the Guam Waterworks Authority and coordination by the Guam Environmental Protection Agency of groundwater monitoring. Article 4 concerns the outsourcing of waterworks by the Guam Waterworks Authority and related contracting and the establishment of a Water System Integration Working Group.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Institution,Waterworks,Groundwater,Water conservation zone,Water quality standards,Water shortage/drought,Water supply,Policy/planning

Policy: Unlawful Transfers - Chapter 41 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter makes provision with respect to unlawful transfers of real property in case of fraudulent transactions. Every instrument, other than a will, affecting an estate in real property, including every charge upon real property, or upon its rents or profits, made with intent to defraud prior or subsequent purchasers thereof, or encumbrancers thereon is void as against every purchaser or encumbrancer, for value, of the same property, or the rents or profits thereof. Other provisions concerning unlawful transfers are contained in Part II, Division Fourth, of the Code, concerning the special relations of debtor or creditor. Other provisions concerning unlawful transfers are contained in Part II, Division Fourth, of the Code, concerning the special relations of debtor or creditor.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Effect of Recording or of the Want Thereof - Chapter 37 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter concerns the recording of conveyance of real property and the effects of recording. The term conveyance embraces every instrument in writing by which any estate or interest in real property is created, alienated, mortgaged, or encumbered, or by which the title to any real property may be affected, except wills. Every conveyance of real property acknowledged or proved and certified and recorded as prescribed by law from the time it is filed with the Director of Land Management is constructive notice of the contents thereof to subsequent purchasers and mortgagees. Non-recorded conveyance shall be void pursuant to section 2. Power of attorney shall also be duly recorded but an unrecorded instrument is valid as between the parties thereto and those who have notice thereof.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Obligations of Owners - Chapter 11 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter defines the duties of tenant for life, coterminous owners, two or more persons are associated by agreement in the use of an asset belonging to a property, etc. The owner of a life Estate shall be required to carry out duties defines in section 1 with respect to the estate. Neighbouring owners are mutually bound equally to maintain the boundaries, monuments and fences between them. Section 3 regulates payment of expenses when two or more persons are associated by agreement in the use of a ditch, flume, pipe line, or other conduit for the conveyance of water, or who are using such ditch, flume, pipe line, or other conduit, or any part thereof, for the irrigation of land or for any other lawful purpose. Section 4 defines liability neglect to pay proportion of the expense.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Servitudes - Chapter 7 of 21 GCA “Real Property”.
Policy_Content: This Chapter defines and classifies servitudes and defines rights and obligations deriving from such land burdens. Easements, i.e. servitudes attached to land include: a) the right of pasture; (b) The right of fishing; (c) the right of taking game; (d) the right of way; (e) the right of taking water, wood, minerals, and other things; (f) and the right of having water flow without diminution or disturbance of any kind. Servitudes not attached to land include the right to pasture, and of fishing and taking game (sects. 1 and 2). A servitude can be created only by one who has a vested estate in the servient tenement (sect. 4). The extent of a servitude is determined by the terms of the grant, or the nature of the enjoyment by which it was acquired (sect. 6). Other provisions deal with apportioning easements, rights of owner, future estate, actions owner of the dominant tenement, actions owner of the servient tenement, how servitudes are extinguished.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Forest Renewal Program Regulations (P.E.I. Reg. EC189/96).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Forest Management Act. Policy: Environmental Audit, Assessment and Review Regulations, 1996.
Policy_Content: These regulations set out procedures for the proper preparation of environmental audit reports for existing and proposed projects that may result in the issuing of a environmental compliance certificate. Such certificate is issued by the Swaziland Environment Authority, and states that a proposed project under consideration is not likely to cause unacceptable environmental impacts and that the proponent shall manage the construction and operation of the project in accordance with an approved comprehensive mitigation plan. "Comprehensive mitigation plan" means a document containing a description of the mitigation measures to be implemented that would prevent, reduce or otherwise manage the environmental impacts of a project and done according to the reporting requirements of the Second Schedule. The Authority shall annually identify and maintain a list of projects which cause concern to the Authority, because of their impact on the environment and shall publish the list of such projects in its annual report. An operator of an identified or listed project is required to submit an environmental audit report and a comprehensive mitigation plan.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Land Acquisition Act (C.C.S.M. C. L40).
Policy_Content: This Act is divided into three Parts, as follows: Part I, Land Acquisition Branch; Part II, Land Value Appraisal Commission and Part III entitled General. The Land Acquisition Branch is continued under section 3 and is under the control and direction of the Minister. The Minister, through this branch, is in charge of all matters relating to the acquisition of land or to the expropriation of land by any authority. All costs incurred in the administration the Land Acquisition Branch, shall be paid out of the Consolidated Fund. Section 8 deals with acquisition and section 9 contains details on acquisition costs. Matters regarding expropriation can be found under section 10. The authority to sell buildings and improvements is provided for in section 12. The continuation and workings of the "Land Value Appraisal Commission" is set out in section 13. Compensation as a result of acquisition is dealt with in section 14. Finally section 17 deals with the Authority of a minister to delegate powers.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el funcionamiento del Comité Asesor de Política Forestal que, como ente asesor del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente, cumplirá entre otras con las siguientes funciones: a) formular recomendaciones tendientes a garantizar la coordinación e integración de las políticas forestales con las políticas de los demás sectores; b) coordinar la ejecución de las recomendaciones consagradas en los documentos aprobados por el gobierno que se relacionen con el recurso bosque; c) evaluar el cumplimiento de los planes y políticas relacionados con el sector forestal, proponer nuevas iniciativas y sugerir correctivos; d) coordinar con las ONG de carácter ambiental, con las comunidades indígenas y negras y con el sector privado la ejecución de las políticas públicas relacionadas con los bosques en cuanto sea necesario; e) apoyar y asesorar la puesta en marcha del certificado de incentivo forestal.

Policy: Indian Cut-off Lands Disputes Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 218).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for agreements between the Government and Indian bands (as defined by the Indian Act) for the purposes of resolving and extinguishing claims asserted by an Indian band and the council of a band against the Government or against the Government and Canada in respect of cut-off lands. "Cut-off lands" means lands that had before 1916 been appropriated by the Government for the use and benefit of Indians (defined in section 1). An agreement: (a) may include provisions for a disposition of land under the Land Act, a transfer of land to Canada in accordance with section 4 or a payment of money, or all or any of them, by the Government in respect of the cut-off lands claims, and (b) must include provisions for the release, discharge and extinguishment of all claims against British Columbia by present and future members of the Indian band and by the council of the band and its successors in respect of cut-off lands.

Policy: Land Rehabilitation Act (C.C.S.M. c. L50).
Policy_Content: This Act is divided up into three Parts as follows: Part I outlines provisions implementing acts of the parliament of Canada; Part II deals with control of tillage and Part III contains general provisions. Section 2 authorises the municipality to do any act contemplated or required to be done to secure the rehabilitation or development of any agricultural area within the municipality. A municipality is to develop within that area; systems; farm practice; tree culture; water supply; land utilization; and land settlement, that will afford greater economic security. In order to do so a municipality may pass the necessary by-laws. The municipality powers are set out in section 2, including the power to purchase or expropriate land. Section 3 deals with Pasture gateways, and section 4 contains provisions concerning the detention and disposal of stray animals found on pastures. The Lieutenant Governor in Councils' powers to arrange rehabilitation and development can be found in section 6. Section 8 provides that a municipality may by by-law, provide for the regulation and control of tillage practices that, are liable to cause rapid soil deterioration by wind erosion. By virtue of section 9, orders may be made, requiring a person occupying any land, to give effect to a by-law. Where a person fails to comply, the council may, by its agent, enter upon the land affected by the order and perform the required work. If the occupant of the land is the owner thereof, the cost of the work done shall be added to, and form part of, the taxes on the land, (sect. 10).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Landfill Tax - Chapter III of the Finance Act 1996.
Policy_Content: A tax, to be known as landfill tax, shall be charged in accordance with this Part. The tax shall be under the care and management of the Commissioners of Customs and Excise. Tax shall be charged on a taxable disposal. A disposal is a taxable disposal if: (a) it is a disposal of material as waste; (b) it is made by way of landfill; and (c) it is made at a landfill site as defined in section 66. A disposal is made at a landfill site if the land on or under which it is made constitutes or falls within land, which is a landfill site at the time of the disposal. The person liable to pay tax charged on a taxable disposal is the landfill site operator.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Lands (Customary Tenure) (Conversion) Regulations (Cap. 184).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern the procedure on conversion of customary tenure into leasehold tenure. A person: (a) who has a right to the use and occupation of land under customary tenure; or (b) using and occupying land in a customary area with the intention of settling there for a period of not less than five years; may apply for conversion to the Chief of the area where the land is situated in Form I as set out in the Schedule. Refusal of the request shall be communicated to the Commissioner of Lands in Form II. Where the Chief consents to the application the Form shall be referred to the Council in whose area the land that is to be converted is situated. The council shall consider whether or not there is a conflict between customary law of that area and the Act.	If the council is satisfied that there is no conflict between the customary law of that area and the Act, the council shall make a recommendation to the Commissioner of Lands in Form III as set out in the Schedule. The Commissioner of Lands shall accept or refuse to accept the recommendation, and shall inform the applicant accordingly. The council may also apply for in the interests of the community for the conversion of a particular parcel of land, held under customary tenure into a leasehold tenure. A person aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner of Lands may appeal to the Lands Tribunal.

Policy: Emergency Program Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 11).
Policy_Content: The present Act provides the legislative framework for the management of disaster and emergencies within British Columbia. This framework defines responsbilities of local authorities, provincial ministries and crown corporations along with the responsbility for the Province’s emergency management program. Policy: National Food and Nutrition Policy.
Policy_Content: The Goal of the present Policy is to improve the health and nutritional well-being of the total population through the consumption of nutrition foods. The Sub-goals and Targets are, inter alia to reduce the prevalence of sores, scabies and skin and eye infection of the general population; to reduce the incidence of an anaemia; to improve the dental health; maintain the current good nutritional status of babies, infants and school children with respect to growth and development.To reach these sub-goals there must be a steady supply of nutritious food which people do consume. For nutritious food to be accessible, it must first be produced and supplied (i.e. available) and affordable. Furthermore, people shall be educated to know which foods are nutritious. The food security and consumption patterns and nutritional status of the population must be assessed annually to determine the effectiveness of the Policy.

Policy: Ozone Layer Protection (Tristan da Cunha) Ordinance, 1996 (Ordinance T3 of 1996).
Policy_Content: This Ordinance prohibits, except with and in accordance with a licence granted by the Governor, (a) manufacture a controlled substance or product in Tristan da Cunha; or (b) import a controlled substance or product into Tristan da Cunha; or (c) export a controlled substance or product from Tristan da Cunha. “Controlled substance or product” means a substance or product whose manufacture in Tristan da Cunha or importation into or exportation from Tristan da Cunha is for the time being required, by or under or by virtue of a relevant agreement (Convention for the Protection of the Ozone Layer) provision, to be prohibited or controlled. Offences are defined and penalties are prescribed. The Governor may make Regulations necessary or convenient for the purpose of this Ordinance.

Policy: Aprueba el Programa de Pesca y Acuacultura 1995-2000.
Policy_Content: Considerando la situación del sector, sus obstáculos, potencialidades y oportunidades de desarrollo, el Programa de Pesca y Acuacultura 1995-2000 se desarrollará alrededor de cuatro objetivos globales, enmarcados en los lineamientos de protección al medio ambiente y desarrollo sustentable fijados por la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente, Recursos Naturales y Pesca y que son: a) alcanzar el crecimiento y desarrollo pleno y sostenido de la actividad pesquera y acuícola, a fin de lograr un aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos pesqueros sin afectar su capacidad de renovación y la calidad ambiental de los hábitats en que se encuentra, ello se hará extensivo a las actividades de procesamiento y comercialización; b) para ello se promoverá el uso sistemático de prácticas que eviten el deterioro y la eventual destrucción del ambiente y que combatan eventuales procesos de agotamiento de los recursos pesqueros. Este propósito se hace extensivo a las actividades secundaria y terciaria del sector e incluye el seguimiento de la aplicación de convenios internacionales en materia pesquera; c) ordenar las actividades económicas del sector para promover la aplicación de los criterios y compromisos establecidos en el Código de Conducta para la Pesca Responsable, de manera que se establezcan las bases para el tránsito hacia un desarrollo sustentable de la actividad; alcanzar y mantener un nivel de producción sustentable y respetuosa del medio ambiente, a través de un manejo y explotación óptimo de los recursos pesqueros, tanto en relación con las especies sobre las que se ejerce esfuerzo de pesca, como en términos de las técnicas utilizadas en la actividad; y d) promover de manera permanente el desarrollo económico y social de las actividades sectoriales.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea

Policy: Décret nº 96-043/P-RM fixant l'organisation et les modalités de défrichement, de classement et de déclassement dans les domaines forestiers de l'Etat et des collectivités territoriales.
Policy_Content: Ce décret fixe l'organisation et les modalités de défrichement, de classement et de déclassement des forêts dans les domaines forestiers de l'Etat et des collectivités territoriales. Tout défrichement est soumis à une autorisation écrite du représentant de l'Etat ou des organes exécutifs des collectivités territoriales après avis conforme de la commission de défrichement. Les articles 3 et 4 fixent, respectivement, la composition de cette commission quand il s'agit du domaine forestier de l'Etat ou de celui des collectivités territoriales. Tout défrichement est aussi soumis au payement d'une redevance et au respect des règles afférentes au mode de défrichement, à savoir: le respect des essences protégées, la coupe des autres essences rez-terre, l'interdiction de mettre feu au pied des arbres, arbustes ou leurs souches. Les articles de 12 à 24 réglementent les différentes étapes des procédures de classement et de déclassement, à savoir: la proposition de classement de la part du service chargé des ressources forestières; la reconnaissance générale de la zone par les représentants des villages riverains et du service forestier; la publication de l'avant-projet de classement; la réunion de la commission de classement qui détermine les limites de la zone à classer et fixe celles de la partie où peuvent éventuellement s'exercer les droits d'usage; l'arrêté de classement.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Afforestation/reforestation,Classification/declassification,Land clearing,Timber extraction/logging,Community management

Policy: Loi sur les constructions.
Policy_Content: L’article 1er de la présente loi règle de manière uniforme la réalisation, la transformation, la démolition, la reconstruction ainsi que l'entretien des constructions et installations et veille notamment à ce que ces dernières respectent les exigences relatives à la santé publique, à la sécurité publique, à la protection de l'environnement et garantissent la qualité du milieu bâti et de son environnement. En outre, elle assure le maintien, la protection et l'entretien des paysages, des sites et des monuments et observe les buts et les principes du droit fédéral et cantonal sur l'aménagement du territoire dans le respect de la propriété privée. Le texte comprend 60 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: But (1er); Instruments de planification, de construction, notions et portée (2); Conditions préalables à la construction (3); Exigences relatives aux projets de construction (4); Procédure d'autorisation de construire et police des constructions (5); Peines (6); Dispositions transitoires et finales (7).

Policy: Regional Law No. 289-OD "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the process of functioning of state bodies, local government, enterprises, institutions and organizations irrespectively of organizational and legal form thereof and the population, in the sphere of protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters. It shall have the following purposes: (a) determination of the jurisdictional competence of state bodies, local government and organizations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters with the consideration of geographic and climatic particulars of the regions; (b) prevention of the outbreak and propagation of disasters; (c) reduction of damages and losses caused by disasters; and (d) rehabilitation of the territory. Regional territorial subsystem of the national early warning system shall be responsible for data collection, processing and dissemination of the information related to disasters and timely information of the population thereof.

Policy: Law No. 12.532 providing for the State Policy of Irrigation.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 34 articles divided into eight Chapters, establishes the State Policy of Irrigation. The Irrigation Policy aims at the rational use of water and soil resources for the implementation and development of irrigated agriculture with the following conditions: priority of social function and public utility of water and irrigable land use; stimulation and greater security to agricultural activities, due to the adverse climatic conditions of the State of Ceará; promotion of conditions that can increase agricultural production. The use of water and soils for irrigation purposes is governed by Law No. 11.996 of 24 July 1992, which provides for the State Policy on Water Resources. The regime of water and soil use for irrigation purposes shall comply with the following principles: rational use of water and irrigable soils, giving priority to the use that ensures greater socio-economic benefit; planning of the use of water resources for irrigation by river basin, through integration with other sectoral plans, aiming at its multiple use and its adequate distribution; definition of duties of water users, aiming at the rational use of irrigation systems; compliance with the norms of prevention of rural salinization of the soils, as well as the protection of the environment and the good quality of the waters, aiming at the sustainable development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Loi cantonale sur les forêts.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour but d'assurer l'application de la législation forestière fédérale dans le canton et de mettre en place une organisation permettant de réaliser les buts fixés. Elle vise en particulier à: a) assurer la conservation des forêts du canton dans leur étendue, leur diversité et leur répartition géographique; b) amener et maintenir les forêts, en tant que milieu naturel, dans un état qui leur permette de remplir durablement leur fonction protectrice, économique, sociale et du maintien de la biodiversité; c) garantir la capacité de production des forêts, sur le plan de la qualité, de la quantité et de la diversité, par une sylviculture respectueuse de la nature en tenant compte des caractéristiques de la station; d) soutenir les propriétaires de forêts et l'économie sylvicole; e) promouvoir l'utilisation du bois indigène. Le texte comprend 89 articles répartis en 9 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Protection de la forêt (2); Organisation (3); Aménagement et gestion des forêts (4); Formation, vulgarisation, information (5); Dispositions financières (6); Voies de droit (7); Dispositions pénales (8); Dispositions transitoires et finales (9).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Resolución Nº 56/96 - Funciones y estructura de la Dirección Forestal en provincias y municipios.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución otorga facultades para estudiar y proponer la organización y estructura empresarial de las actividades de fomento, mantenimiento, protección, producción forestal y de la fauna cinegética que se ejecutan actualmente en las empresas forestales integrales, empresas municipales agropecuarias y otras empresas agropecuarias del país, segregando de éstas las actividades de carácter estatal, las que estarán a cargo de la Dirección Forestal y de los respectivos órganos provinciales y municipales (par. 1º). El párrafo 5º define, además de las funciones asignadas a la Dirección Forestal en la Resolución Nº 15-95, de 1 abril 1995, la elaboración, ejecución y control del plan director de reforestación a nivel de municipio, provincia y nación, y del programa para el desarrollo de los frutales en arboledas y en mezclas con plantaciones forestales, fundamentalmente con fines de autoabastecimiento.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Decree No. 1359 amending Decree No. 1254 establishing compensation to former landowners.
Policy_Content: This Decree amends Decree No. 1254 establishing compensation to former landowners. It consists of 9 articles specifying the compensations for: touristic areas, agricultural, occupied and non-occupied lands. The amendments concern: the procedure for issuing compensations, the required documents, the surface and price; priorities and the case in which such compensation is allowed.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.105 of 1996 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of determination of the boundaries of land tenure in urban construction.
Policy_Content: The Government, for the purpose of securing and transfer of the plots of urban land and the plots of land of other settlements on conditions of ownership, possession, lease of natural and legal persons, as well as for the purpose of their registration, taxation and transaction, decrees to validate the Regulation and to recommend the bodies of the local self-government to set up in case of necessity special commissions for the determination of the boundaries of land tenure. The Regulation is aimed at the solution of the following problems: 1). determination of the boundaries of the existing immovable property; 2). formation of the new lots of immovable property in the existing construction sites. Determination of the boundaries of land tenants (land survey) is carried out either of built-up territories or for territories subject to building in accordance with overall plan and projects of land use planning and building of towns and other settlements and other documents of territorial development. In the process of fixing boundaries of the existing built-up towns and other settlements from the boundaries of the plots of land are excluded territories on which are situated transport and engineering communications and the territories of common use.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Merchant Shipping Act (Chapter 179).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provisions for the registration and marking of ships and the certification of Singapore ships, provides for the ownership of ships and related matters, prohibits the pollution of water by ships and regulates navigation by ships in Singapore waters. The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore shall appoint a Director of Marine and a Deputy Director of Marine. Provisions on offences and penalties, and legal proceedings are also included.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea

Policy: Decree No. 81 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection is the authorized environmental institution carrying out the following tasks: (a) elaboration and implementation of the common state policy in the sphere of environmental protection and rational nature management; (b) the state control over the observance of environmental safety standards, use of surface water and groundwater, atmospheric air, animal and plant species, protected areas, minerals and peat, protection of soil, ozone layer and waste management; (c) provision of the population with environmental information; (d) international cooperation. The Ministry carries out the following functions: (a) environmental audit; (b) environmental monitoring; (c) registration of zoological collections; (d) authorization for the transfer of wild animals (except for fishes and aquatic invertebrates) to new habitats, for the use of wildlife for scientific, aesthetic and educational purposes, capture of rare and endangered animals for captive breeding; (e) keeping of Red Book; (f) issuance and annulment of the authorization for burial (storage) of domestic and non-domestic waste.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Uganda Export Promotion Board Act 1996 (Cap. 102).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Uganda Export Promotion Board as a body corporate and defines its objectives, functions and powers. The objectives of the board shall be to facilitate the development, promotion and coordination of all export-related activities that lead to export growth on a sustainable basis. The Board shall, among other things, provide technical advice on postharvest handling of exports.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regulations on rural credit co-operatives and associations.
Policy_Content: Rural Credit Cooperatives ('RCC') shall be established for the allocation, target use and repayment of the state resources. RCC shall be a legal voluntary entity established by "free and good will" of heads of families, heads of peasant farms and posses the Certificates for the Right to use land plots. RCC shall be established in accordance with the principle that every member of the cooperative enjoys the right: to be economic and business independent and self-financed and self-governed and to participate equally in its management. The second part of the Regulation deals with the organizational structure of cooperatives. Heads of families, heads of peasant farms wishing to establish RCC shall hold a foundation meeting and adopt the Charter (see Schedule 2) with obligatory participation of representatives of rayon land and agrarian reform centres. Rayon associations of RCC shall be established by the Chairmen of the RCC Boards located on the territory of given rayon. RCC and its rayon associations shall be entitled to assure timely allocation of the state resources subject to availability of land and livestock population, natural and climatic conditions and distance from the raw materials and distribution markets (Schedule 5). RCC and associations shall bear the responsibility for target and effective use of allotted state resources. (completed by 5 Schedules)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law No. 228 on protection of the atmospheric air.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that the purposes of protection of the atmospheric air shall be: (a) to ensure favourable environment; (b) conservation of air quality; (c) state supervision of atmospheric air of inhabited areas; and (d) enforcement of legislation in the sphere of atmospheric air. The Act consists of ten Sections divided into 36 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) rights and duties of citizens; (3) air quality rate setting; (4) economic mechanism of protection of the atmospheric air; (5) environmental audit; (6) atmospheric air protection requirements in the process of economic activity; (7) registration of emissions; (8) dispute settlement; (9) liability; and (10) international cooperation. The authorized state institution in the sphere of protection of the atmospheric air shall be the Ministry of Environmental Protection. Air quality standards shall establish: (a) maximum concentration of pollutants in the atmospheric air; (b) maximum emission limits for stationary and non-stationary sources; and (c) maximum limit of electro-magnetic pollution. Pollution of the atmospheric air by emissions shall be charged. Protection of ozone layer shall be carried out by reduction of ozone depleting substances.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Regional Law No. 4-OZ “On protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes organizational and legal provisions for protection of the population and land, water and air against natural and technological disasters, and mitigation of the consequences thereof. Regional early warning system shall be integral part of the national early warning system. Information of the population of natural and technological disasters shall be done with a view of risk assessment and reduction of damages from the outbreak of natural and technological disasters. Authorized state environmental institution shall be responsible for timely supply of reliable information, related to disasters, to the population.

Policy: Política de Bosques. Documento CONPES Nº 2834.
Policy_Content: La Política de Bosques es una política sectorial con alcance nacional desarrollada en 1996 por el gobierno de Colombia que tiene como objetivo general lograr el uso sostenible de los bosques, con el fin de conservarlos, consolidar la incorporación de sector forestal en la economía nacional y contribuir al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de la población. La Política presenta cuatro estrategias fundamentales para alcanzar sus propósitos: modernizar el sistema de admiración de bosques; conservar recuperar y usar los bosques naturales; fortalecer los instrumentos de apoyo; y consolidar la posición internacional.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Motive Fuel and Fuel Oil Approval Regulations (N.S. Reg. 21/96).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the Environment Act. “Motive oil” means a petroleum product used to power a vehicle, aircraft or vessel and includes gasoline and diesel oil, but does not include kerosene or fuel oil. “Fuel oil" means a liquid or gas derived from petroleum or natural gas and all liquids or gases containing any derivative of petroleum or natural gas that are produced, prepared, compounded, acquired, used or may be used for the purpose of generating heat or electrical power, and includes stove oil, furnace oil, bunker, heavy fuel oil, and any other petroleum or natural gas product, but does not include kerosene. For the purpose of the Act and these Regulations, motive fuel and fuel oil are designated as dangerous goods. The text consists of 17 sections.

Policy_Content: The present Regulation of the Council of Ministers, which is composed of 26 paragraphs, establishes detailed directions of activities of the Agency for Restructuring and Modernizing Agriculture and ways of their execution. In particular, the Agency provides financial support to agricultural investments concerning: improvement of production efficiency; better use of work resources; creation of raw material base for industrial cultivation; improvement of food production quality; enlargement of goods and services offer and its better adjustment to requirements of the national market and foreign markets; limiting environmental damages.

Policy: Agreement No. 2 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Krasnodar Territory regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Krasnodar Territory have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation and the administration of the Krasnodar Territory deal with issues regarding formation and realization of the coordinated programs of the development of agro industrial complex of the Krasnodar Territory, including social sphere, joint financing of costs for radical land reclamation and exploitation of inter-departmental land reclamation systems, increase of soil fertility, carrying out environmental protection, zoo veterinary and anti-epizootic arrangements, development of elite seed-growing and pedigree livestock breeding, plant protection, agro chemical service, carrying out scientific and research, projecting and construction and other types of activity within agro industrial complex. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation: shall take into account the interests of the Krasnodar Territory in the process of elaboration, introduction and financing of federal programs, large scale arrangements for the development of agro industrial complex aimed at state support of the producers of agricultural commodities, improvement of land relations, social development of rural area, development of agricultural machinery manufacturing, increase of soil fertility, production of hemp and its processing, prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, provision with the national and imported preparations, and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, issuing of authorization for their local manufacturing, formation of the system of marketing and infrastructure of the market of agro industrial complex; shall render assistance in the provision with seeds of highest reproduction elite species selected by scientific selection institutions, pedigree livestock from pedigree breeding centres of the Russian Federation and from abroad; shall allot annually financial funds for planting new perennial species, restoration of the perished ones and care of perennial species for the purpose of increase of production rates of vine, fruits, tea and subtropical species in the territory that is the main producer of the aforesaid species; shall allot financial resources on repayable basis and through tenders, including investments, for construction, extension, reconstruction and technical re-equipment of agricultural objectives, food and processing industries, construction enterprises, maintenance facilities and other objectives of agro industrial complex; shall render assistance in the provision of the regional enterprises of food and processing industries with raw materials, main and auxiliary components and combustibles and energetic resources. 3) The administration of the Krasnodar Territory: shall provide for stable development and increase of the efficiency of agro industrial complex under conditions of market economy at the expense of improvement of production and economic relations and productive forces, development of various forms of property and economic activity, rational use of land and other available resources; shall form regional food reserves; shall provide for delivery of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs of the coordinated amount to federal stock of foodstuffs at fixed purchase prices for local producers of agricultural commodities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement of 1996 between the Russian Federation and the Krasnodar Territory regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory.
Policy_Content: Authorised representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Krasnodar Territory have agreed on the following: 1). The State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory jointly are authorized to: a). establish the conditions for economic activity and use of natural resources on the territory of the Krasnodar Territory pertaining to health resorts (spa) and recreational areas; b). establish special types of land tenure on the territory of the Krasnodar Territory, ensuring conservation and rational use of the stock of land; 2). The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation and its State Bodies: a). elaboration with the participation of the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory of normative legal acts pertaining to the sphere specified in the paragraph 1; b). elaboration and validation with the participation of the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory long-term federal programs of social and economic development of the Krasnodar Territory, including improvement of ecosystem of the coastline of the Black sea and the Azov sea and social and economic development of health resort (spa) zones. 3). The state bodies of the Krasnodar Territory, for the purpose of implementation of the present Treaty, shall participate in elaboration and realization of federal programs specified in the paragraph 2 of the present Treaty.

Policy: Land and Environment Court Rules 1996.
Policy_Content: These Rules prescribe the general practice applicable to all proceedings to be commenced in the Land and Environment Court. They are divided into 18 Parts. Part 2 concerns the administration. In particular, it deals with the following matters: seal of the court, sittings of the court, vacation, registry, judges and assessors. Part 3 makes provision regarding the registrar, assistant registrar and officers. The documentation is to be kept or issued by the Registrar, which shall also retain custody of all documents filed in any proceedings, according to the provisions of Parts 3 and 4. Every matter or thing in relation to any proceedings which is required or allowed to be done by a party may be done by the party's solicitor. For this purpose, Part 5 regulates the appointment of the solicitor, the change of solicitor or agent, the cessation of a solicitor. Further provisions regulate the different phases of the proceedings in Classes 1-4 and the proceedings in Class 5 of the Court's jurisdiction. In particular, they deal with the following: Application of supreme court rules (Part 6); Commencement of proceedings (7); Service (8); Motions (9); Amendments of documents filed in the proceedings (10); Withdrawal and discontinuance of proceedings (11); Stay of proceedings and failure to prosecute (12); Rules applying only to proceedings in Classes 1-3 of the Court's jurisdiction (13); Rules specific to Class 4 proceedings (14); Decisions, judgements and orders of the court (15); Taxation and assessment of costs by the Registrar (16); Miscellaneous provisions (time for appeal, fines, Trans-Tasman proceedings) (17) ; Mediation available in Classes 1-4 of the Court's jurisdiction (18).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Rules commenced on 29 January 1996.

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 96-60 portant création de l'inspection de l'environnement de wilaya.
Policy_Content: Il est créé dans chaque chef-lieu de wilaya, une inspection de l'environnement. L'inspection de wilaya est l'organe principal de l'Etat en matière de contrôle de l'application des lois et règlements relatifs à la protection de l'environnement ou qui y ont trait. A ce titre, elle est chargée de: 1) concevoir et de mettre en oeuvre en liaison avec les autres organes de l'Etat, de la wilaya et de la commune un programme de protection de l'environnement sur l'ensemble du territoire de la wilaya, 2) délivrer les permis, autorisations et visas prévus par la législation et la réglementation en vigueur dans le domaine de l'environnement, 3) proposer toutes mesures tendant à améliorer le dispositif législatif et règlementaire ayant trait à la protection de l'environnement, 4) prendre en liaison avec les autres organes de l'Etat les mesures visant a prévenir et a combattre toutes les formes de dégradation de l'environnement et notamment la pollution, les nuisances, la désertification et l'érosion des sols, a sauvegarder et a développer la diversité biologique ainsi que le patrimoine cynégétique et a promouvoir les espaces verts et l'activité horticole.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 96-59 portant missions et organisant le fonctionnement de l'inspection générale de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les missions et d'organiser le fonctionnement de l'inspection générale de l'environnement, chargée de veiller à l'application de la législation et de la réglementation en vigueur, en matière de protection de l'environnement. A ce titre, elle est notamment chargée de: 1) assurer la coordination des services extérieurs de l'administration de l'environnement et de proposer toute mesure tendant a améliorer leur efficacité et a renforcer leur action, 2) évaluer périodiquement les mesures et les actions de contrôle et d'inspection effectuées par les services de l'environnement habilités a cet effet, 3) proposer toute mesure tant juridique que matérielle tendant à renforcer l'action de l'Etat en matière de protection de l'environnement, 4) effectuer des visites d'évaluation, d'inspection et de contrôle de toute situation ou installation susceptibles de présenter un danger pour l'environnement et pour la santé publique, 5) effectuer en cas de pollution accidentelle les enquêtes visant a déterminer les causes, a évaluer les dommages et a situer les responsabilités, 6) veiller a la mise a jour des systèmes d'alerte et de prévention des accidents de pollution susceptibles de porter atteinte à l'environnement et a la santé publique.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Law No. 2868 on subsoil and subsoil management.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to regulate subsoil management with a view to protect natural resources, to ensure the rational management and protection of subsoil. It covers exploration, mining, extraction of minerals and groundwater. The Act consists of ten Chapters divided into 76 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) competence of the executive bodies; (3) right of subsoil management; (4) repealed; (5) subsoil management contracts; (6) subsoil and environmental protection; (7) safety of the population and personnel; (8) state subsoil resources; (9) legal terms and conditions; (10) temporary and final provisions. Legal regulation of subsoil management shall be based on the following principles: (a) rationality; (b) subsoil and environmental protection; (c) reproduction of mineral resources; (d) chargeable use. Subsoil and minerals shall be the state property.  The government shall carry out the following functions: (a) management of subsoil; (b) conservation of the plots of subsoil; (c) validation of the list of minerals for extraction. Management of subsoil shall be subject to licensing which shall pertain to the competence of the authorized subsoil institution. Subsoil management licence can be provisional or permanent and shall be issued for the following operations: (a) geological study; (b) exploration; (c) mining; (d) exploration and mining. Exploration contract shall be concluded for the period of six year and shall be extended twice for the period of two years. Extraction contract shall be concluded for the period of 25 years and, in case of big or unique mineral deposits, for the period of 45 years and shall be subject to extension. Exploration and mining contract shall be concluded for the period of exploration and mining with the possibility of extension. Subsoil monitoring consists of subsoil protection against environmental pollution, water leakage, fires and negative impact on mineral deposits and environment.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree concerning investigating activities for the granting of the authorizations provided for by article 11 of Act of 10 May 1976, No. 319, and subsequent amendments, in matter of dumping in marine waters or adjacent areas, of materials deriving from the dredging of sea and brackish basins beds or of coastal emerged grounds, and also from any other handling of silts in the marine environment.
Policy_Content: This Decree is divided into 2 articles and 3 Annexes. It establishes the procedures for the issue of the authorization to discharging silts deriving from dredging operations in marine waters and adjacent areas, such as shores, brackish ponds and coastal zones. Paragraph 2 of Annex A prohibits the dumping in the sea of dredging materials that may be classified as toxic or noxious waste or that could create a hazard to the marine environment and the marine living resources. The authorization is issued by the Ministry of the Environment upon investigation by the competent authorities and is aimed especially at the chemical, physical and microbiological evaluation of such materials. Annex A deals further with the application modalities, the investigating activities, the issue, refusal to issue, withdrawal of the authorization, inspections, protected areas in which the dumping is forbidden. Annexes B/1 and B/2 concern modalities and technical requirements of the reports to be submitted in order to obtain the authorization.

Policy: Law No. ZR-29 on immovables.

Legal status of immovables regards also marine, fluvial-marine and fluvial vessels subject to compulsory state registration. The Law consists of 12 Sections composed of 31 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-2) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 3-8) establishes competence in the sphere of immovables and specifies subjects of ownership. Section 3 (arts. 9-11) deals with purchase and expropriation of immovables. Section 4 (arts. 12-15) regards rent (lease) of immovables. Section 5 (arts. 16-21) regards other rights related to immovables. Section 6 (art. 22) regards expropriation of immovables for the needs of society and state. Section 7 (art. 23) regards use of immovables pertaining to state property. Section 8 (art. 24) regards modification of the boundaries of a plot of land. Section 9 (arts. 25-26) regards registration and cadastre. Section 10 (arts. 27-29) regards cessation of the right of ownership and its protection. Section 11 (art. 30) regards dispute settlement. Section XII (art. 31) regards entry into force of the present Law.

Policy: Decree-Law No.1 of 1996 on Electricity and Water.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 10 articles aims at organizing duties and powers of the Ministry of Electricity and Water and states that it is responsible for the production, development, transmission, distribution and sale of electric power for all purposes, as well as the extraction, production, distillation, desalination, storage, delivery, distribution and sale of water for drinking, domestic, commercial and industrial uses. Except in cases of personal use issued by the Minister, it is prohibited to produce or distribute electricity and water except with a written license issued by the Minister. The Ministry determines as well (i) the electricity and water connection fees and draw up the tariff schedules for the consumption of electricity and water units in the various regions; and (ii) the prices of other electricity and water services. The Ministry officials are authorized to enter any place connected to electricity and water to verify the implementation of the provisions of this Law. The Ministry has the right to cut off electricity or water services, or both, after giving the consumer sufficient notice in the following cases (i) nonpayment of the fees; (ii) non-conformity of equipment, devices and internal installations with safety conditions; and (iii) establishment of internal extensions without a license from the Ministry.

Policy: Decreto Nº 117 - Ley Agrícola y Forestal del Estado de México.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se establecen las normas y bases para promover el desarrollo de las actividades agrícolas y forestales en el Estado de México. En particular la Ley busca fomentar el mejoramiento de las condiciones de la producción agrícola y forestal, mediante el aprovechamiento racional de los recursos naturales, la transferencia de los resultados de la investigación científica y técnica, la organización y capacitación de los productores, la elaboración de procedimientos de comercialización, el otorgamiento de estímulos para la producción y la promoción de obras de infraestructura y de inversiones. Además se regula la coordinación entre las autoridades estatales, municipales y las organizaciones sociales, así como la participación de los productores, en el proceso agrícola y forestal. La Ley también establece disposiciones en materia de protección fitosanitaria (sanidad vegetal y uso de agroquímicos). Por último se establecen las sanciones aplicables en caso de infracción.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 97 regarding validation of the Regulation of afforestation and reforestation.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation deals with application of forestry and agro-technical arrangements in accordance with environmental protection arrangements for the purpose of increasing the efficiency of afforestation and reforestation activity. The Regulation is compulsory for all permanent forest users. Permanent forest users must carry out afforestation and reforestation. Land formerly covered by forest plantation shall be subject to reforestation while land not covered formerly by forest plantation, land unfit for agriculture, low productive land shall be subject to afforestation. Afforestation and reforestation shall ensure the following purposes: 1) rational use of forest stock; 2) improvement of qualitative composition of forests, rising up the productivity and biological resistance thereof; 3) increase of water protection, land protection, sanitary and hygienic and other useful qualities of forests and protective forest plantations; 4) achievement of the optimal forestation by means of afforestation in the briefest period of time with the use of more economic means and technologies.

Policy: Order No.20 of 1996 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding validation of Model Regulations on state natural reserves and natural monuments.
Policy_Content: The Minister orders to validate Model Regulations on state natural reserves and natural monuments. Model Regulation on state natural reserves consists of VI Secs. State natural reserves are the territories (define areas of water) that have particular importance for the conservation and renewal of natural complexes or their components and maintenance of ecological balance. Declaration of a territory state natural reserve is authorized either with expropriation from land tenants, proprietors and owners of the plots of land. State natural reserves are subdivided into federal and regional ones. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II classifies the types of natural reserves. Section III establishes the modalities of setting up state natural reserves. Section IV establishes the status of special protection of the territories of protected areas. Section V regards protection of state natural reserves. Section VI regards control over the observance of special protection status of state natural reserves. Natural monuments are unique, irreplaceable, ecologically, scientifically, culturally and aesthetically valuable natural complexes, as well as the objects of natural and artificial origin. The document consists of VII Secs. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II specifies the main categories of natural monuments. Section III establishes the modalities of declaration of natural complexes and objects natural monuments. Section IV establishes special protection status of the territories where natural monuments are situated. Section V regards the use of natural monuments. Section VI regards state registration of natural monuments. Section VII establishes control over the observance of the special protection status of natural monuments.

Policy: Regulation on the complex state nature reserve of federal significance "Stone steppe".
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of federal significance "Stone steppe" is constituted for the purpose of conservation and restoration of environmentally protective anthropogenic agro-forest landscapes. The main task of the reserve shall be protection of natural complexes through state control over compliance with the established protection regime, coordination of the haymaking areas, coordination of felling in forest plantations and allotment of land plots for gardening and horticulture. Scientific research activity in the reserve is aimed at studying natural environment and long-term tracing of natural processes with a view of assessment and forecast of the ecological state of environment. The following activities shall be prohibited in the reserve: (a) all types of felling, except for clean cutting, sanitary felling and experimental restoration cutting; (b) movement of vehicles off the common use roads; (c) organization of encampments, rest halts and fire making outside authorized areas; (d) allotment of land plots for construction; (e) exploration and mining; (f) all types of hunting; (g) industrial procurement of medicinal and other plants, mushrooms, berries, fruits, seeds; (h) plowing of land outside arable land; and (i) stubble burning and agricultural burns.

Policy: Federal Law No. 7-FZ on non-commercial organizations.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal status, the modalities of registration, activity, re-organization and liquidation of non-commercial organizations as legal persons, formation and use of property of non-commercial organizations, rights and duties of their constitutors (participants), the grounds for administration of non-commercial organizations and the possible forms of their support by state institutions and local self-government. Non-commercial organization is such organization that has neither purpose of producing profit nor distribution of it between its members. Non-commercial organizations can be set up for the achievement of cultural, educational, scientific, administrative purposes and for the protection of public health (art. 2). Chapter 7 (arts. 33-34) lays down final provisions.

Policy: Agreement No. 10 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Sverdlovsk Region regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Sverdlovsk Region have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation: shall carry out coordination of the elaboration and realization of federal programs, introduction of large-scale scientific and technical innovative arrangements in all branches of agro-industrial complex of the Sverdlovsk Region; shall include the Sverdlovsk Region into common Russian centralised program of provision with pedigree cattle, sperm of pedigree sires, prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, carrying out scientific research in the field of veterinary, provision with the national and imported preparations and technical veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, issuing authorization for their manufacturing and trade; shall finance on account of federal budget federal special programs, scientific research, projecting, construction and technological activity of federal importance, development of material, technical and scientific basis of scientific institutions within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation; shall participate in crediting the Sverdlovsk Region for the purpose of setting up the regional stock of grain; shall credit agro-industrial complex, deliver machinery of lease and form material and technical basis and seasonal reserves. 2) The Government of the Sverdlovsk Region: shall provide for stable development of agro-industrial complex and increase of the manufacturing of agricultural commodities under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions on the basis of improvement of production and economic relations and productive forces, development of various forms of property and economic activity; shall render assistance in the development of enterprises and organizations of agro-industrial complex within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation; shall ensure rational utilization of funds allotted from federal budget.

Policy: National Forest Policy of Malawi.
Policy_Content: The goal of the National Forest Policy is to sustain the contribution of the national forest resources to the quality of life in the country by conserving the resources for the benefit of the nation. The general objectives of the policy are to satisfy the people’s needs, particularly those of the rural people who are the most disadvantaged. The general objectives will, therefore, aim at: allowing all citizens to have regulated and monitored access to some forest products; enacting legislation allowing to access to the use of forests and forest products, and promote equity and participation by local communities; contributing towards improving the quality of life in the rural communities and providing a stable local economy in order to reduce the degenerative impact on the environment that often accompanies poverty; establishing appropriate incentives that will promote community-based conservation and a sustainable utilization of the forest resources as a means of alleviating poverty, including on-farm trees, and fostering the growing of trees by all sections of the communities in order to achieve sustainable self-sufficiency of wood and forest-derived products;

Policy: Emergency Situation Act (1996).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the following to allow for implementation of necessary measures in the event of a natural disaster or catastrophe, or to prevent the spread of an infectious disease: 1) the basis, conditions and procedure for declaration of an emergency situation and the competence of public authorities responsible for responding to emergency situations; 2) the measures which may be implemented during an emergency situation and the rights, duties and liability of persons during an emergency situation. The Government of the Republic declares an emergency situation throughout the state or in a part thereof pursuant to clause 87 8) of the Constitution of the Republic of Estonia in the event of a natural disaster or catastrophe or in order to prevent the spread of an infectious disease. An emergency situation is declared on the condition that it is necessary to implement extensive measures, including rescue work, promptly in the event of a natural disaster or catastrophe, or in order to prevent the spread of an infectious disease, and that it is not possible to eliminate the danger or assist the victims without implementation of the measures provided for in this Act. The document consists of 5 chapters that contain 28 paragraphs. Chapter 1 (paragraphs 1-9) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (paragraphs 10-17) establishes procedure for declaration and termination of emergency situation. Chapter 3 (paragraphs 18-23) establishes competence of public authorities responsible for responding to emergency situation, measures to be implemented and duties of persons during emergency situation. Chapter 4 (paragraphs 24-27) establishes conditions for compensation and social guarantees for persons. Chapter 5 (paragraph 28) establishes liability.

Policy: Federal Law No. 4-FZ on land reclamation.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes the legal basis in the field of land reclamation, determines the authority of state executive bodies, local administrations as regards the regulation of the aforesaid activity and the rights and the duties of citizens (physical persons) and juridical persons that carry out land reclamation and provide for efficient use and protection of reclamated land. Land reclamation shall be intended radical land improvement by conducting hydrotechnical, land clearing, chemical, anti-erosion, agroforestry, agrotechnical and other reclamation operations and arrangements. Land reclamation systems shall be classified as public and common (general) use. Public land reclamation systems cannot be transferred in ownership to natural and legal persons. Depending on the nature of reclamation measures, shall be classified the following types of land reclamation: (a) hydromelioration; (b) agroforestry; (c) land clearing; and (d) chemical land reclamation. Objects of state monitoring of reclaimed land shall be all reclaimed land in the Russian Federation. Land reclamation arrangements shall be performed in compliance with the requirements of land, water, forest legislation of the Russian Federation, and also the legislation of the Russian Federation related to environment, subsoil, flora and fauna.The Federal Law consists of 9 Sections composed of 42 articles. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 specifies types and kinds of land reclamation. Section 3 concerns the ownership of reclamated land and separately located hydrotechnical equipment. Section 4 determines the authority of the Russian Federation, of the regional executive bodies and local administration in the field of land reclamation. Section 5 regards state management in the field of land reclamation. Section 6 establishes the modalities of land reclamation. Section 7 regards financing of land reclamation (legislative enactment of land reclamation). Section 8 deals with dispute settlement in the field of land reclamation and establishes liability for the infringement of legislation on land reclamation. Section 9 lays down the conclusive provisions.

Policy: Aprueba el Programa de mediano plazo, denominado Programa Sectorial Agrario 1995-2000.
Policy_Content: El Programa Sectorial Agrario 1995-2000 tiene como objetivos promover la seguridad jurídica de todas las formas de propiedad de la tierra; la certidumbre documental de los predios rústicos; avanzar en el desarrollo, bienestar y equidad para los campesinos; procurar justicia con respeto a los derechos agrarios; mejorar las condiciones organizativas en las que se desenvuelven las actividades sociales y económicas de los ejidos y comunidades; superar las limitaciones del minifundio; propiciar una justa y productiva circulación de los derechos agrarios y la propiedad rural; y ofrecer servicios institucionales de excelencia. El Programa, formulado por la Secretaría de la Reforma Agraria, para su ejecución promueve la consolidación de las funciones de coordinación sectorial con el fin de que los programas del sector agrario se integren y operen esencialmente a través de sus órganos desconcentrados y entidades paraestatales por ella coordinadas. El objetivo general es el de consolidar la nueva política agraria para que la propiedad de la tierra sea base del desarrollo agrario e influya, en forma determinante, en el incremento sostenido de la producción, productividad y rentabilidad en el medio rural y se traduzca en mayores ingresos, bienestar social y fortalecimiento de la calidad de la vida en comunidad.

Policy: Decree of the Minister of Forestry No. 12/Kpts-II/1996 re the obligation of forest concessionaires to provide and sell part of their production yields for regional development and/or community purposes.
Policy_Content: Indonesian companies that are holders of a forest concession granted by the Ministry of Forests shall be required to sell at least five percent of their production of sawn and other processed timber for regional development and community purposes. "Regional development and community purposes" shall be projects of public interest such as the construction of houses, public buildings, buildings for social and religious purposes, etc. The Forestry Service at regional level shall supervise and control the sale of timber in accordance with the present Decree. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 22 validating the Regulation on main felling in the mountain forest.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be compulsory for forest owners, timber cutters and other natural and legal persons. Mountain forests shall be considered forests growing within mountain systems with relative height of locality over 100 metres and with average degree of inclination over five grades, and also growing on mountain plateau and table irrespectively of the degree of inclination. The Ministerial Decree consists of 13 Sections dealing with: (1) general provisions; (2) timber extraction methods and techniques; (3) felling in the first category forests; (4) felling in the first category coniferous forests; (5) felling in the first category deciduous forests; (6) felling in the prohibited areas of the deciduous forests along the banks of rivers and water reservoirs, lakeside and the banks of other waterbodies; (7) felling in the second category forests; (8) felling in the second category coniferous forests; (9) felling in the second category deciduous forests; (10) ecological and forestry requirements for cutting area work; (11) use of felling debris and land clearing; (12) forest reproduction in the cutting areas; (13) liability. Main use felling must ensure: (a) forest conservation; (b) timely substitution of mature forest with underwood; (c) reproduction of the precious forest species in the cutting areas; (d) sustainable and inexhaustible forest management and rational use of forest land; (e) improvement of forest productivity. Trees and shrubbery of precious and rare species shall not be destined for main felling. In the protected areas, national parks and nature reserves shall be authorized only cleaning cutting and sanitary felling.

Policy: Loi nº 96/03 du 4 Janvier 1996 portant loi cadre dans le domaine de la Santé.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe le cadre général de l’action de l’Etat dans le domaine de la santé, notamment à travers la politique nationale de santé. La politique nationale de santé a pour objectif l’amélioration de l’état de santé des populations  grâce  à  l’accroissement  de  l’accessibilité  aux  soins  intégrés  et  de  qualité  pour l’ensemble de la population et avec la pleine participation des communautés à la gestion et au financement des activités de santé.  La politique nationale de santé s’appuie sur des grands principes, notamment: l’accessibilité universelle aux soins essentiels et de qualité à travers le développement des Districts de santé ainsi que d’un système « santé de référence contre référence » ; la protection et la promotion de la santé des groupes vulnérables et défavorisés, notamment les femmes, les enfants, les adolescents, les personnes du troisième âge, les indigents et les handicapés; ou la mise en oeuvre d’une politique de médecine préventive par la promotion de l’hygiène, l’assainissement de l’environnement, l’éducation sanitaire et la vaccination.
