Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Udmurtian Republic regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Udmurtian Republic have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation through Federal Executive Bodies shall carry out the following plenary powers in the field of development of agro-industrial complex of the Udmurtian Republic: to take into account the interests of the Udmurtian Republic as regards elaboration, financing and promotion of federal programs aimed at state support of the producers of agricultural commodities, social development of the countryside, development of agricultural machinery construction, increase of soil fertility, flax cultivation and processing, development of pedigree stock-breeding, prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, carrying out veterinary scientific research, improvement of land relations, formation of the structure of marketing and market infrastructure of agro-industrial complex; financing of the purchase of meat, milk and other agricultural commodities for federal needs; shall contribute to the delivery of raw materials, additives and components for the processing industry; to allot and deliver seeds of scientific selection institutions of the Russian Federation and foreign states. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Udmurtian Republic jointly: shall provide for the formation and realization of co-ordinated programs of the development of agro-industrial complex of the Udmurtian Republic; joint financing of the validated investment programs and of construction sites, expansion, reconstruction and technical re-equipment of the objectives of agriculture, food and processing industry of the Udmurtian Republic; expenditures for radical improvement of soil and exploitation of land-reclamation systems, improvement of soil fertility, environmental, veterinary and antiepizootic arrangements, development of elite seed-growing and pedigree stock-breeding, plant protection, carrying out research work, projecting and other activity in the field of agro-industrial complex. 3) The Government of the Udmurtian Republic shall provide for the development and increase of the efficiency of agro-industrial complex at the expense of rational use of land and other available resources; shall set up organizational and economic conditions for the improvement of production and economic relations, promotion of all types of property in agriculture; shall provide for rational use of finances and resources allotted by the Russian Federation; shall undertake measures for the delivery of agricultural commodities to the Federal Food Fund in accordance with the co-ordinated amount; shall finance republican programs of state support of the producers of agricultural commodities; shall set up regional food fund; shall organize inter-regional economic and scientific and technical cooperation in the field of agriculture; shall render assistance to the organizations and enterprises under the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation situated on the territory of the Udmurtian Republic.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Udmurtian Republic regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of ownership, management and administration of forest resources on the territory of the Udmurtian Republic.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Udmurtian Republic have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation provides for: a) determination of the main directions of state policy in the sphere of forestry; b) determination of the modalities of organization and functioning of state forest institutions; c) coordination of international cooperation as regards use, reproduction, protection and conservation of forest; elaboration of the federal programs as regards rational use of forest resources, increase of productivity, reproduction, conservation and protection of forests; d) organization of state registration of the forest resources, keeping state forest cadastre, forest monitoring and forest management; e) determination of norms and regulations regarding use of forest resources; f) fixation of forest fees; g) financing of forestry of the Udmurtian Republic; h) carrying out state control over the state, utilization, reproduction, protection of forest and determination of modalities for its application. 2) The Parties will carry out joint policy in the field of forestry on the territory of the Udmurtian Republic by means of: a) joint elaboration, financing and carrying out projects and programs in the field of forestry and rational use of forest resources; b) elaboration of proposals for the improvement of forest legislation; c) utilization of forest resources; d) determination of scientifically grounded dimensions of the use of forest resources; e) development and conservation of the network of state protected areas and national parks. 3) The Government of the Udmurtian Republic independently provides for: a) validation of the modalities of carrying out forest tenders; b) participation in accordance with the established modalities in elaboration and improvement of forest legislation of the Udmurtian Republic and other normative legal acts; c) decision-making regarding concession of the plots of the stock of forest in long-term and short-term use; d) elaboration and realization of regional programs aimed at the development of forest; e) financing out of republican budget republican programs; f) carrying out elaboration and realization of republican programs as regards rational use, reproduction, protection and conservation of forests; g) carrying out state control over the state, utilization, reproduction, protection and conservation of forests.

Policy: Act to amend the Maritime Traffic Act (No. 421 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The amendments of the principal Act are made as a consequence of the Act related to liability to oil pollution caused by ships being repealed, and the ratification of the Amending Protocol of 1992 of the International Convention on the Establishment of an International Fund for Compensation for Oil Pollution Damage, 1971. They concern liability of the shipowner for marine pollution (sect. 1 of Chapter 7); non applicability of limitations of liability (sect. 3 of Chapter 9); liability in general for oil pollution damages and in particular the establishment of a limitation fund and insurance against liability (Chapter 10); limitations on claims (sect. 1 of Chapter 19), offences (sect. 9(a) of Chapter 20); competent court (sect. 3(a) of Chapter 20); and enforcement and executive title (Chapter 21).

Policy: National Agricultural Policy.
Policy_Content: The National Agricultural Policy of Namibia is a multi-sectoral policy with the following objectives: achieve growth rates and stability in farm income, agricultural productivity and production levels that are higher than the population growth rate; ensure food security and improve nutritional status; create and sustain viable livelihood and employment opportunities in rural areas; improve the profitability of agriculture and increase investment in agriculture; contribute towards the improvement of the balance of payments; expand vertical integration and domestic value-added for agricultural products; improve the living standards of farmers and their families as well as farm workers; promote the sustainable utilization of the nation’s land and other natural resources’; and contribute to balanced rural and regional development based on comparative advantage.

Policy: Decreto Nº 883 - Normas para la Clasificación y el Control de la Calidad de los Cuerpos de Agua y Vertidos o Efluentes Líquidos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba las Normas para la Clasificación y el Control de la Calidad de los Cuerpos de Agua y Vertidos o Efluentes Líquidos. Se dispone que el Ejecutivo Nacional mediante Decreto establecerá la clasificación correspondiente a cada cuerpo de agua o sectores de éstos, y en estos podrán establecerse normas específicas sobre vertidos, de acuerdo con las especiales condiciones del cuerpo de agua objeto de la clasificación. Asimismo, podrá establecer un orden de prioridades para la clasificación de los cuerpos de agua, de acuerdo con la intensidad del grado de intervención o degradación de sus aguas. Los cuerpos de agua que no hayan sido objeto de clasificación se regirán por las disposiciones generales establecidas en este Decreto. El Ministerio del Ambiente y de los Recursos Naturales Renovables podrá diseñar planes maestros de control y manejo de la calidad de aguas específicos para cada cuenca hidrográfica en el territorio nacional, a los fines de mejorar la calidad de un determinado cuerpo de agua o de tramos de éstos.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal concernant les aides pour travaux forestiers en agriculture et en forêt.
Policy_Content: Le susdit règlement grand-ducal porte des dispositions relatives aux aides pour travaux forestiers en agriculture et en foret. Il prévoit la possibilité d'allouer des subventions pour travaux forestiers aux propriétaires de fonds agricoles et forestiers ainsi qu'aux collectivités publiques autres que l'Etat. Ne peuvent être subventionnés que les travaux effectués en zones vertes telles que définies par la loi du 11 août 1982 concernant la protection de la nature et des ressources naturelles. Le règlement fixe les montants des subventions en fonction des différents types de travaux. Ces travaux peuvent consister dans le boisement et reboisement, la conversion de taillis, travaux d’entretient, travaux de protection, mesures de conservation, voirie forestière, plan simple de gestion. Se entiende por madera en rollo, la materia prima forestal consistente en troncos de árboles derribados o seccionados, con un diámetro mayor a 20 centímetros en cualquiera de sus extremos, sin incluir la corteza, y una longitud superior a 240 centímetros. Policy: Loi fédérale en faveur des zones économiques en redéploiement.
Policy_Content: Dans les zones économiques en redéploiement, l'aide fédérale peut être accordée pour des projets d'entreprises industrielles ou d'entreprises de services proches de la production qui: a. Continuent de développer leurs produits, fabriquent de nouveaux produits ou introduisent de nouveaux procédés de fabrication et b. créent des établissements de production qui ne sont pas ou qui sont peu représentés dans la région. L'article 4 indique les conditions nécessaires afin que la Confédération puisse garantir sous forme de cautionnements des crédits d'investissement jusqu'à concurrence d'un tiers du coût total du projet. Une entreprise peut aussi bénéficier d'un allégement de l'impôt fédéral direct uniquement en complément d'un cautionnement ou de contributions au service de l'intérêt et lorsque le canton dans lequel est réalisé lui accorde aussi des allégements fiscaux en vertu de sa législation. Finalement, l'arrêté règle la compétence et la procédure, les voies de droit, le financement et l'exécution. L'arrêté comprend 11 articles.

Policy: Implementation of Decree No. 342 of the President of the Republic of Tajikistan on distribution of 50.000 hectares of land for personal use of the population.
Policy_Content: New land shall be distributed for personal use so that the total amount of land for personal use and irrigated additional land ads up to seventeen percent of the total of arable land. Before allocation of land, the local entities mentioned in article 2 shall monitor and register the existing irrigated lands and other data needed for allocation. Priority shall be given to small plots, and land that has not been cultivated for a long time and has a low productivity. Land shall be distributed by the Commission of land distribution, to be established through elections in regions, kolkhozes and sovkhozes. Land shall be distributed to members of farm brigades but not to private farms or members of a cooperative. The basis of the distribution of land shall be a long-term agreement between the director of a kolkhoz or sovkhoz, the local authority and the head of a family.

Policy: Concessions Act.
Policy_Content: "Concession" under this Act shall mean the granted special right to use objects which are public state property, as well as the granted permission to carry out activities for which a state monopoly is established by law. Concessions shall be granted for periods up to 35 years. The term of a concession may be extended but the overall term may not exceed 50 years. Concessions may be granted for objects such as: the waterfront beach strip, biological, mineral and energy resources of the continental shelf and in the Exclusive Economic Zone, the national aquaculture facilities and systems, waters of national significance including mineral waters, the water supply facilities and systems which are state property, forests and parks of national significance, as well as natural and archaeological reserves. Applications participate to a tender or. Applications. Applications participate to a tender or auction. Participants in the tender or auction may be Bulgarian as well as foreign citizens or foreign legal persons registered as merchants. Chapter IV regulates the contract of concession.

Policy: Electricity Supply Industry Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the office of the Regulator. The Regulator’s functions, powers and objectives include: administer the licensing system for electricity entities; monitor and regulate technical standards in the electricity supply industry; promote efficiency and competition in the electricity supply industry; and establish and maintain a safe and efficient system of electricity generation, transmission, distribution and supply. The Regulator must also issue the Tasmanian Electricity Code which shall provide for matters specified in the Act.

Policy: Décret nº 95-285 du 3 octobre 1995 portant réglementation des activités des sociétés cotonnières privées créées en partenariat avec la société nationale pour la promotion agricole (SONAPRA).
Policy_Content: Ce décret autorise la création et porte réglementation des activités des sociétés cotonnières privées créées en partenariat avec la société nationale pour la promotion agricole (SONAPRA). Il régit les relations entre ces sociétés et les différentes structures intervenant dans la filière-coton. Il est formé par 23 articles répartis en 6 chapitres, à savoir: Champ d'application (I); Production du matériel végétal, égrenage et distribution de semences (II); Commercialisation du coton-graine (III); Commercialisation des produits finis cotonniers (IV); Participation à la constitution des réserves de stabilisation et au financement de la recherche cotonnière (V); Dispositions générales (VI). La SONAPRA détient l'exclusivité de la commercialisation primaire du coton-graine auprès des producteurs et cède ce produit au prix de revient rendu usine. Elle répartit la production nationale de coton-graine, définit les normes techniques d'usinage nécessaires au maintien et à l'amélioration de la qualité du produit et détient l'exclusivité du classement de la production du coton fibre issus des usines.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Nº 10.800/95 - Por el cual se reglamenta el Impuesto a la Renta de las Actividades Agropecuarias.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación del Impuesto a la Renta de las Actividades Agropecuarias. En particular establece quiénes son contribuyentes, define el hecho generador, las rentas comprendidas, los gastos deducibles y los principios que rigen la liquidación y el pago. Las rentas comprendidas contemplan: la explotación de terrenos cultivados, arbustos, prados, pastos y vegetación espontánea, y los productos de ganado de renta, los productos del agua para riegos, la caza y la pezca, y todos aquellos derivados del suelo que no tengan carácter minero o forestal. Policy: Loi Cadre n°18-95 du 3 octobre 1995 - Charte des Investissements.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de promouvoir et faciliter les investissements au Maroc. Les mesures prévues par cette charte tendent à l’incitation à l’investissement par: la réduction de la charge fiscale afférente aux opérations d’acquisition des matériels, outillages, biens d’équipement et terrains nécessaires à la réalisation de l’investissement; la réduction des taux d’imposition sur les revenus et les bénéfices; l’octroi d’un régime fiscal préférentiel en faveur du développement régional; le renforcement des garanties accordées aux investisseurs en aménageant les voies de recours en matière de fiscalité nationale et locale; la promotion des places financières offshore, des zones franches d’exportation et du régime de l’entrepôt industriel franc; et une meilleure répartition de la charge fiscale et une bonne application des règles de libre concurrence, notamment par la révision du champ d’application des exonérations fiscales accordées. Conformément au document, ces mesures tendent également à: encourager les exportations; promouvoir l’emploi; rationaliser la consommation de l’énergie et de l’eau; et protéger l’environnement.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations, 1995.
Policy_Content: Regulations to make provision for criteria of assessment of environmental impact of "undertakings" as defined in regulation 2 and the procedures of such assessment and for the appointment of a National Environmental Appraisal Committee. "The criteria and procedure under these Regulations and any procedures approved by the Minister shall be used to determine whether an activity is likely to significantly affect the environment and is therefore subject to an environmental impact assessment". All persons, agencies or institutions, whether public or private, shall submit projects or activities to the Department for determination whether such project or activity would require an EIA (reg. 3). Regulation 5 specifies the minimum content of an EIA. Regulation 18 provides for public participation during the EIA process. Contents of an EIA report are prescribed by regulation 19. Policy: Standards for the Classification of Land as a Farm Regulation (B.C: Reg. 411/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Assessment Act. The Regulation lays down provisions relating to the standards for the classification of farm land. In particular, section 4 establishes that the assessor must classify as farm all or part of a parcel of land used for: a) primary agricultural production, b) a farmer's dwelling, or c) the training and boarding of horses when operated in conjunction with horse rearing.2) Land will only be classed as farm where part of a parcel or parcels of land are: a) necessary to the farm, and b) predominantly used for primary agricultural production. The text consists of 11 sections as follows: Interpretation (1); Application of this Regulation (2); Application for classification of land of a farm (3); Classification of land as a f arm (4); Gross annual value requirements (5); Exception for requirements for sale of primary agricultural products (6); Classification of lease land (7); Classification as a developing farm (8); Packing house (9); Reporting requirements (10); Repealed (11). Policy: Development Facilitation Act, 1995 (No. 67 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns implementation of reconstruction and development programmes and projects in relation to land. Section 3 sets out general principles that apply to all land development: (a) policy, administrative practice and laws should provide for urban and rural land development and should facilitate the development of formal and informal, existing and new settlements; (b) policy, administrative practices and laws should discourage the illegal occupation of land, with due recognition of informal land development processes; (c) policy, administrative practice and laws should promote efficient and integrated land development in that they- promote stated objectives, etc. These principles apply throughout the Republic, shall also apply to the actions of the State and a local government body and serve to guide the administration of any physical plan, transport plan, guide plan, structure plan, zoning scheme or any like plan or scheme administered by any competent authority in terms of any law. Section 4 contains general principles for decision-making and conflict resolution. There is established a legal person to be known as the Development and Planning Commission under section 5. A tribunal is hereby established for each province in each case to be known as the development tribunal of the province concerned (sect. 15). Such tribunal shall deal with matters arising from this Act. A Premier may establish a development appeal tribunal for each province under section 24. Land development objectives may be set by the authorities outlined in section 27 and in accordance with section 28. Section 48 and following sections provide for land development procedures including procedures relating to the development of small-scale farming. (69 sections divided into 8 Chapters and completed by one Schedule)

Policy: Regional Law No. 7-175 “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates management of protected areas of regional and local significance with a view of conservation of unique and typical ecosystems, wild flora and wild fauna species, genetic resources thereof and ecological education of the population. Protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; (e) health resorts; (f) protected wetlands; green belts; (g) water protection areas; and (h) urban forests. Expropriation of land under protected areas shall be prohibited (art. 1). Institution of protected areas can carried out either with or without expropriation of land (art. 5). Some categories of protected areas can be conceded on contractual basis to scientific research institutions for permanent (open-ended) management or for the period of no less than 25 years (art. 6).

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 209 of 1995 obligating industrial and commercial organizations and others to apply environmental regulations as stated in environmental permits.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision is composed of 3 articles. Article 1 states that every industrial, commercial or other kind of establishment is obliged to abide by the stipulations outlined in the environmental permit issued for it. The General Director of Environmental Affairs, the General Director of Environment of the Governorate of Dhofar, and the Directorate of Environmental Affairs in the Directorate General of Regional Municipalities in the regions and the Environmental Inspectorate, are all to enforce the provisions of this Decision. Anyone who hinders their carrying out the obligations of their duties or opposes them is to be banned. Those who contravene the environmental stipulations of article 1 are to be punished by a fine of 100 Omani Riyals (OR). If, after 25 days, the violator continues to contravene, he will be fined 50 OR a day for a period not exceeding 3 weeks, after which the establishment is to cease operations until the cause of the violation is dealt with. If there is danger to the environment or harm to public health, the Ministry can remove the violation at the expense of the violator.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 24.124 - Plan de uso del suelo para el Departamento de Santa Cruz.
Policy_Content: El Decreto, que consta de 9 artículos, aprueba el Plan de uso del suelo para el Departamento de Santa Cruz. El plan establece las siguientes categorías generales de uso: a) tierras de uso agropecuario intensivo; b) tierras de uso agropecuario extensivo; c) tierras de uso agrosilvopastoral; d) tierras de uso forestal; e) tierras de uso restringido; e) áreas naturales protegidas (art. 2º). A los efectos de cumplimiento del plan se distinguen dos tipos de reglas: a) reglas de intervención, que fijan las recomendaciones de manejo y establecen restricciones a las intervenciones de acuerdo a la aptitud y potencialidad de los recursos naturales y los ecosistemas; b) reglas de uso, que definen el uso para el cual serán destinadas las distintas áreas considerando y recomendando las técnicas y medidas de conservación y aprovechamiento del suelo necesarias para evitar el deterioro de su capacidad productiva (art. 3º). El presente Decreto crea la Oficina técnica del Plan de uso del suelo del Departamento de Santa Cruz, bajo dependencia de la Corporación Regional de Desarrollo de Santa Cruz, encargada de su cumplimiento, control y seguimiento (art. 4º).

Policy: Decree No. 179 implementing the Agricultural Producer's Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates in detail the matters dealt with in the Agricultural Producer's Protection Act. Chapter I sets out general provisions. Chapter II determines the terms of application of protected purchase prices and forecast prices. Chapter III regulates the contracts to be stipulated between agricultural producers and the State Agricultural Fund, and the purchase of agricultural products at protected purchase prices. Chapter IV provides provisions regarding the organization and operation of the State Agricultural Fund. Financial and economic activities of the State Agricultural Fund are regulated in Chapter V. Chapter VI deals with the establishment and maintenance of the information system operated by the Fund. According to Chapter VII, regional agricultural services shall be established as authorities of the national administration. Chapter VIII regulates the export and import of agricultural products. The regime may include some temporary restriction for the purposes of protecting Bulgarian agricultural producers, preventing shortages of agricultural products of primary importance, protecting of consumers, and ensuring national physical balances of agricultural products for which protected purchase prices and forecast prices have been determined.

Policy: Proclamation to Provide for the Establishment of the Eritrean Standards Institution, No. 75 of 1995
Policy_Content: This law establishes the Eritrean Standards Institution as an autonomous body with legal personality as the sole organ whose purpose is for the standardization, quality assurance and metrology activities throughout the country. The Institution has the powers to; prepare compulsory Eritrean Standards relating to products, practices and processes in the economic sector and follow up the implementation of same; revise said standards from time to time as necessary; waive temporarily the enforcement of compulsory Eritrean Standards where necessary; affix the standards mark to products which conform to Eritrean Standards; examine or test products to ensure conformity to Eritrean Standards and conduct study and research for this purpose; certify import and export products which conform to Eritrean Standards; inspect and certify the conformity of measuring instruments to Eritrean Standards and seize those which do not conform; enter into factories, business premises or other relevant places to ensure, by inspection and investigation, whether products, practices and processes conform to Eritrean Standards, among others.  The law provides that the International System of Units is adopted as the legal system of measurements in Eritrea and that the institution shall have custody of the National Etalons to maintain the traceability of measurement and the system of units specified within the law. The law places and obligation on traders and producers to provide free of charge information and samples to the Institution upon request. The law also provides for the administration and composition of the Institution.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Agricultural Credits Act (Cap. 224).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with rights relating to credit for agriculture. A charge, lien or assignment may be created on farming stocks and additional assets in accordance with section 3. “Farming stock” and “additional asset” is defined in section 2. An agricultural charge may be fixed or floating, or both and may be in form and made upon such conditions as the parties to the charge may agree. A farmer, may, individually or in association, create in favour of any person a charge on any farming stock, additional asset or other agricultural asset security for: (a) inputs or other items required for cultivation; (b) sums advanced or to be advanced to the farmer; or (c) sums paid or to be paid on the farmer's behalf under any guarantee; and such security may also cover interest, commission and charges thereon. Section 4 defines effects of a fixed charge. A fixed charge shall confer on the holder the rights specified in that section. Section 5 defines a floating charge and its effects. Agricultural charges may be registered with the Registrar of Agricultural Charges under section 8. Sections 11 and 12 deal with validity of contracts for the advancement to a farmer of inputs or other items required for cultivation. Sections 13 and 14 provide for arbitration under the Arbitration Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Lands Act, 1995 (Cap. 184).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the continuation of leaseholds and leasehold tenure as well as for the continued vesting of all lands in the President who has the power of alienation (land held under customary tenure is subject to certain conditions) (sect. 3). It also provides for the statutory recognition and continuation of customary tenure (sect. 7), for the conversion of customary tenure into leasehold tenure (sect. 8) and establishes a Land Development Fund and Lands Tribunal (Parts III and IV). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law, instrument or document, but subject to this Act, all land in Zambia shall vest absolutely in the President and shall be held by him in perpetuity for and on behalf of the people of Zambia. The President may alienate land vested in him to any Zambian. The President shall not alienate any land situated in a district or an area where land is held under customary tenure. Any person aggrieved with a direction or decision of a person in authority may apply to the Lands Tribunal for determination (sect. 15). (32 sections)

Policy_Content: The present Decree regulates the administration of forest products in the territory of Java. It is divided into the following Chapters: General Provisions (I); The Implementation of the Administration of Forest Products (II); Forest Safeguarding/protection, Examination and Supervision (III); Sanctions (IV); Transitional Provision (V); Closing Provisions (VI). The State Public Corporation of Forestry (Perum Perhutani), Forestry Services, other government agencies, privately-owned companies and individuals in the territory of Java shall be obligated to implement the administration of forest products (art. 2). The latter shall include the control of (a) the picking of forest products, (b) timber and non-timber production and transaction. The transportation of timber and non-timber products shall be accompanied by a Transportation List, indicating the quantity, volume and type of products to be transported.

Policy: Law No. 12.488 establishing the State Policy on Forestry.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 49 articles divided into sixteen Chapters, establishes the State Policy on Forestry. The Policy aims at the adequate and rational sustainable use of forestry resources, aiming at improving the quality of life of the population and promoting the socio-economic, conservation and preservation of the environment. The specific objectives of the Policy are: identify, implement, manage and maintain a state system of protected areas in order to protect biological communities representative of natural forestry ecosystems; promote the development of research and technologies on forestry; plan and rationalize forestry activities; encourage forestry management, agroforestry and reforestation of forestry species for multiple use; carry out the power of forestry inspection whether in public or private areas; create programmes of environmental rehabilitation, through afforestation, reforestation, forestry management and agro-silvopastorism activities; promote the conservation, protection and recovery of soils, water resources and biological diversity as well as degraded areas, especially in the areas of permanent preservation and protect areas threatened with degradation; establish protection programmes to prevent and control pests, diseases and forest fires; monitor rare or endangered species; integrate forestry actions with other environmental agencies and entities that operate in the State, etc.

Policy: Provincial Act No. 11 setting up the Provincial Agency for the Protection of the Environment.

Article 2 defines the powers and duties of the Agency, which cover: (a) technical functions related to inspection and controls to be performed on physical, chemical and biological agents for the purposes of the protection of air, waters and soil against pollution; (b) installation and management of environmental monitoring nets; (c) project and management of the provincial information system relative to the environment; (d) technical and scientific assistance; (e) promotion of research and studies. Policy: Environment Law No. 12 of 1995.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 36 articles: title and date of entry into force (art. 1); terms and definitions (art. 2); establishment of the General Administration for the Environmental Protection (art. 3); the main objective of the General Administration is environmental protection (art. 4); competencies and duties of the General Administration, i.e. preparation of the general policy for environmental protection, pollution control, preparation of environmental standards, research, control of industrial activities, environmental standards, conditions and environmental standards for agricultural, commercial, industrial and housing projects, classification, rules on the storage and circulation of dangerous materials, creation of protected zones, preparation of emergency and disaster-facing plans (art. 5); the Council of Environmental Protection is formed by the Minister of Municipality Affairs and Environment as President and 21 members from different ministries and administrations (art. 6); the Council has to meet once every two months (art. 7); competencies of the Council: approval of the general policy for environmental protection, environmental standards and the budget, proposals for environmental laws and regulations and approvals of emergency plans to face national disasters (art. 8); the General Administration is the competent authority for environmental protection (art. 9); the General Administration has to strengthen cooperation between Jordan and the international and regional environmental organizations (art. 10); competencies of the Director-General (art. 11); income and financing of the General Administration (art. 12); establishment of the Fund for Environmental Protection (art. 13); the income of the Fund (art. 14); the General Administration decrees the necessary provisions for environmental impact assessment (art. 15); provisions on water and atmospheric pollution, flora and fauna (art. 16); the General Administration decrees standards for water and water pollution control (art. 17); the General Administration must control soil pollution, desertification and the exploitation of the continental shelf (art. 19); treatment and classification of waste (art. 20); requirements and descriptions of protected zones (art. 21); inspection and control of projects, industries, etc. by the Director-General (art. 22); transgressors will be punished with the payment of (10.000) dinars, or at least one year imprisonment (art. 24); noise and vibration standards (art. 27); owners of industries, vehicles and construction sites must be provided with equipment for the control and reduction of pollution (art. 28).

Policy: Constitution of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
Policy_Content: The Republic of Kazakhstan proclaims itself a democratic, secular, legal and social state whose highest values are an individual, his life, rights and freedoms (Article 1). Human rights and freedoms in the Republic of Kazakhstan shall be recognized and guaranteed in accordance with this Constitution (Article 11). The Republic of Kazakhstan shall recognize and by the same token protect state and private property. The land and underground resources, waters, flora and fauna, other natural resources shall be owned by the state. The land may also be privately owned on terms, conditions and within the limits established by legislation (Article 6). Citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan may privately own any legally acquired property. Property, including the right of inheritance, shall be guaranteed by law Article 26). The Constitution consists of 98 Articles divided into IX Sections: General Provisions (I); The Individual and Citizen (II); The President (III); Parliament (IV); The Government (V); The Constitutional Council (VI); Court and Justice (VII); Local public administration and self-administration (VIII); and Concluding and transitional provisions (IX). Citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan shall have the right to protection of health (Article 29). The state shall set an objective to protect the environment favourable for the life and health of the person. Officials shall be held accountable for the concealment of facts and circumstances endangering the life and health of the people in accordance with law (Article 31). Parliament shall have the right to issue laws that regulate the most important public relations, establish fundamental principles and standards dealing with: 1) civil freedoms and rights; 2) conditions of ownership and other rights of property; 3) healthcare and social provision; and 4) environmental protection (Article 61).

Policy: Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Buryatya regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Republic of Buryatia.
Policy_Content: Authorised representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Republic of Buryatia have agreed on the following: 1) The relations between State Bodies of the Russian Federation and State Bodies of the Republic of Buryatia shall be governed by the Constitution of the Russian Federation, the Constitution of the Republic of Buryatia and the present Treaty. 2) The Russian Federation and the Republic of Buryatia jointly are authorized to administer the following issues: a) establishment of conditions for economic activity and nature management on the territory of the Republic of Buryatia adjacent to the Baikal lake; b) elaboration and validation of the federal programs of the development of the zone of Baikal-Amur main line situated on the territory of the Republic of Buryatia. The Russian Federation adopts federal laws regarding the aforesaid issues of joint jurisdiction on the basis of which the Republic of Buryatia carries out its proper legal regulation. 3) Bodies of state power of the Russian Federation are authorized to: a) elaborate and adopt federal law on Baikal lake and other legal acts regarding establishment of special conditions of nature management and environmental protection of the Baikal region; b) elaborate and validate long-term federal programs regarding protection, renewal and improvement of Baikal region. 4) Bodies of state power of the Republic of Buryatia within the limits of their jurisdiction are entitled to: a) apply federal legislation on Baikal, adopt on its basis normative legal acts and carry out control over their observance; b) elaborate and validate long-term federal programs regarding protection, renewal and improvement of Baikal region; c) favour conclusion of the regional ecological agreements concerning Baikal region.

The Regulations set out requirements additional to present regulations governing the transport of dangerous goods as laid down in the Merchant Shipping (Dangerous Goods) Rules, 1992 (S.I. No. 391 of 1992). Principally, the Regulations: designate the Irish Marine Emergency Services (IMES) of the Department of the Marine as the National Competent Authority for the purposes of these Regulations; designate the Harbour Masters of named Irish ports as Local Competent Authorities for the purposes of these Regulations; require that vessels carrying dangerous or polluting goods coming from outside the Community notify the relevant Local Competent Authority of their intended arrival; require that vessels carrying dangerous or polluting goods leaving a Community port notify the relevant Local Competent Authority; require that vessels bound for or leaving a Community port which carry dangerous or polluting goods and which stop at an anchorage within the territorial waters of the State but not within the jurisdiction of a port, shall provide IMES with information on the goods carried; and provide for the collation and dissemination of information, where warranted, on the movement of dangerous or polluting goods and/or any incidents involving such goods.

Policy: Loi Nº 95-017 portant Code du Tourisme.
Policy_Content: La présente loi, constituant Code du Tourisme, fixe les règles qui sont de nature à favoriser le développement intégré, ordonné durable et harmonieux du tourisme, aussi bien dans le cadre de l'aménagement du territoire national que dans celui de la sauvegarde de l'environnement. Ce développement doit respecter les éléments de notre identité nationale et de nos coutumes. Les dispositions de la présente loi s'appliquent à toutes personnes physiques ou morales pour le développement et la promotion du tourisme et qui sont: les organismes et/ou les entreprises intervenant pour l'aménagement et la gestion des zones d'intérêt touristique; les opérateurs touristiques; et les personnes exerçant des activités connexes, telles que le guide, le guide-interprète, l'accompagnateur ou le service traiteur. Policy: Décret nº 95-531/PM fixant les modalités d'application du régime des forêts.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte application de la loi nº 94-01 du 20 janvier 1994 portant régime des forêts, de la faune et de la pêche, notamment en ses dispositions relatives à la protection de la nature et de la biodiversité ainsi qu'au forêts. Le décret comprend 151 articles répartis en 10 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales: définitions et modalités d'exécution des études et travaux nécessaires à la mise en oeuvre de la politique forestière par des organismes différents du gouvernement (établissements publics, bureaux étrangers, populations riveraines et associations professionnelles) (I); Protection de la nature et de la biodiversité (feux, défrichement, mise en défens, mesures conservatoires diverses) (II); Domaine forestier national, permanent et non permanent (III); Inventaire et aménagement des forêts (IV); Exploitation des forêts (V); Récupération, industrie et commercialisation des produits forestiers (VI); Dispositions financières et fiscales (VII); Suivi, contrôle de l'exploitation forestière et répression des infractions (VIII); Dispositions diverses: prises de participation, sous-traitance et quotas (IX); Dispositions transitoires et finales (X).

Policy: Resolución Nº 098/95/DGF/MIRENEM - Manual de procedimientos para el otorgamiento del certificado de protección del bosque.
Policy_Content: El Certificado de Protección del Bosque (CAFMA 2000) tiene como objetivo principal contribuir al incremento del área y a la permanencia del bosque natural en aquellas zonas cuya función principal es la protección del recurso hídrico para consumo humano, así como en las áreas protegidas y en los corredores biológicos prioritarios definidos por el Ministerio de Recursos Naturales, Energía y Minas (MIRENEM); asimismo, se propone reducir, evitar o fijar emisiones de gases con efecto invernadero, atribuibles a la conservación del bosque incentivado. El Certificado de Protección del Bosque (CAFMA 2000), que es una especialidad del Certificado de Abono Forestal, es un título valor nominativo emitido por la Dirección General Forestal en favor de todo aquel solicitante que cumpla con los requisitos establecidos en el presente Manual.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Governmental Order No. 456 regarding validation of the list of lines of activities subject to special permit (licence) and institutions authorized to issue such permits (licences).
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Internal Affairs is entitled to supervise over production, trade and repair of hunting and sporting weaponry. The Ministry of Housing Facilities and Public Utilities is entitled to carry out activity regarding operation and maintenance of networks, constructions, structures and equipment facilities of water supply, sewerage and water allotment services. The Ministry of Forestry is responsible for logging, soft resin procurement, sap procurement, sawing and planing production. The Ministry of Emergencies and protection of population from the Consequences of the Disaster at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Station is responsible for control and monitoring of radioactive contamination of the environment, alimentary products and household articles. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection is responsible for marketable procurement (purchasing) of wild growing plants/herbs (their parts), mushrooms, technical and official raw materials of vegetable origin, their industrial processing and trade, and utilization of wild animals (with the exception of fish stock). The Committee for Fish Resources Protection is entitled to carry out activity in the sphere of marketable fisheries and catch of aquatic invertebrates, as well as the organization of artisanal fishing on a payment basis. The State Committee on Land Resources, Geodesy and Cartography is responsible for establishment (reconstruction) of land plot borders for owners, landowners and land tenants, as well as protected territories, fulfilment of topographic and geodetic, cartographic and air-photographic works, as well as editing of maps. The Ministry of Agriculture and Foodstuffs is responsible for veterinary practices, production of alcoholic beverages and tobaccos, prevention of animal disease, processing and handling of fish and meat products, and milk.

Policy: Federal Law No.147-FZ of 1995 on natural monopolies.
Policy_Content: The present Federal Law determines legal basis of federal policy as regards natural monopolies in the Russian Federation and is directed to the achievement of the balance between the interests of the consumers and subjects of the natural monopolies, ensuring accessibility to the consumers of produce and efficient functioning of the subjects of natural monopolies. The document consists of VI Chapters that contain 27 articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Chapter II (Arts. 6-8) regards state regulation and control in the sphere of natural monopolies. Chapter III (Arts. 9-14) regards bodies of regulation of natural monopolies, their functions and plenary powers. Chapter IV (Arts. 15-20) establishes liability for the infringement of the present Federal Law. Chapter V (Arts. 21-25) regards the modalities of decision-making (orders) to the bodies regulating natural monopolies, as well as the modalities of their execution and appeal against them. Chapter VI (Arts.26-27) lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Regulations of Sichuan Province on  Administration of Agricultural Machinery.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to strengthen the management of agricultural machinery, and protect the legitimate rights and interests of the owners, operators and users of agricultural machinery. The Text consists of 49 Articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Agricultural Machinery Scientific Research, Extension, Education and Training (II); Commercialized Services (III); Business Operation and Management (IV); Quality Supervision (V);  Safety Supervision and Management (VI);  Legal Responsibility (VII); Supplementary Provisions (VIII). Policy: Land Use Planning and Building Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to use the soil in a rational and efficient way, to conserve natural living conditions, as well as the beauty of the landscape. It regulates the requirements for buildings and plants with a view to ensure the proper use of land, as well as the beauty, safety and hygiene, of the environment including the protection of nature and cultural heritage. The interests of the population and of the local economy shall be taken in due consideration. According to article 10, local development plans shall envisage building and non building zones; the latter shall be destined to agricultural land, protected areas, waste deposits, recreational areas, etc. The text consists of 116 articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Planning (II); Development (III); Building regulations (IV); Implementation (VI); Regulations as to proceedings; (VII); Transitional and final provisions (VIII).

Policy: British Virgin Islands Ports Authority Regulations, 1995 (S.I. No. 27 of 1995).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the British Virgin Islands Ports Authority Act with respect to control of ports and navigation, the handling of dangerous goods, the pollution of territorial waters and the licensing of coastal crafts (excluding canoes and open boats used solely for the purpose of fishing). Fishing from a harbour shall be prohibited without a  permission of the Managing Director of the Ports Authority. Discharge or deposit of any pollutants in the territorial waters is prohibited. The Managing Director may exclude from the territorial waters a vessel whose general condition or the state of whose cargo in his/her opinion  constitutes a threat to the marine environment and may order the master or person in charge of a vessel whose general condition or the state or whose cargo in his/her opinion constitute a threat to the marine environment to take whatever action necessary to ensure the removal of that vessel from the harbour.

Policy: Response Organizations and Oil Handling Facilities Regulations (SOR/95-405).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact paragraph 657(1) (f) of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to procedures, equipment and resources of response organizations and oil handling facilities for use in respect of an oil pollution incident. Section 3 establishes that a response organization shall demonstrate in its response plan that the response organization has the capability to comply with the requirements relating to the procedures, equipment and resources prescribed in section 4 in respect of its geographical area. Paragraph 2 of this section lists also the information which a response plan shall include. Furthermore, such a response plan must take into account any contingency plan for its geographical area that is issued by the Canadian Coast Guard. The text consists of 19 sections divided into 2 Parts as follows: Response organization (I); Oil handling facilities (II). One Schedule is enclosed.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water

Policy: Decree No. 699 of 1995 of Moscow Government regarding the improvement of the system of licensing on the territory of the city of Moscow.
Policy_Content: Moscow Government, taking into consideration that the purpose of the system of licensing is to ensure the protection of citizens against direct negative impact on their physical and moral state on the part of private enterprises and the prevention of penetration on market of the undertakings that carry out illegal, unqualified and injurious to human health activity as well as in order to exclude bureaucratic interests for the maintenance of monopolistic positions on city market, decrees as follows: 1). Moscow Licensing Chamber is the only authorized governmental institution entitled to issue licences for the types of activity subject to licensing by the Regional Executive Bodies. 2). To validate the list of activities subject to licensing (Annex 1). 3). To validate the Regulation on licensing of some types of activity on the territory of the city of Moscow. (Annex 2). 4). To entitle Moscow Licensing Chamber to represent Moscow Government in the process of entering into contract with Federal Executive Bodies as regards joint licensing of some types of activity and delegation of plenary powers to Federal Executive Bodies for the types of activity belonging to their sphere of competence in accordance with the legislation currently in force. The list of activities subject to licensing by Moscow Licensing Chamber includes: 1). Retail trade of spirits and beer. 2). Wholesale trade of beer. 3). Production, trade and distribution of foodstuffs for public catering. 4). Trade of foodstuffs. 5). Harvest and trade of raw materials extracted from herbs (except for species recorded in the Red Book). 6). Land use planning and prospecting. 7). Organization of sporting and artisanal fishing and harvest of precious fish, aquatic animals and plants. 8). Trade of tobacco. 9). Production, storage and wholesale trade of ethyl alcohol. 10). Production, bottling, storage and wholesale trade of spirits.

Policy: Décret n° 95-1474 du 14 août 1995, portant désignation de  l'autorité  compétente  en  matière  de  contrôle technique à l'importation et à l'exportation des produits de la pêche d'agréage des locaux.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret énonce les missions du Ministère de l'Agriculture, et concrètement la Direction Générale de la Production Animale, en tant que responsable pour le produits de la pêche. Notamment, il est chargé:  du contrôle technique à l'importation et à l'exportation des produits de la pêche; du contrôle des conditions sanitaires de production, de préparation, de traitement, de transformation, de conditionnement, d'entreposage, de transport et d'expédition appliquées aux produits de la pêche; de l'octroi de l'agrément sanitaire aux établissements de préparation, de transformation, de réfrigération, de congélation, de conditionnement et d'entreposage des produits de la pêche et de l'aquaculture; de l'agrément des procédés physiques ou chimiques servant à la purification des mollusques bivalves vivants; et de veiller au respect des normes de salubrité des produits de la pêche destinés à la consommation humaine.

Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 1116 on “Rehabilitation of damaged land and conservation of fertile layer of soil."
Policy_Content: This Governmental Resolution determines that: (a) land that has lost fertile soil due to technogenic activities shall be considered as damaged; (b) landowners and users of public land, as well as other natural and legal persons performing works involving damage to the land must protect the harvested crop soil layer and use it for the reclamation of damaged land or for low agricultural productivity to improve land use; (c) natural and legal persons operating mineral deposits and peatlands that perform geological prospecting, exploration, construction and other work related to fertilization of land in case of damage to the soil layer, must rehabilitate damaged agricultural land and forested land and, if this is not technically possible, to use them for water reservoirs. Data on damaged land shall be inserted in State Land Cadastre.

Policy: Loi nº 34-94 relative à la limitation du morcellement des propriétés agricoles situées à l'intérieur des périmètres d'irrigation et des périmètres de mise en valeur en bour promulgué par le dahir nº 1-95-152 du 11 août 1995.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte limitation du morcellement des propriétés agricoles situées à l'intérieur des périmètres d'irrigation et des périmètres de mise en valeur en bour délimités. Dans les périmètres d'irrigation, la superficie minimum d'exploitation est fixée à 5 hectares; à l'extérieur elle doit être suffisante pour dégager un revenu permettant de rémunérer deux travailleurs agricoles. Font exception les morcellements pour la création ou l'extension d'entreprises non agricoles et en cas d'expropriation pour cause d'utilité publique. La loi fixe aussi le régime applicable aux immeubles en indivision ou en copropriété et les cas d'infractions.

Policy: Federal Act amending the Forestry Act.
Policy_Content: The amendment of the above-mentioned Act (BGBl. No. 440/1975) concerns article 45(2), which reads as follows: "The detailed regulations are to be issued by the Federal Minister of Agriculture and Forestry being empowered to dispose wood which is affected or threatened by forest pest. Moreover it is established that: (a) affected wood has to be felled; (b) that storage of diseased wood also outside the forest is allowed only if the affected wood has been treated with chemical substances; and (c) that all relevant details of imported wood have to be reported to the competent local authority and d) that for the official examination of wood processing plants a fee has to be paid". Moreover, article 46 together with its title is deleted.

The aforementioned Committee will prepare a report to the Ministry of Justice related to its operations (art. 6).

Policy: Joint Decree No.1 of 1995 of the Ministry of Environment, the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Agriculture and Food regarding validation of the Regulation on Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: The Ministers decree to validate the Regulation that shall set forth the terms and procedure for the environmental impact assessment (EIA) for the projects, facilities and activities under Article 20, and Paragraph 9 of the Environmental Protection Act. Subject to EIA shall be: 1. National and regional development investment programmes; 2. Territorial development plans and general urban development plans and their modifications; 3. Construction and regulation plans and their modifications providing for changes in the functional designation of construction of plants and facilities set forth in Annexes 1 and 2 to the Environmental Protection Act, as well as construction designs related to changes in the functional designation of lands in the agricultural and forest funds by plants and facilities set forth in Annexes 1 and 2 to the Environmental protection Act; 4. Designs for new facilities and designs for expansion or reconstruction with changes in the functional designation of the facilities set forth under Annexes 1 and 2 of the Environmental Protection Act; 5. Operating facilities set forth in Annexes 1 and 2 to the Environmental Protection Act; 6. Facilities subject to privatisation or restitution. Upon motivated proposals from the competent authorities, subject to EIA may also be other plants and facilities apart from those set forth under paragraph 1. The document consists of 7 Chapters that contain 17 Articles and 3 Annexes. Chapter 1 lays down the general provisions. Chapter 2 determines EIA procedures. Chapter 3 regards EIA documentation. Chapter 4 deals with public discussion of EIA results. Chapter 5 concerns decision-making on the EIA. Chapter 6 concerns control of decision. Chapter 7 lays down transitional and conclusive provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.077/95 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 5.804 sobre conservación del sistema ecológico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación de la Ley Nº 5.804 sobre expropriación de terrenos para la conservación del sistema ecológico. En particular, establece las pautas de manejo a aplicar a las acciones y emprendimientos a desarrollar en el área delimitada por dicha Ley. El título II del presente Decreto (arts. 4º-35) introduce normas de zonificación y sobre el uso de los terrenos. Estos últimos se distinguen en permitidos, restringidos y prohibidos.

Policy: Order No. 39 of the Ministry of Emergencies and Protection of the Population against the Chernobyl Disaster validating the Regulation on the State Radiation and Ecological Polesie Reserve.
Policy_Content: The Polesie Reserve has been set up in the estrangement zone for the purpose of carrying out the complex arrangements for the prevention of spreading of radioactive nuclides outside the contamination zone, conservation of the ecological balance of natural ecosystems, radiation and environmental monitoring of flora and fauna, radiobiological nature management and environmental protection. Land of the Polesie Reserve shall be considered of environmental importance. Activity aimed at the ensuring radiation safety of the territory, environmental protection arrangements and scientific research shall be authorized on the territory of the Polesie Reserve. The Polesie Reserve shall carry out the following functions: 1) prevention of spreading of radioactive nuclides; 2) protection of territory in conformity with the functional zoning; 3) forest fire protection and pest management; 4) ecosystem conservation; 5) radiation control. Permanent residence of the population, unauthorized stay of persons and timber rafting shall be prohibited on the territory of the Polesie Reserve.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: This Resolution establishes the general principles for environmental policy in order to improve the quality of life in Mozambique and to protect its environment. Policy: Nuclear Safety and Radiation Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Nigerian Nuclear Regulatory Authority and its Governing Board and the National Institute of Radiation Protection and Research. It also provides for the control of ionizing radiation and the exploration, etc. of materials containing radioactive substances and the packing and transportation of radioactive material and radioactive waste. The Nigerian Nuclear Regulatory Authority shall be charged with the responsibility for nuclear safety and radiological protection regulation in Nigeria. The Act requires registration of premises where sources of ionizing radiation are kept. It also provides that no person shall produce or market any consumer product containing radioactive substances without licence issued by the Authority.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 775 validating the Regulation on licensing of certain activities related to subsoil exploration and management.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree applies to the licensing of exploration of subsoil and well sinking (except for thermal water) to national and foreign legal and natural persons. A separate licence shall be issued for each type of activity, but one legal or natural person may hold several licences. Licences shall be non-transferable. Applicants shall submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) copy of statutory documents; (c) copy of state registration of enterprise; (d) receipt for payment of fee; (e) tax inspection registration certificate; and (f) availability of technical equipment and technological capacity. Licences shall be issued for each specific activity and shall have a minimum duration of three years.

Policy: Décret nº 95-1420 fixant les règles d'organisation, de fonctionnement et les modes d'intervention du fonds de développement de la compétitivité dans les secteurs de l'agriculture, de la pêche et des industries agro-alimentaires.
Policy_Content: Le fonds de développement de la compétitivité dans les secteurs de l'agriculture, de la pêche et des industries agro-alimentaires a été institué par l'article 45 de la loi nº 94-127 portant loi des finances pour la gestion 1994. Ce décret spécifie les activités constituant l'objet du fonds, à savoir: financer les activités et les programmes des groupements interprofessionnels (notamment, les dépenses de fonctionnement et d'équipement et l'intervention pour la stabilisation des produits agricoles, agro-alimentaires et de la pêche) et les études sectorielles et stratégiques. Il est créé une commission consultative chargée de proposer le programme d'intervention du fonds et d'en assurer le suivi et l'évaluation ainsi que de donner son avis sur l'octroi du concours du fonds. Le décret indique aussi quelles sont les ressources et les modalités de gestion du fonds.

Ce texte comprend 40 articles divisés en 7 chapitres. Le chapitre 1er contient les dispositions générales. Les fonctionnaires et employés de l'administration s'appliquent à protéger tant la nature que les ressources et milieux naturels, à conserver et à restaurer les paysages et sites naturels et à améliorer les ressources cynégétiques et piscicoles, etc. Les instructions pour les préposés forestiers affectés à un triage forestiers sont prévues par le chapitre II. Le préposé forestier est soumis à l'autorité immédiat du chef de cantonnement ou de son délégué. Le chapitre III concerne les instructions pour les préposés et cantonniers affectés aux services de la Conservation de la Nature et au service de la Chasse et de la Pêche. Policy: Regional Law No. 5-z "On protected areas".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, conservation and management of protected areas with a view of ensuring landscape and ecological sustainability, conservation and protection of unique and model ecosystems, wild fauna and wild flora species, genetic fund thereof, and ecological education of the population. Protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) state nature reserves, including biosphere reserves; (b) national parks; (c) natural parks; (d) state nature reserves; (e) nature monuments; (f) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; (g) healthcare areas and spas; and (h) green belts of inhabited areas. All protected areas shall be taken into consideration in the process of elaboration of land-use planning schemes.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 193/95 establishing principles and norms to which cartographic production must obey in the national territory.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 20 articles establishes principles and norms to which cartographic production must obey in the national territory. These provisions apply to all cartography, topography and thematic maps, except the classified cartography of the Army. The State, through the Minister of Planning and Territorial Administration, is responsible for defining technical standards in the field of cartographic production and reproduction as follows: a) ensure, through the competent public bodies and services, the coverage of the territory with topographic mapping at 1: 10000 and lower scales and hydrographic mapping at 1: 5000 and lower scales, as well as their updates; b) ensure the production and maintenance of thematic cartography legally assigned to public bodies and services. Any entity may produce cartography or carry out activities in the field of cartographic production provided that it is authorized by law. This Decree-Law creates the Cartography Coordinating Council, under the Ministry of Planning and Territorial Administration. This Council is the coordinating body for the activity of public bodies and services legally competent to produce cartography. Offences and penalties are appended to the text.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 557 regarding validation of the regulation on the modalities of classification of forests by groups, by categories of protection and selection of especially protected plots of forest land.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes common rules of classification of forests by groups, by categories of protection and selection of especially protected plots of forest land. The forests of Ukraine shall be sub-divided by ecological and economic requirements into the first group and other groups. Forests carrying out important environment protection functions as well as forests of protected areas, forests of scientific or historical importance (including genetic reserves), forest fruit plantations, subalpine trees and bush plantations shall be classified as first group forests. Forests that are not classified as first group forests, forests meeting ecological requirements and forests destined for timber extraction shall be classified as other group forest. Regime of restricted forest management shall be applied to this group of forests for the purpose of conservation of protective functions, continuity and inexhaustibility of forest management. The document consists of 4 Sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards offences and examination of applications as regards classification of forests by groups, by categories of protection and selection of especially protected plots of forest land. Section 3 establishes the conditions for the classification of forests by groups, by categories of protection and selection of especially protected plots of forest land. Section 4 regards especially protected plots of forest land.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Classification/declassification,Protected area,Protection forest,Recreational forest,Timber extraction/logging,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 555 regarding validation of Sanitary forest requirements.
Policy_Content: Sanitary forest requirements is the totality of norms regulating sanitary and rehabilitation arrangements and sanitary requirements established for the purpose of protection of forests in the process of forest management, use of forest resources and carrying out work not related to forest management, entrepreneurship, institutional activity and citizens. The Regulation consists of 10 Sections. Section 1 establishes sanitary and rehabilitation requirements. Section 2 regards selective sanitary felling. Section 3 regards total sanitary felling. Section 4 regards liquidation of hang-up. Section 5 regards prevention of the origin and spreading of locuses of forest pests and disease. Section 6 regards protection of timber stock against pests and disease. Section 7 establishes sanitary requirements for carrying out main use felling, sanitary felling and other types of felling. Section 8 establishes sanitary requirements as regards resin boxing and procurement of arboreal sap. Section 9 establishes sanitary requirements for the forests of important sanitary and hygienic and recreational functions. Section 10 establishes state control over observance of sanitary forest requirements and establishes liability for the infringement thereof.

Policy: Pollutant Discharge Reporting Regulations, 1995 (SOR/95-351).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact sections 657 and 658 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to the reporting of discharges or probable discharges of pollutants. For the purpose of the present Regulations “waters under Canadian jurisdiction" means: a) Canadian waters, and b) the exclusive economic zone of Canada described in section 13 of the Oceans Act. The Regulations apply in respect of Canadian ships in all waters and in respect of ships other than Canadian ships in waters under Canadian jurisdiction, including a shipping safety control zone prescribed under subsection 11(1) of the Arctic Waters Pollution Prevention Act. Section 5 establishes that the master of a ship shall report any discharge of a pollutant from the ship that occurs or the probability that such a discharge will occur, where the discharge is prohibited by the Act, the Arctic Waters Pollution Prevention Act or regulations made under these Acts. The text consists of 6 sections.

Policy: Loi nº 95-73 relative au domaine public maritime.
Policy_Content: Cette loi fixe les dispostions principales relatives au domaine public maritime, composé par le domaine public maritime naturel et par celui artificiel. Ce domaine doit être délimité par rapport aux propriétés riveraines; cette délimitation est confiée à une commission spéciale, dont la composition et fonctionnement seront fixés par décret, et sera effectuée selon les critères et les modalité prévus au chapite II de cette loi. Les terrains limitrophes au domaine public maritime sont gravés des servitudes prévues au chapitre III. Ce domaine est ilaniélable, imprescriptible et donne lieu à des utilisations communes et privatives, ces dernières sous forme soit d'occupation temporaire soit de concession. Policy: Water Resources Act of 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 23 articles divided in 6 Chapters aims at reforming the organization of the Nile and Non-Nilotic surface waters as well as the groundwater, hence superseding the Law of 1939 that was limited to the Nile waters only. The Law establishes the National Council for Water Resources (NCWR) with the following main tasks (i)  design and rationalize the management and use of water resources to mitigate the effects of natural disasters resulting from drought and floods, to protect these resources from pollution and degradation and to develop them in an integrated and balanced manner with the other natural resources; (ii) develop a long-term national program for the optimal and balanced use of water resources; (iii) propose and review the legislation related to water resources; (iv) supervise the withdrawal of water from the Nile, non-Nile waters and other rivers and groundwater for the purposes of irrigation, drinking, industry, hydro-power generation and sanitation; (v) issue permits to withdraw water from the Nile, or other non-Nile waters, or groundwater; (vi) The allocate specific quantities of surface or underground water; (vii) distribute the available quantity water for fair use; and (viii) organize the drilling of deep surface wells.

Individuals and corporations intending to carry out activities relating to petroleum operations are required by law to apply to the minister and provide background details as required. The Regulations further require contractors carrying out petroleum operations to always act in accordance with generally accepted practices in the international petroleum industry. Policy: Rating Act 1995 (No. 4 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The competent local authority shall make, assess and levy a general rate each financial year upon all immovable property according to the provisions of Part I of the Schedule. Each rate shall be made, levied and assessed on immovable property on the basis of the valuation of the land and improvements thereon. Section 7 establishes the cases in which immovable property shall be exempted from the payment of rates. Part III of the Act describes the procedure, methods and criteria to be taken into account for the valuation of the land. The local authority may issue a notice, to be published in the Official Gazette, for the following purposes: (a) setting the amount of the rate to be paid; (b) appointing a date on which such rate shall become due and payable; (c) stating that the penalty will become payable in respect of any rate remaining unpaid after the expiry of two months from the date appointed under paragraph (b). Further provisions concern: (a) liability for rates; (b) penalty for late payment of rates; (c) recovery of rate; (d) legal proceedings for recovery of rates; (e) certificate for transfer of immovable property. The Act is completed by one Schedule containing the list of areas to which the Act applies.

Policy: Agreement of Long Kone Quarter on the Natural Resources Use Management.
Policy_Content: This Agreement regulates the allocation and use of natural resources in the villages concerned. To this end it provides for the establishment of the following forest areas: (a) Prohibited Forest Areas, in which the cutting of trees, the harvesting of forest products or hunting of animals is strictly forbidden; (b) Reserved Forest Areas, in which the exploitation of forests and forest products must be performed according to a plan in order to ensure their proper use and conservation; (c) Allowed Forests Using Areas, which may be exploited by the population of the villages. Said areas are divided into two categories: (a) Forests to be used for daily existence (agricultural production, planting and livestock), and (b) Forests to be used for production and shifting cultivation. Furthermore, the Agreement establishes measures against freshwater and potable water pollution and makes a list of prohibited wildlife.

Policy: Loi n°95-70, du 17 juillet 1995, relative à la conservation des eaux et du sol, telle que modifiée par la loi n°2004-24 du 15 mars 2004.
Policy_Content: Cette loi a pour objet la conservation des zones menacées par l'érosion hydrique, l'érosion éolienne et l'ensablement. Les travaux de conservation des eaux et des sols, menés par des actions de lutte anti-érosive, sont mis en oeuvre dans le cadre de périmètres d'intervention selon des plans d'aménagement. Chaque périmètre comprend un bassin versant principal ou secondaire des oueds. Les travaux de conservation des eaux et des sols peuvent être déclarés d'utilité publique dans les cas où l'administration constate: une menace d'érosion hydrique ou éolienne des terres agricoles; un envasement accéléré des retenues des barrages ou des lacs colinéaires; des risques de dégradation des infrastructures et des agglomérations urbaines par l'effet des inondations et des glissements de terrains. Le ministre de l'agriculture délimite, par arrêté, les terres où les travaux de labour et de plantation doivent s'effectuer en courbes de niveau et les autres travaux de façon à ne pas empêcher l'écoulement naturel des eaux; il fixe aussi les zones où certains outils ou techniques sont interdits. Sont aussi réglementés et, le cas échéant, interdits le pacage et l'exploitation des plantations arboricoles, arbustives ou herbacées, des cours d'eau et de leurs francs bord végétalisés. Les propriétaires et les exploitants agricoles sont tenus à ne pas empêcher l'exécution des travaux de conservation et l'activité des agents compétents pour la mise en oeuvre et le contrôle des plans d'aménagement, mais ils ont droit à une indemnité compensatrice s'il subsiste une privation totale de jouissance. La loi porte aussi création d'organismes au niveau national, régional et local pour la conservation des eaux et des sols. Il s'agit notamment du conseil national, des groupements régionaux et des associations créées à l'intérieur de chaque périmètre. Ces dernières, ainsi que les propriétaires ou les exploitants agricoles, peuvent bénéficier de l'encouragement de l'Etat au développement de l'agriculture pour la réalisation, l'achèvement ou l'extension des travaux de conservation des eaux et des sols. Le dernier chapitre de cette loi est consacré aux sanctions prévues pour les infractions aux dispositions de la loi même.
